wnc9RDEhEYcSYUWv9MIAwA.text: Overall this restaurant is great. The menu is thick of options ranging from crafted cocktails to juicy steaks and fresh salads.  The venue is similar to a French bistro. Very open yet intimate. Diners have the option to sit on the patio, in restaurant or at the bar.  We ordered artichoke dip for appetizer, a steak and salmon salad for lunch and shared a milkshake for dessert. Dip- it's a generous portion but you're going to need more crustini. Ask for more! Steak- order your cooked preference 1 degree higher. We typically like our meats at medium- rare, but it will cone out bleeding. Their medium-rare is a True rare. Comes with a huge bowl of potatoes and asparagus.  Salmon salad- Salmon is cooked deliciously and Romain is tossed in a sherry dressing. Nice and light for a warm day. Milkshake- amazing! Rich and large enough to share. There are so many options but we ordered the very berry.

FPCw7Cn8skU5GzhdHfyjSA.text: We came to see what the Instagram hype was all about.   We ordered drinks 35$ a piece for somewhat 60 oz drinks.  They did taste pretty good. We also ordered appetizers which tastes great. We got a free Nutella pizza no one wanted but had a ton of peanut butter. No one complained about it but does anyone complain about free food?  Overall it was an okay place, would def go back to order entrees.

8-fLzkUe5EEfyfZm0N35TA.text: Sugar Factory is an ok experience. The food lacked flavor. The service started out great but gets noticeably bad the last 75% of your time there. The music is really loud. The tables are small while the plates are huge- my friend had to put her plate in her lap because there was no where else on the dinky table. The prices for the Goblets are high so look for check in deals on Yelp and other voucher websites or skip them altogether. I'd go back with the realization that their Happy Hour sucks.   We went after reading about the happy hour and what a rip-off. I'd have been more pleased if the Goblets were 50% off- end of story. Inside the server said buy one Goblet and get select apps for $3. I figured it was a great deal and thought you could choose 2 or 3 apps for $3 each, I mean the Goblet is the price of an entree at dinner for goodness sake. Well you could only choose ONE app at that price PER Goblet. I chose the burger thinking I was getting a great deal. Not so much. The burger came out and it was honest to goodness the size of a slider! It was not as others have posted pictures of who went earlier when the restaurant first opened. They honestly thought I was going to pay $3 for that little thing. The server, while nice and all smiles, failed to mention that. I'm not a greedy person but these servers should learn how to describe what they are selling their patrons.   I sent the slider back and ordered a burger. The table next to us suffered the same fate and they sent their little slider back too and asked for a traditional sized sandwich which is $13. That burger didn't arrive for 20 minutes. Three people walked by and kept saying "itll be right out". I wasn't in a hurry, but at a certain point you start to notice. The burger arrived and it was cooked medium (noticeably pink in the middle) so I'm not sure what took so long to cook it. lt looked great and juicy but it lacked ANY and ALL seasoning. It was bland as shit and there was no salt in sight. Even with the crispy onions strings they didn't help.  The Goblet was great but you'd get sticker shock if they listed the price of them on the menu in fact they don't list the price for ANY of their drinks. I despise sneaky restaurants that do that. You have to ask the server and it becomes a talking point when it shouldn't be. $39 for a drink is not chump change for any time of the day. On top of that they ran out of all citrus fruits at the bar- no lemons for the water, no limes for the vodka soda and no lemons for my $39 Iced Tea Vodka drink. The server had the audacity to bring over 1 (One) sad lemon slice from the end of a lemon with all the white pith on a big plate. It wasn't enough juice in that thing to squeeze a drop in a thimble. During dinner a server walks in from the back with bags of citrus fruits from the local grocery store. Who is running this operation? Get it together.  Towards the end of the meal, as usual, the server disappears and we have to ask random people and managers to bring us our check.This has become an annoying part of dining out lately. You'll get great service at the start and then it tapers off dramatically to no service at all- then they hoover over you to leave a 20% tip, but were absent the last 75% of the meal. Oddly they don't even have check presenters here. Everything is ordered and check is presented on a ipad style device. Its quick, but we never were presented with a itemized bill when they swiped our credit card or after the charge was processed. Its best to ask for a bill BEFORE paying and keep a tally of the charges.

A3I7LxhCrgdTCTcEnNTp-g.text: So yummy! The drinks were pricey, and not a lot of alcohol, but still good! I had the raspberry watermelon  mojito which was delish!!!

Vo4HeBYrVCH5w3frzEZDGQ.text: Me and my fiance came here for our birthday because we heard so much about this place. I see it so much on social media and I really wanted to come here for our third time in Vegas. When we arrived it was a bit confusing there's not really a "host" you see while inside but eventually someone approached us and seated us. The cool big drinks are all $40. We ordered "The Drake" which tasted really good but was missing the candy peaches that was suppose to be inside. We ended up having to go to the bartender to ask for them. There is a ton of ice in the big drinks so you basically are there just for the experience which is nice but for $40 a big drink I'd like a little less ice for what I'm paying for. Our waiter was a bit rude and never checked on us. At the end the hype of this place is more for a cool snap or insta video, but it was cool how the dry ice is with the drinks. Our total experience was a 3/5.

Xve2UnhMSI24mfynGJRhjA.text: Came here for my cousins 30th birthday and when I tell you the customer service was amazing I mean it! Rudi was phenomenal! Literally the best server I have ever had! He went above and beyond to make sure our experience was great!! My cousin had the best time here .. way more than what we were expecting! If you busy this place make sure Rudi helps you!

WFEyVFbd-sR_PU_-y8HTAA.text: I have been to a few Sugar Factory locations on the Las Vegas strip but I have to say the service at this location was subpar and slow.  The waiter seemed too preoccupied and not vested in his job.  Over the past decade, I have enjoyed eating at the Sugar Factory due to the vast menu and creative presentation but tonight I left sad and disappointed.  I made a reservation about two months in advance on opentable and checked in at the front but I received an email about an hour later suggesting that I missed the reservation.  Service tonight was slow and not personable.  We celebrated a 21st birthday here tonight and she was carded but her birthday was not acknowledged.  Moreover I noted her 21st birthday when I made the reservation yet no one came by to say "happy birthday."  The food and beverages were mediocre and nothing to rave about for the price.  I give two stars for atmosphere and presentation but nothing more.

S-x6Lrnqela40X5lyUuQ0Q.text: I was hesitant coming here because of the reviews. There were few complaints about the customer service, but idk what they're talking about? The service is great here! Our server was Emon and he was so nice and cheerful! We loved him!! He wasn't as attentive but when he stopped by, he always had a smile on his face!   The big drinks that are really popular here are about $38. We got the Berry Bliss and my boyfriend and I couldn't finish it. Only half way. So I would say the portion is good for at least 2-3 people. I didn't think it was worth the price. It's just a really carbonated drink with some jelly inside. And there were only a few pieces of the jelly... it was probably that particular one but idk. The other drinks looked good as well but it's just carbonated drink with jelly. Some with candy! They're available with or without alcohol. Then we got the banana split (sundae for 2)! That was $16 and totally worth the price. The size portion is perfect and so good!!! I totally recommend that sundae. It's so good. I would come back just for it haha.

Could not have better things to say about this place. We went for my sister's birthday and it made for a very special birthday dinner! Sugar Factory is a must try if you're in Vegas!!!

Tried the mai tai goblet and was pretty tipsy by the end of it. Didn't feel it creeping up cause it was very delicious. Sydney was amazing!!! Her service was probably one of the best we had on the strip. Made up for the price and I'd probably come back just to get that service again. Wings were good but ask for them to be well done the skin wasn't crispy enough for my liking. They have a good portion, 8... the pic I attached looked less because I had eaten some already and didn't want to show the bones. The spinach dip sucked. Don't order it if your a fan  of spinach dips. Overall, I would definitely come back. And certainly recommend it if it's your first time.

wmUjTZZ_Uu3YF_vz0UpbKQ.text: Very cute and trendy place I was absolutely impressed by all the desserts, drinks, and milkshakes they offered! Everything looked absolutely yummy! I went here on a Saturday night and it wasn't too busy, and I was pleasantly surprised my boyfriend and I got seated right away. It's very fun atmosphere for a great group of friends or a cute birthday dinner! My boyfriend and I split the steak (which was amazing) so we could have room for dessert and it was well worth it of course. My only two problems I had was that the music was waaayyyy too loud. I could barely hear our waitress, I felt like I had to yell for her to hear me, let alone my boyfriend who was only right across from me. My other problem was that the restaurant felt very cramped, I felt like I was sitting at the same table with the people next to me when we first got seated and that's just too close for me personally, but they reseated us very quickly so I'm happy for that.

However, the food was extremely subpar and the service was very slow. We constantly felt like they had forgotten about us. I shared the turkey burger with my friend which was good, but nothing crazy. The fries were nice and crispy. Their bruschetta was very yummy, but only came with 4 small pieces and was very expensive. Overall, the taste did not justify the prices.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8B6LWbQM-HjLWAycrxSFgw.text: Let me just start by saying "we were like 2 big kids at the candy store!!!" Lol Hubs and I could not leave Vegas without strolling down to the Sugar Factory. We stayed in the Trump Hotel so it was a very short walking distance for us. We went around 11 because the the crowd packed in shortly after so I was grateful we went early. We decided to try the Sugar Factory Club with Fries. We were also supposed to have an order of onion rings but our server either forgot to add it or the kitchen just forgot to deliver them to the table because we inquired about then twice before just saying screw it. Now on to the sandwich.... It was delicious with the avacado and herb mayo and the fries were very warm... They not piping how like I imagined them. Now on to our drink... We shared a Mai Tai with 3-4 different rums and it was simply fruity and delicious. A very wonderful experience. My hubby was very disappointed that he was not able to get a Couture Pop (his main reason for going to the Sugar Factory) but he just kept it kicking. Overall good experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. SF Club with Fries

mps48fQ3Os5MAWhjHPKhtA.text: I came here to try one of their famous dry ice goblet drinks around 10pm on Monday and man was the Lollipop Passion one Soooo good. It tasted like green apples. The presentation of the drink was worth the money spent. It had enough alcohol to leave you tipsy but not over powering to get you sloppy. I would definitely come back to try the food as I only came for the drinks. Friendly staff and GREAT music. They played some early 2000's R&B. Keep up the good work!

H0eTrDdjexvAOp7dt1iPWQ.text: Okay spot for sweet treats right on the strip. We came in on a Sunday afternoon and we must have picked a really bad time because I guess they were having a shift change and we didn't get to order for almost 25 minutes after looking through our menu. Our server walked past our table multiple times and didn't even make eye contact, and then when he finally came back he brought a female server with him and told us they're having a shift change and she will be our server now. It didn't make sense because even after we finally ordered our food and drinks and started on them after everything arrived, we saw him walking around within the restaurant and serving other tables and still working??  Anyways.. the food is mediocre. I'd only come back for the drinks. Things are overpriced for the quality but it is Vegas and it is a spot right on the strip so its expected. Their chocolate shake, I forgot the exact name, was really good. The Buffalo Chicken sandwich and Turkey Club we ordered was prepared fresh and a good sized serving, but we didn't find it to be anything spectacular. It was good but not as good as what some others hyped it up to be. Like I said, only come here for drinks and you'll have a good time. They have a lot of cool, interesting drinks with lots of candy and chocolate options and you can even make your own.

D5BBbYm3pHQ-t5BCB9qNJA.text: I'm so late with my review...oops  This place was so cool! The decor looked amazing. The staff was so helpful and nice. They have a large menu and our waiter helped us make the best choice for lunch. We ordered the rainbow sliders, aka pretty patties , with onion rings and goblet drinks. Oh yeah..those goblet drinks are amazing!!!  I also ended my lunch with the largest ice cream cone EVER! It had everything on it....cotton candy, pop rocks,Gum balls, candy necklace, etc.  I will definitely be back soon!

D8w2Z3hrEPcJUFzD70uTVg.text: Excellent atmosphere and broad menu selection; however service was a bit slow. Birthday desert presentation fun and festive. Overall great app experience.

SJE1HTCQOpSENo4nEoQQ0Q.text: Amazing fun place. The food and drinks are definitely worth the price. You can also get your goblets drinks to go!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fettuccine Alfredo taken up another level

XvHYe19tJeHrKCwEYm7SYQ.text: First off let me start by saying I have dined here twice before and had great service but the service that I received on 10/6/18 was ATROCIOUS.   We can in around 6pm, asked for a table for 3 inside and that we wouldn't mind waiting because it was FREEZING outside, weather showed around 60 degrees. At first the hostess said okay, and proceeded to take us inside. She then said the wait was 20 mins and "can't you just sit outside?" Taken aback, my group just agreed to sit outside since it was immediate seating.  Our waitress comes over right away and asks if we need any drinks, we just ask for water. About 10 mins later she came back with the water and asks if we were ready to order. We order 3 entrees and an appetizer. We then proceed to wait approximately 30 mins until we see our waitress again. Water glasses empty. All the while my party is FREEZING, there were no outside heaters expect for one that was located near the hostess stand. She says our food should be right out...but what about the appetizer.  Finally, 45 mins after ordering our food, a bus boy brings us our food along with the appetizer that should have came out before the meals. Our waitress then shows up to help with placing one meal down, I ask for silverware since we only had two setting at the table for a party of 3.....10 mins later I finally got my silverware. Obviously at this point my entire group is peeved that we've waited almost an HOUR to get our meals.  We finish eating around 7:20-7:30pm.....we wait.....and wait.... and wait.... finally around 7:50 we ask the hostess to find our waitress because we are cold, and ready to leave. We literally saw the hostess walk to our waitress, who was inside the nice warm restaurant and point to our table... our waitress walks to the back room. About 10 mins pass and I am FURIOUS its been 30 mins since we finished our meals, we want to leave and get out of the freezing cold!  My party gets up from the table to go inside and wait since at least it was warm in there. We then hear the hostess yell over their walkie talkie "YOU BETTER GET OUT HERE, THEY'RE GOING TO LEAVE WITHOUT PAYING!!!!"   Then, and ONLY then does out waitress magically appear with our check in hand. No apologies for the wait, no "how was the meal", nothing. In fact she hovered over us until we signed our check. Finally we can leave at 8:15pm, over 2 HOURS from when we got there. 2 HOURS in the cold outside. Also I would like to note that there were barely any other parties getting sat outside.  In all honesty, we SHOULD have just walked up and left considering this was the worst service I have EVER experienced in my LIFE. But I have dignity and will pay for my meal, hey I'll even leave our horrible waitress a small tip (I should have left her a big fat $0).  After this experience I know I won't be back here. Its unfortunate because I really enjoyed the atmosphere and service in the past. But I refuse to go back to a place that treated me so poorly. Fool me once, shame on you. Fool me twice? Not going to happen.

M73h3MW77an2uuUIDTcpvw.text: No Split!  Sugar Factory will forever remain one of the cutest places to celebrate special occasions with your best girlfriends and for that I'm grateful they've re-opened. Spending over $500 after tipping on top of gratuity for a "mediocre" dining experience is extremely disappointing (definitely not the hip-trendy-exceptional service they're known for)!    PROS: The Chocolate Lounge was extremely patient and sat majority of my squad while the remainder of the crew (8 total) were "tardy for the party" on a Saturday evening! (The restaurant was very slow upstairs to be honest)  CONS: We started off with hair in one of the 8 glasses of water. Small service failure but still unacceptable.   The Pacific Salmon $29 was very over cooked; not by request.   The spinach dip $15 was terrible. I wish I could compare it to something but I'd rather not. Just skip it and thank me later!  My friends salad didn't have one drop of dressing which was completely strange. (Of course we "found" the waiter to make it right).  I purchased The Drake $40 for obvious reasons! Y-O-L-O  Regrettably, it looked like swamp water? Total opposite of the photo! If Drake didn't change his number so frequent, I'd call him and get his thoughts on the situation! Of course I didn't drink it. The not so souvenir cup became a filthy looking photo opp for my out of town snap chat peeps! It's an additional $15 to keep the plastic "souvenir" cup can you believe that?! Total rip!  The icing is the new "no split" check policy that our server failed to share until the end. Everyone paying towards one bill with the option to receive separate receipts of payment is so backwards and took the server way more time to settle 8 payments.   Overall I'm uncertain if I'd return which is disheartening because I've been a SF fanatic since couture pops were on trend (that's a long damn time in Kardashian years)!   Totally five star worthy but not worth it this evening!!!

23sUQ2kulK6OsJvfQSuK3g.text: Ask for Jeremias He was kind and friendly and helped us out with our selection for being our first time here This is a definently a must stop place if you like sugar drinks with alcohol

OrHJkBfLFsCziUalL_WIGQ.text: Such a cute restaurant! I've been to the one in Orlando, FL before so nothing was a surprise. I had a Groupon for $40 toward our meal so I made sure that we stopped here. We got here at 7:30pm and it wasn't packed at all. We walked right in. You can make a reservation but you probably won't need it through the week. On the weekend, it's probably packed! Our server Manny was AMAZING! He was funny and he was very attentive! The service was perfect!  I order the caesar salad with shrimp and my boyfriend had a chicken sandwich and fries. Everything was delicious. But the thing to write about...the GOBLETS! I had the fuzzy peach mango and he had the gummy bear one. They are HUGE! It's about 2 1/2 drinks in just one goblet. They are very sweet with all the candy that's in them and they weren't very strong but they were still great. However, they are expensive! One goblet is $38 and you can't keep the goblet! That's kinda crazy if you ask me. The food isn't too bad price wise. My salad was $19. It can get loud in here...especially with the staff yelling when it's someone birthday and they deliver a dessert to the tables. Go and ask to sit in Manny's section!

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken sandwich...very juicy!
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar salad with shrimp

K8CSetmp5pME4JwVZ2JHNg.text: I DONT KNOW WHAT TO RATE THIS. BUT KEEP READING IF YOU JUST JUST A GOBLET!   we walked all the way over here for a goblet. The menu don't list how much the drinks are... which is a little weird.  Well goblets are $39. The other regular cocktails are $8  But be aware at this location YOU DONT GET TO KEEP the goblet!!!!!!!!!!! You have to pay an extra $15!!!! If you however go to the their other location you pay $39 and you get to keep the cup! But at the other location don't have have dry ice! At this location they gave dry ice and they make your drink all smoky and cool!!!   Other that that, the drinks are good. Sweet! But good! I got the watermelon mojito, it was delish!!! It had a ton of candy which is cute but really not necessary because we ended up throwing most away since we can't drink a lb of candy in one sitting. Good presentation tho!

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $39!

3r3TmbhbL97IJE2_8FXHMg.text: This was somewhere I always wanted to visit so I expected the price to be a bit high ($40 for one goblet to be exact). The staff was really nice but they seemed to be having some sort of meeting behind the bar so instead of taking our drink order (we were the only ones at the bar) the bartenders were reviewing some type of policy changes and safety regulations with the managers as we awkwardly sat there waiting for them to finish discussing what they could and couldn't do.   After we ordered the bartender we making our drinks as the manager was going thru all their supplies asking questions and telling them they couldn't do this or put that there, made me a little nervous as to what exactly I was drinking and how clean it was. Definitely not a discussion you should be having in front of paying patrons

nsQcXhnZetJgH3JbjmDCXg.text: Cool place! Second floor is Chocolate!! Sunday Brunch! Big choice of drinks, all with champagne! Cupcakes, chocolate fountain, waffles, music, outside dining (if you are in the mood,) great view of the Strip!

2slZgLgVeEM5XcID22OksA.text: This was the place we had my brother birthday dinner.  We were told it was lady's night on Thursday at the chocolate Lounge, which was find but didn't realize we could here anything but the music.  We had 15 people with us so most conversation was through text lol.  Very cute place.    Reason for getting a one star was the service.  Knowing the music was so loud why would you try to talk to me from across the table.  After ordering our food it had taken a good 35-40 for appetizers.  It wasn't busy.  Even for a house salad!  Come on now.  Everyone food didn't come out at the same time.  3 hours later and 20 minutes for the bill.  I was over it not worth $761.  We all wanted desserts but didn't want to wait another hour.    Making the reservations was hard enough to get through.  With one person telling me I had to go through a group with a set menu.  And another telling me we didn't.  Where is the communication?  For being on the Las Vegas strip you would think service would be on point.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. For that price and the service! No thank you.  No desserts

8zRFonkcCSluvJgxL6qE0g.text: Food was okay Ill admit Ive had a better burger at red robin. We specifically asked the girl if we got fifty percent off pf our sons thirty five dollar drink. We were told everything was fifty percent off and we brought it to her attention at check out and she had an attitude when I told her we were misinformed before we ordered. She said well I can get a manager with an extreme attitude. We declined and decided we wont come back in the future.

PgqZ3J1Ud_PRRRYhmOWXog.text: I miss the old sugar factory!!! This location needs help. Service was awful. We ordered a club so you really can't screw that up. Music was way too loud for a 1pm lunch. Our bus boy helped more than the waitress.

zdmQmO3p8dY-vtQL4RLX9A.text: We purchased the $40 worth of food for 2 on Groupon. The savory food is as good as the desserts. My husband said the Big Cheesy burger was worth the 20 bucks. The club was well-sacked with quality meat and cheese. We shared the Chocolate Blackout which was not too sweet, just rich chocolaty. The coffee is dark and rich and went well with the ice cream.

5V-N4WSub2tFPCGUNvmwfQ.text: I have always wanted to go to the sugar factory and of course it's EVERYTHING I imagined! We ordered a goblet (of course) and it was well worth the $40 not as sweet as it looks very strong and fun to look at...the children ordered a milkshake that was just as delicious and the staff was very friendly I would highly recommend to friends family and fellow yelpers

qb8uNTP_4FppSc-JGc6DDg.text: Okay so this has reopened in a new location and new menu.  When I first went when it was at Paris, it was great.  Then I went again under new owners and it was terrible.  Then it closed. Back in March my friend came to visit from NY and wanted desperately to come here.  I was skeptical but I figured it's a new location I will try it... It was really good. We all enjoyed our food, the menu is huge but a bit daunting.  We all bought candy at the adjoining store and a good time was had by all. We left full and happy.

WRTytlvxAdvBCtBwqvdTbg.text: I'm not the type of person to complain but last night i had a horrible experience at the sugar factory. It was my first time going to this location, but used to go to the other locations before it got closed down.  Last night i had this server that didn't even introduce his name or anything, also when i was about to order he just casually walked away when i was about to tell him what i wanted . He finally came back to the table 30 mins later and finally got my order. He was just very rude towards me and my friends. I'm a server/bartender so i understand the restaurant industry and how busy it can get. I just never had horrible customer service in my life before.   Also it took 1 hour to make a classic strawberry milkshake...

_QN4CtMZ_GhSlf_GeWuhAw.text: Went there with my mother-in-law and my husband and Jake was our server; he's absolutely a delight and made our experience one of a kind. The food is absolutely delicious and the customer service is impeccable. The drinks were fun and hit the spot especially for a girl with a serious sweet tooth. Thank you Sugar Factory and Jake for a truly sweet experience definitely will be back

fxe2ooLG1QPuQKnGPUQIDg.text: I loved the idea and novelty of this restaurant but was disappointed after dining here tonight.  The hostess was great and had us seated promptly. The waitress took a while to get to us, but no biggie - it's Vegas and it's on the strip. The food came out quickly but we were disappointed. The spaghetti and meatballs were overly salty, as were the fries, my tomato bisque was room temperature (at best) and by the time our milkshake and hot cocoa got to us we were about done with dinner. The small things we had asked for - extra parm cheese, and an extra cup took nearly 15 minutes to get after having a hard time flagging down our waitress and having to ask multiple times. The manager eventually came over and we said we needed more cheese and he said he'd take care of it. Either way, it was a long wait for those small items and I was trying not to make s big fuss. Giving them the benefit of the doubt, they were probably busy and doing their best. I still tipped $20 on a $110 bill but feel like I it wasn't worth it.... I even had a Groupon for $80 of it and still left disappointed...

-7CRwjX4yxGN2EklaNiVHg.text: I've never eaten the food at Sugar Factory but I have visited for their drinks. They have awesome goblet drinks that are full of candy and are super delicious! We ordered their lollipop passion goblet which is described on the menu as "a wonderful mix of melon, coconut and pineapple blended together to create a taste sensation no one will be able to resist! Garnished with lollipops" Our goblet came to the table and it is huge, I am glad the husband and I decided to share this drink. It had two huge rainbow lollipops and a candy necklace inside. The server pours our drink and we were surprised it had some kind of dry ice or something in it to make the drink bubble and smoke. (It was super neat) We had great service, the woman who took care of us was very attentive even though we only came in to order a drink to share. The drinks are expensive though and I wish I knew beforehand that yelp has a special. If you check in on yelp you get 50% off your goblet drink, which would have saved us at least $25, but you live and you learn! Next time I would for sure use the check in offer if it is still available.  Overall the drink was super refreshing and not too sweet. We will return. The decor of the restaurant is super cute, they have awesome looking food and great service.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This drink was so cute, love the yellow duck on the glass
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lollipop passion
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I loved the glass it came in

PWd5iGASdOunWOIYrd1zWw.text: Never disappoints! Love the dry ice bowls! A Vegas staple and a must-do for every tourist. Staff is friendly and service is great. Something different and a bit exotic! Recommend 100%!

dLHcDagtzYdhb4FRtNbPkg.text: Shopping at fashion show mall today and i had a groupon for Sugar Factory. Always heard and saw the amazing drinks so decided to give it a try.  The inside is super cute and trendy. Lots of chairs and tables for big groups or even smaller intimate party sizes. The menu is super huge with lots of choices so dont get too overwhelmed. Lots of colorful and fruity drinks for the overwhelming goblet sizes. We opted to share the Raspberry Watermelon Mojito ( it was okay wish i chose something else) if you check into Yelp you get any goblet drink for half off. Steal!!!!  Besides the food and drinks i would have given it more stars but the service and the surrounding activites with the other staff was challenging. For example the buss boy was mopping right in our area where ourselves and other guests were eating and drinking as well as a walkway for patrons and servers moving back and forth with the aroma of clorox on the side very unappetizing. I dont see why the mopping was needed at that very moment when there were no spills that needed to clean up. As soon as he finished  (i told my girlfriend this was going to happen) an employee slipped and fell. Good thing she didnt get hurt too bad and right after her a guest was coming along and myself and another guest told her to watch herself because it was slippery (no visible signage) i just shook my head. Its common sense. Finally a manager told him to not do that right now. Smh.

a4Kicq5PIGsdBl4VddtXuQ.text: This was an absolutely terrible experience. To start off, the service was horrible. I didn't get the name of my waitress but she was blonde and she had a very bad attitude. The food was so cheap and unoriginal. I ordered the signature burger and it was average. I expected higher quality from a restaurant on the strip but I shouldn't have trusted my gut. Not to mention it was outrageously overpriced! The only thing under $10 was a cup of coffee for $8. The only reason I gave this two stars instead of one was the French fries, they were simultaneously soft and crunchy. If anything, order postmates for the fries, but honestly, McDonald's is better. The goblet drinks were gross, no one can even finish them because of the obnoxious size. The drinks were a gimmick, extremely sugary and ridiculous not to mention unsanitary! Would not recommend coming here, try Black Tap for an amazing sweet and savory restaurant experience.

NOzFmKi_BbYSwcOg3Du1Vw.text: My experience here at the beautifully designed restaurant was BitterSweet. Alfredo, is Great! He will do well and move up quickly, if that's what he wants to do. Now Alfredo, sales me on coming in to try some of there signature drinks that start at $44. My time here, also being that I'm not a tourist, the drinks would always be available to me. I'm more of a Foodie, and I did Love my Turkey Burger with crumbled Bleu cheese, sauteed mushrooms and onions. With a side order of chargrilled asparagus for my side dish. Now after waiting for the actual waiter Betty to appear after waiting for a small glass of water 10 minutes. I explained to her, that I'd never eating here before. She didn't make or offer any suggestions to me. Just was kinda on a mission I guess her shift was almost over after me..so I asked, Could she give me a few minutes more?" She replied, "Sure thing" and left for about 12 minutes more this time. I really didn't make too much of a stink being that she may've been Bombarded with an Abundance of customers to tend too. I ordered finally, my food was "Superb." I guess I wasn't moving fast enough for this young lady. She reappeared at my table with in 10 minutes more asking, "Was I done?" I looked at her with half a sandwich left and shoed her away..this may've been wrong but I didn't like feeling as if my table had a meter on it. Now, I'm not getting hyped up just because I knew I'd be asking for the GM's email or speaking with the higher up before I left this establishment. I waited for I guess the shift changing, I did see the morning shift manager tell one of the hostess' that he didn't have time at the moment he'd be back..13 to 14 minutes went by before I spoke with a very caring an also intuned individual about what he's been experiencing since he's lived in Vegas as well. Geraldo was an is a splendid General Manager. Hopefully he can stay here to whip the staff into shape per say literally...it's disgusting to pay for services and then the server's are expecting a 5-18% tip..this usually is what I give IF I'm treated with courteous behavior. Geraldo reassured me that he'd speak with this young lady. He was also very aplogetic because of what had accurred.This situation that had me a little hot and bothered. Betty and the day shifts manager need additional coaching or more frequent breaks. Just a suggestion. Overall my food was Fabulous, the Proprietors are worth all the praises as well. Thanks! I will return.

LCk4eF56Wgd90Yy2fGe73A.text: The atmosphere is adorable and what a fun crowd. It is perfect for families as well because of the super cute candy store they have inside. I came here with my mother in law and husband and we got a drink to share.   Looking through the drink menu we finally picked one to share and I know most places and bars don't have their prices next to the drinks but when we got the tab after ONE drink we spent $43!   Now that's a little crazy for some juice and candy with a shot of alcohol.   Anyways this place is fun but definitely only for a treat.

hFr6nz0HPVqR0MJRs50iDQ.text: Atmosphere is trendy, food was very poor. Fettuccine Alfredo sauce must've came straight from a jar, ordered the angus filet medium rare came out dry must've sat under the heating lamp for a while before getting to us. They have a promotion if you sat outside food was 50% off go figure with Vegas summer heat which was tolerable for the food quality and pricing. Wait for service and food was a bit excessive. Silvia our server was very kind and apologetic, did everything she could to make our first experience a better one, kudos to her!

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

l51LgKj9nGSCeZwC694Y3Q.text: I had the best experience for my 21st birthday!! The drinks were amazing and the food was great. Would 100% recommended if you are looking for something sweet and fun all around. The staff were very quick and on it the entire experience

SXf92cLhRqFUVZvorQGHeg.text: Food was tasteless, way to overpriced for what you get.  Customer service was good but won't go out of my way to come here again.

RLzPJbS1aka5ajK7ylgIAQ.text: This is one of those places that you come to for all the hype and the experience. We had a Groupon for $40 off but the bill was over $100 for 2 people and 5 things so we were disappointed. However, I would come back because we learned our lesson, and you just have to know what to get. We got 2 soups, one of the goblets and 2 burgers. The French onion soup was bland and my sister's was actually artichoke dip when she looked under the cheese. It was an honest and funny mistake, however it took 10 minutes for the server to come over and get it exchanged. We got the signature lollipop goblet and it was weak. More tarty and sweet than anything else. That turned out to be $40 bucks and a huge disappointment. I think it's worth maybe 25 or 30, and then you should be able to add shots. We saw some things on the cocktail menu that we could get but being as though this was our first and probably last time for a while we decided to get what the place was known for. Meh. I will say we ended on a high note with the burgers though. Had the bleu cheese bacon and the white chocolate burger. Both were great! So next time we're in Vegas we think we'll go back and try other drinks and stick to just the burgers (and definitely try dessert  since we'll have a little extra money in our budget)

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bleu cheese bacon burger
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zDNzBv-BF45tKpOOcegnTQ.text: Came back tonight and what a difference.  Bryan (manager) came over to meet me personally and introduced himself. He went out of his way to make sure that my sons birthday dinner went flawless. Food was great, quick and our waitress was very attentive. Bryan also made sure to bring out the biggest ice cream surprise I've ever seen. My son had the best time as well as the rest of my family.  So glad we gave this another try. Can't wait to come back again.

T1Tc1BFNb1MhtBDyqWTqpg.text: Love this place. Drinks are amazing!! You guys are so good with great service and the food was so awesome! Made the best birthday!

afR8uQuVcv7Q1YdMwjrqOg.text: Our waiter Chaz was absolutely amazing!! He suggested the best items! He was super friendly, which made our our first experience wonderful. Super cool environment! Great music! I would recommend this restaurant to any hip, chic foodie!

xSzClAuiMwy4ZHdK3a3v-A.text: Friendly and helpful service. The shakes are crazy! Crazy and good! The atmosphere was clean and modern. There are a lot of visuals. We liked how it was attached to the mall as we stopped by after a day of shopping. Wish we tried the food. This is definitely a place to stop for dessert though!

EACNW1vCjhQiEPbwlmLV4g.text: I absolutely loved eating here! Me and my friends both went for lunch while we were shopping around. Such a nice and ecstatic atmosphere. All the staff introduced themselves to us and we're happy to share their experiences and their knowledge on the menu! The bruschetta was delicious, as well as the veggie burger. We both got the sugar daddy milkshake which was amazing and we were sad not to be able to finish it. Definitely would recommend to a friend and would definitely eat here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The sugar daddy milkshake. It had a whole slice of cheesecake and lollipop. Definitely a must have.

a2L1pJCGiyQdyUn0F_hrMw.text: Our server Menz and a very attentive manager who's name I didn't catch are the only reasons I'm giving a 5 star. Truthfully it should be a 3 star.   We arrived 5 minutes early for our 8pm reservation and were told that there were reservations ahead of us who had not been seated and that we would have to bare with them. After asking several times the overwhelmed host was unable to give us an estimate on how long the wait would be.  She said the same to other guests. We overheard that others had been waiting over 30 minutes past their reservations. Ultimately at 20 minutes I spoke to a manager who immediately sat us. They maybe need more seating or a more conscious host staff.   Once we sat down our server Menz was a delight! We had no more worries other than the long wait for food. The food was delicious as were the drinks but both were a little pricey for the portion sizes. I'd eat here again but not for dinner.

WCgl0P4YFAzFGNCMYVCW4A.text: Our server was so nice and asked me to write a review. We should be careful what we ask for. I was with two other people and we all ordered different entrees and 1 appetizer. It was ALL bland and left much to be desired. The goblet drinks were....well..large and ok, but not even worth the discount with the Yelp check-in. I definitely will skip this place in the future and you should too.

e92VaqE5HC8o6LFUVDLWCQ.text: Today was our last day in Vegas so we decided to try out this place. The atmosphere is cool and clean. We only had dessert but it was good.

tf8Grj1QQCyZPh_tGHU6jg.text: Absolutely horrible service and management. Will never come back. I came here to celebrate my birthday and made a reservation a week ahead. They sat us upstairs and no one came to greet us or anything for over 30 mins, and It took 45 minutes to even get water after we sat down. The food was sub par, but after complaining to the manager (who didn't even have a name tag and never even apologized) about the lack of service, he did absolutely nothing besides split our checks up for us. Worst restaurant experience I have ever had. Oh and the waitress never even brought my "birthday surprise" that cost $10. I've been to the old location at the Paris Hotel several times and it was great! But this new location is totally different now and I will never return.

vvoh_DdHZhc6ZbGh2uvxxw.text: Amazing fooooooooooddddddd.... too bad I was in a hurry I couldn't enjoy this place the way I wanted to . I had the sugar daddy shake which was soo good . My friends ordered the rainbow burger which was pretty damn good when it was warm . My friends loved the other stuff they ordered too. The menu options are definitely cute and creative . I loved the restaraunt decor as well. I wish to return to the l.a location near me soon .

u6B_xOF_Dwd4H3-9WggVEg.text: Exactly one week ago today my family and I along with in-laws drove to Las Vegas to celebrate my sons 9th birthday. As soon as we checked in to our hotel rooms we asked my son where he wanted to have dinner for his birthday and he said Sugar Factory.  He was so excited and us adults were excited too (we had seen pictures on Instagram, tv shows etc).  Right away I called to make a reservation for a party of nine (4 adults and 5 kids ranging from 3-9years old) at around 7:45pm.  We all got ready to head out and walked the strip a bit.  While walking and passing the restaurant we saw that it was empty and the kiddos were already hungry so I stopped and spoke with the hostess and she was able to sit us right away. We all were relieved and happy because the kids were hungry and super excited to dine there.  We were taken upstair to the "Chocolate Room" then our waiter came.  I forgot to get his name, I should have written it down but my oh my was this waiter so rude! I don't know if he was annoyed because it was so many of us or that we had 5 kids with us but cmon its a damn restaurant what do you expect! Any-who,  my daughter and I went to the restroom and on the way out we saw our waiter. I told him hey it's my sons birthday and right away he answered me as if he was annoyed stating they DO NOT do free birthday cheers I would have to buy a dessert and also pay a $5 fee to have the waiters come out and wish him a happy birthday.  Fine I was okay with it, I could've paid extra, not a big deal but the way he responded to me was unprofessional.  Because of his sassy attitude I decided not to bother with ordering my sons desert.  Mind you guys... it took forever for us to get our drinks...and it took forever for him to order our food! He would leave and come back minute after, lets just put it this way we literally had like a photosesh outside with all the kids because he was just taking so long.  Point blank this waiter ruined our mood, and to top it off I paid over $80 for our meal and unacceptable service. What urked me even more was the fact that his tip was already included on our bill.  I would not have left a tip at all if I had the option.  My son and I along with our in laws were looking forward to the desert and having a good birthday dinner and he ruined it. We all felt uncomfterable it was only obvious this waiter was annoyed or idk having a bad day. I was so upset and irritated by the waiter that I even wrote on the receipt stating If it wasn't for the added gratuity on the check I would have left nothing as a tip! $0! I also wrote a piece of advice to give better service next time. I hope his manager read it or who knows he probably threw it away so he wouldn't get in trouble.  Just a shame the food was really good but the service was just horrible and that alone threw off our dinner and even our mood for the rest of the night.

xXpP_9aB1dF97M55UXUV7w.text: Not only was the service GREAT but the desserts was AMAZING!!! Thank you Erick with a CK lol you are GREAT

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not only was the service GREAT but the desserts was AMAZING!!! Thank you Erick with a CK lol you are GREAT

VlmGP04XTkzL6ZIgflcxDQ.text: This drink was absolutely amazing. I spent the day by a pool and had a massage so in 110 degree heat, you want something that is going to quench your thirst. This one is the Lollipop Passion and delicious! Bonus you get to keep the glass and the candy. They have a full menu of these drink options and well as a large menu of other drinks and food! I can only drink one but I will be back!!!

Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

e8tZzZxfP20RSfAI5IQi-g.text: I'm so upset... I came in thinking this place was going to be great and it was totally the opposite. Didn't get the drink I specially ordered. The food I ordered was cold when it came out. I'm just in shock that this place was suppose to be really great and it seriously made our night end badly. I just wish someone could've made it right.. ?

RqyHTGrU4n6yyAEOjl4ULw.text: My kids and I had a blast here! Our waiter Chez was amazing he was very attentive and even had a couple jokes up his sleeve for the kids. I came in with two of my girlfriends and their children and we all agree this is a great place for kids and adults as well :) most of the fishbowl drinks can be made non alcoholic for the kids, awesome music beautiful decor and excellent food. The desserts are to die for and so creative!! We will be back for more soon maybe without the kids next time!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PjDg_qy4ZnG_GHndVeV6SQ.text: Haven't been to The Sugar Factory for a few years now and came to this location on a whim. I didn't realize that this was sort of a soft launch for their grand opening which is tomorrow.   The drinks and candy are what they're known for, but the actual real star at this establishment was our server Brandon! It was quite busy and frantic (typical Las Vegas restaurant on the Strip), but Brandon made our experience a very memorable one. Not only is Brandon knowledgeable and cognizant of everyone's tastes at the table, but he was extremely personable and delighted us with his upbeat personality and sharp wit!  Thank you Sugar Factory for making a comeback & thank you Brandon for your service and pleasant disposition.

_9i3MIMWZyIK53llNET0zQ.text: If the music is so loud that the server can't hear the order correctly it's probably too loud.  All the fried food was so greasy that you can only assume that the food was fried twice. Our server didn't come back until the end to give us our check; we had to get our mustard and hot sauce from the busboy. And the milkshake was crazy runny. It was more like chocolate milk rather than a shake. Now I have to have another dinner to redeem myself from eating this crappy one. Would NOT go back again.   *Update on 9/12/17*  Since my last review, I got a message from Jennevive (manager) and she apologized for the subpar food and service so therefore kindly offered a free dinner on the house for me and a guest. First of all I didn't expect this kind of response... I didn't think anyone would pay attention to ONE person's bad review. But we went back to give it another chance. I immediately noticed that the music was not as loud as before (I was able to actually hold a conversation while we ate!). I must also mention that Mannie (our server) was excellent to us and treated us like VIP. He was very attentive and kind. The steak and lobster we ordered was supposed to be medium but it came out over cooked, so our server brought us another order of the same and it came out just right. Overall we were impressed with the service both from the manager and server so I did appreciate their efforts to take the time and care for a customer that has had a bad experience. It left me feeling like every customer is important to them and I was appreciative and impressed with that!

rSAyOeA39CO8_rTCcqDVyw.text: I went here for the first time and every piece of candy I bought was not only expensive but completely stale. I couldn't even eat it.

P5vdarFqkuCTKwl96JilmQ.text: What a fun and unique experience! The food portions were large and there are some really unique menu items. Jeanette was our server and she was so sweet. Would recommend this place for a fun treat for anyone visiting the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Xye8qdXSfWinSQbDdlySPg.text: Sweet place to visit. Great menu from burgers to steak and breakfast . Enjoyed our dinner, fun atmosphere . We ordered a couple large goblet of adult drinks but I think they served them without alcohol they were lightly served but we had fun watching the finishing touches of the drink at the table . Finished our dinner with a 3 scoop banana split sundae. Cool place to visit.

0H2GBE6644jg3bmjWTHzAw.text: 4-17-19 was my 21 wedding anniversary and we were visiting Vegas.  This was the only place that I really wanted to try while I was there.  It did not disappoint! I hope I am correct on this because I am writing this review late but I think our waitress name was Ashley. She was great. We are not big drinkers but due to the special occasion I wanted to splurge and try a drink. They are 40$ a pop. We got the watermelon patch goblet.  When the waitress came with the drink she asked if I wanted to video it.  So glad she did it was really cool to watch.  We shared the drink.  Perfect for two people. I got the blue cheese burger and it cost 13$ which I thought was average price for a burger.  My husband got the south beach flair burger 15$ and my daughter got the grilled chicken sandwich 16$. My son just got the chicken tenders. All the food was delicious and perfectly cooked.  Wouldn't have changed anything.  For dessert my son got the Carmel sugar daddy cheesecake shake it is suppose to come with graham cracker on the side of the glass but my son wanted rainbow sprinkles and she had no problem.  He was very happy with his dessert.  I also bought a groupon that day that saved some money.  But please remember to tip your waitress/ waiter on original price not the discounted price especially if they do a great job like Ashley.  The only thing I am disappointed With I didn't know they had an upstairs that had a chocolate bar and carousel I just read the reviews that mentioned it. Bummed I wasn't told about it.  Well I guess I just have to go back.  Oh darn!

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing drink we had
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blue cheese burger.

sHVZrA0eahe7Gjb9LcefcA.text: This review is mainly for their Sunday brunch. I was here yesterday on a private event and had lots of fun. It was on the 2nd floor at the Chocolate lounge.  The Sugar Factory is indeed a cute and a popular hot spot in Vegas. They have an indoor and outdoor seating. Their signature menu offers everything from pancakes and sweet and savory crepes to burgers, salads, and pizzas.  We all had drinks on their famous goblets with dry ice that makes them fizz and bubble. The drinks and sweets were tasty, however, the food was a little bland.  The lower level is the Sugar factory dining experience as well as a confectionery offering gifts and sweets for every taste.   The music was loud and so we sat outside on the patio. I'd definitely recommend the Sugar Factory if you want awesome ice cream with lots of choices.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. dj
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bd5zlFDnlJyyo4LLWkUMVg.text: My 1st experience here was bittersweet.   The service: I went with friends to celebrate a birthday. We had a large group of 12 so it was a little hectic trying to take drinks and place orders. Now, being a Las Vegas local, not all but some places offer a local discount. My friend called and asked if they offered one, and they told her yes. HOWEVER when we arrived, I had to ask 4 different people, including the manager if they offered a local discount and NO ONE KNEW! I got really agitated because instead of someone coming back to tell me, I constantly had to ask someone else.   The food: I LOVED the pasta here! I ordered Chicken Alfredo, added shrimp and asked if they red peppers could be added to make it a little spicy. The waitress said that didn't have red peppers but could tell them to spicy it up. When I say this was the BEST PASTA I've ever had..... They seasoned the pasta so well I didn't need to add any salt or pepper. The chicken was tender and they gave BIG shrimps (about 6 to 7). Some of my friends did not like the food that they order.  The drinks: I have to say the drinks were the coolest thing ever! I had a Sexual Chocolate which literally tasted like chocolate covered strawberries. Absolutely delicious.  Overall: I was not really happy with the service (the waitress forgot to add our local discount but did fix it). She did her best. I know how tough it is trying to serve a large party. I really enjoyed my food and drink. The music was great as well. Perfect spot for a date. Next time, I will have to order one for their monstrous desserts.

S99TpoyC6588xg5uY86YrQ.text: Disappointed in the service and the fact that they whr out of a lot of the candy and would not substitute because if I post on social media it wouldn't be True to the description asked for a refill on soda never recieved it. Taste and quality of food was not as good as my first visit 2yrs ago also there where flies flying around our food (inside the restaurant) will I return no do I recommend no.

wHH9_lXf8fHw8TnNsMK7rQ.text: I'm guessing they consolidated all Vegas Sugar Factories into this one location which makes sense. It's definitely a step up in energy and ambiance from the old Town Square location.  I will say, being 7.5 months pregnant and easily prone to headache, perhaps I should've chosen somewhere quieter to eat. Anyhow, that said, it's definitely a great place for a party to dine.. bachelorette, family reunion, whatever!  Bear in mind that this restaurant is Strip prices for sure so expect to pay $10-12 for an appetizer and at least $16 for an entree. Drinks and desserts are about the same.  Jake our server was super busy running around everywhere so it took a while to get our orders and refills. Because of the lunch rush, plan for at least an hour and a half meal without dessert.  I will say that their turkey burger is my absolute favorite. I tried it years ago and it's always been on my mind. It's thick, savory and seasoned, and topped with aioli! So good!  Didn't get to indulge in dessert this time but I know they big and beautiful and so are their prices!   Check in on Yelp for free bruschetta which is so worth it!

_8E7zl80AsAWNrOAMfl8wg.text: It doesn't live up to the hype. The food is definitely nothing special, the French fries were too salty and the sandwich was something we could've just made at home. We also got the fettuccine Alfredo and it tasted too much like garlic. Only the drinks were good, but pricey. If you go I suggest just go for some drinks, eat elsewhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

f7aS0RWQC0hzw10Q2ZTLoA.text: My wife and I had a great breakfast and a wonderful time here.  Andrea was our server and he was fantastic.  I'd call it a perfect experience.    I'm a waffle-lover and this place is unbelievable because you get to choose your toppings. They come on the side and then you can put them on yourself.    The whole menu looks great and I cannot wait to go back and try one of the drinks.  [I've had an account for 10 years and this is my first review.  I guess I must really like this place.  Keep up the good work, Sugar Factory!]

9n315PtqO8YHJeQ58shgEw.text: A diabetics dream! Sugary mixed drinks that can be made with of without alcohol. Garnishes made with gummies and dry ice to add to show. No prices on drinks so that should give you an indication that they are pricey. My husband I shared a watermelon mojito and fries and that was 40 bucks. Great place to try but more of a novelty. Candy shop connected to restaurant in case you didn't get enough sugar. They tip off some drinks with sparklers, shakes made with a chocolate covered cup. Food seems like glorified diner food. Gummies are like jawbreakers after sitting in liquid. Cool loud current music so good to hang with friends and groups.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oopFKM33b3-27ZASRpmphQ.text: Sugar Factory. Where all of your sweet desires can be consumed. From "Goblets" of cocktails to lavish ice cream sundaes, to crazy milkshakes, they also have a variety of food options to choose from.  After a couple of days of non stop drinking, I decided to lay off the booze. Although they are known for their Goblets (60 oz concoction of colorful, vibrant cocktails) I decided to skip the massive "buzz" and opted for something that had no alcohol. Their Milkshakes caught my attention.  Giggles Snickers Milkshake: For some reason by looking at all their desserts, I had the assumption that everything was going to be overwhelmingly sweet. To my surprise, the milkshake tasted fantastic. It was nice, creamy, and thick. It had a great oreo flavor, and I kept scooping away at the whipped cream and sprinkles. It was perfect. The presentation was exquisite. The mug was covered in chocolate with a rainbow of sprinkles and bits and pieces of Snickers everywhere. There was also a caramel waffle to top it off! SWEET! 5/5  I'll have to come back again to get sugar wasted with their Goblet's!

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Giggles Snickers Milkshake 5/5

BbQy8IEiEVdWsCMMNM0TzQ.text: I had a pretty sweeeet time here at the Sugar Factory! To start off, Ms. Mercedes, our hostess, was such an incredible host and helped make our time there really extraordinary. I wish I could remember the name of my waitress because she also deserves all of the praise I can give. The Sugar Factory is one stop in Vegas that I recommend everyone makes.  I loved the location of this place, in the heart of the strip. It was alive and full of fun people and all of the staff was very welcoming and professional. You can also take your drink to walk around if you haven't finished it during your stay (which, unfortunately, I finished mine).  Which brings me right to the drinks. I had the "Energy Bear Goblet". Now I'm not really a sweets person, but this was a special occasion so I decided to bite the bullet. This was so fantastic. From presentation to taste, this was a very quality drink.   I also had the buffalo chicken sandwich and if everyone isn't ordering this, they're really doing themselves dirty. A fantastically cooked chicken with a delicious sauce and awesome toppings. So good, there was no way I could finish this and a goblet.  And if I haven't raved about the staff enough (I haven't), the service was impeccable. From the entrance to service to everything. It was a friend's birthday and Mercedes would not let her get out of the birthday dessert and song. Which was fun, and made us feel very warm and welcome.  Overall, fantastic choice for a place to celebrate. 5/5 service, 5/5 food, 5/5 location.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LF3nvtb7UfcoJwghtxb_2A.text: We went to the Sugar Factory in Vegas while we were visiting. We had heard of it and thought it would be fun to go. We used a great value Groupon because this place is expensive. $40 for one of their drinks! While the food was good, it wasn't great. I had the Mac and cheese balls. I liked them, but they weren't anything I'd intentionally go back for. Overall it was a fun visit and service was good!

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. YUMMY!! Can&#39;t wait!

Q-NyK56wqNM1k6w5SjSCSw.text: Waffle burger was really good, I would definitely order again. For their milkshakes you are paying for the appearance and the Mac and cheese pops are good. It's Vegas so it's expensive but the waffle burger you can share with 2 people.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waffle burger
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac and cheese
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crazy milkshake

RYXYWzW5zXD5-uOQC6SzMg.text: Have you ever heard the expression 'like a kid in a candy store?'  Um, yeah....  I have always wanted to go to a Sugar Factory and there is NONE anywhere near where I live. This was on my Vegas bucket list from the moment I knew I was going!  Now, there are 2 locations in Vegas. This is the one outside of the Fashion Show mall. Our experience here couldn't have been better. We sat at the bar and our bartender was friendly and funny.   We ordered the Giggles Snickers Shake and I sat in excited anticipation while I waited!  When it was ready, OMG!  I could hardly contain my excitement!  It was so beautiful and huge and I couldn't wait to dive in!  My husband ate the snickers on top while I munched the warm waffles. The shake itself was the best we'd ever had!  And, because I wasn't going to let any of this go to waste, we scraped the chocolate off the side with our spoons!    The whole experience from beginning to end was everything I'd hoped!  When we were done I filled up a box of gummies to take home to my daughter. From penguins to whales to crab claws to strippers, they had every gummy you could ever want!

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

F1kUyW-CII2Q9nN44Wm_2A.text: Stopped by for a drink at the bar. The bar top was full of dirty dishes. Took 5 minutes to even be acknowledged. Then didn't ask if I wanted a drink. There where also ants crawling all over the bar top. Just plain gross.

Qw5rkwrbw3epUkPMjOkgjA.text: My sister and I go to Vegas often and have always wanted to try a drink from Sugar Factory for many many years, and finally did.  We ordered a basket of fries and finally decided on the Berry Bliss goblet to share.  The fries were good, but we were both a little disappointed in our drink.  We decided on the Berry Bliss drink because in the description, it said it had fresh berries in it.  It was supposed to come with strawberries, raspberries, blackberries, and blueberries, but the drink came with no fruits, just those hard berry gummy candies, like the Haribo Berries.  And I do not like those candies.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Berry Bliss

E6RlkZ7r4WY_lJj_4bxxGw.text: Asked for a non-alcoholic goblet: the watermelon patch. Got the watermelon sprite version in the goblet with the nitro ice but sadly nooo candy. What's the point of ordering a 60oz soda? For $34??? Unfortunately the picture here is not insta-worthy.   I guess non-alcoholic means no fun, no candy, or as they say in Vegas: no dice.   Came here for the experience and left so disappointed.   I didn't order any of the food thereafter. But the family ordered French onion soup, which was both small, and super salty. As another reviewer said - it's like a Cheesecake Factory, but sugary.   The only good thing worth noting about this place is the ambiance and the candy shop section. But we're in Vegas, so there's not a lot going for it sadly.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Watermelon patch (non-alcoholic w/o candy = $34)  Why?

v24-2BR1wZpBKOFTGCkI4w.text: Always fun stop. Food is just okay in my opinion. I would compare it to a Cheesecake Factory. Very rich.   We do not come for the food. We come for the fun drinks! This stop we tried the classic ice cream sandwich and the featured Pit Bull drink.   Two star because the bathroom were SO dirty. Sticky floors, only one stall with TP.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ye6WM1doaYH_vK24lAcRPQ.text: Food is terrible , only the drinks and sweets are bomb, I guess that's why it's called the sugar factory lol

_xuzXm4bpoOdzvWrsTlCAw.text: Love the concept but the food is just ok. Very popular location being that its on the Las Vegas strip so be prepared for crowds. I would recommend making a reservation ahead of time. For how pricey it is I would have expected a better meal. The ambiance is loud music and low lights so be prepared for that.

VibwydbUKYqkZVGUDTEfPg.text: First timer! Experience was very good and our waiter Justin was great. Attentive, funny, and quick! Our drinks and food were very good too! Even what I had (chicken Caesar salad) was amazing! Very pricey, but worth it.

rHCi5QfCWKyVY1S2M1WRzQ.text: Cool place for family and friends.  I loved the decor and so convenient as its located right next to the mall.  I had the steak sandwich and it was awesome, order salad instead of fries and the salad was wilted - one bite and I was done! Question?  How do you run out of Mac and cheese at 6:30pm?  Kids menu is limited and they ran out of Mac and cheese. WEIRD...any who...the drinks are great..but for 2 steak sandwiches, chicken strips, pasta, 2 milkshakes and 2 drinks..drumroll....$250!  Next time we will visit the candy store and skip the meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3fT8lkkcBTlrZaxpjT7fCg.text: This place is amazing! I've been here a couple of times and it never disappoints. The food is delicious, goblets are great, and the service is wonderful! Our server Reudiger and Chris was very helpful and provided us with great service. I cant wait to come back!! You must stop by if you're in Vegas!

Pvi9k2YkxE5dTfkq0WLf-Q.text: Went after the Canelo-Chavez Jr. Right about the time they were closing but they still took us in. 1pt.   Location: by the fashion mall district.   Drinks: we had the original goblet and the one with oranges ( candy gummies) I think. Drinks were special, it's something you have to try in Vegas. 1pt   Food: I ordered a rib eye and she ordered mahi mahi tacos. The rib eye was very good and tender well cooked how I wanted it "medium" the sides were nothing out of the ordinary but were well prepared. 1pt   Service: waiter was a guy named Jason, that's the guy to go to! He's the man! I highly recommend requesting him. He helped us thorough the menu talked to us about the origin of the place and the popular items on the menu. He even went to the bar to make us his favorite drinks. Not usual for a waiter to also make your drinks 2pts.   Overall 5 stars, well come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZKewjbS3E8S9hBnZwHGulg.text: WOW, WOW, WOW are the three best words to describe the Sugar Factory!    Great night, great fun, great food, great drinks, and most of all great service...... and did I mention the great desserts!   This is a great place to celebrate a birthday, anniversary, or any special event....they even have a private room upstairs for weddings.   Hats off to you Sugar Factory....can't wait to visit again soon!

mtXtL0W_J7jHyDcEEC2vkA.text: Sugar Factory is known for their oversized drinks that have a smoking effect. They also offer food. I ordered the Philly burger. There was cheese sauce on it that just took the burger to the next level for my taste buds. It was delicious! It came with regular thin cut fries. The burger filled me up and then some. The decor in the restaurant is really unique. The colors and lighting makes the restaurant look very vibrant. No complaints for a casual lunch or dinner here. The restaurant also offers breakfast but I have not had any of the breakfast items. The drinks are very good too. I would recommend this restaurant.

Rd9a5UBFTuMIj43CEPUXNg.text: We have the strawberry milkshake and raspberry watermelon. The milkshake is not over sweet which is perfect for me but the alcohol drink is sweeter than I expected. Service could be a little bit improved!

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

d1LTPMwy2eykx6H__snVuw.text: This is by far my sons favorite place that we went to in our last trip to Vegas. There's a store with all the candies and the menu is good for kids and adults. It's not cheap for one order of a milkshake but it's not your ordinary milkshake  in the cup too. Something to try when you are on vacation. There's picture of Kardashians everywhere and found out that it's their store. I'm happy with the visit. A must try I say..
