zaK3w7nN5Xdl3B1GssBZKA.text: Don't let the bad reviews deter you from going here!! You will regret it!!! We went during our vacation back in July and I am counting down the days until I get to go back!! Maybe the bad reviews were from people who didn't order the right items- no one in my group ordered dinner or the big sugary goblet drinks. We got appetizers and fries which were delicious.  But the best part were the drinks- we all ordered different versions of the chocolate martinis- I got the peanut butter chocolate, my boyfriend got the chocolate mint, and I forget what the others got but we all LOVED THEM!!! Unfortunately I don't have any pics (which is so not like me) but trust me you will not be disappointed with any of the creative martinis.  Sure it's expensive and service wasn't amazing but hey it's Vegas. And with a chocolate martini in your hand it's kinda hard to be mad ;)

S-Xf167bj5_RS95fofwJ-w.text: The hype from all of the stars is exactly what this place needed to land on the famous strip of Las Vegas blvd.  I ordered the coffee, which was the best item on the menu.  For the high prices, waiters that are talking about their Friday night plans on the Front of the house floor and the chicken and waffles that taste like frozen boxed chicken I think you can skip this place.   The drinks are 40 dollars and come in huge plastic cups labeled with the company name which you would expect glass for that price.  For my partner, the breakfast ordered was precooked bacon, uncooked eggs, and breakfast potatoes that Jimmy Dean whipped up before the sun rise.   As expected, the check was delivered to us just by a piece of paper. Not even in a nice receipt holder.   The experience at the Sugar Factory Restaurant was just like being a hooker in Vegas: Expensive, fast and cheap.

JxRMPwE-yoF3thqihwVL1g.text: My sons 6th birthday and where does he want to go? This hell hole!   We get there and they offered 50% off menu items if you sit on the patio, i told them we had a groupon and the looks on their faces was like we were the devil, but in reality they were GREEDY DEVILS.   LONG STORY SHORT I had a groupon for $80 which turned our bill to $54 bucks. Our total was $134. Wtf. Umm and we ordered a VIRGIN goblet drink that had no price and comes out to be $34 freakin dollars!! Are you kidding me. Turns out were suppose to take the goblet home but he never told us.   Then brings the bill and is waiting for me to tip..hold your horses boy.. i am not tipping you more than $20 bucks for what you call service. He was like rushing us. Not sure what his name was he was that forgettable.   Food was ok..overall my kid was happy but I don't think we will be visiting this place again. Save your money and go to 711 for a fruity drink.

cJXbon9qzHbRxrJS4I91-g.text: I'd been looking so forward to coming here and ended up pretty disappointed. We ate and had a drink to share. The food was overpriced, average quality, and a very small portion. We asked what the least sweet drink was, because neither of us were looking for a super sugary drink (which maybe was our big mistake), I can't remember what the name of the drink was they recommended, but it was super sugary and didn't seem to even have alcohol in it though it was supposed to. All in all it was a fun photo opportunity but I would never return.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oWsI-ikD_nBBJ9iwvNiaRA.text: I ate some pretty amazing crepes here for brunch. The waiter was kind enough to customize my order request a bit. A pretty clean fun restaurant with a candy shop attached to it.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mBR9w_v-FieJysCK_-7hSQ.text: I have given this place 4 chances and they keep letting me down. I really really wanted to love this place. They look so fun.  So, first time I go and we were in the upstairs room. It felt like they didn't have enough servers because they kept disappearing. Took 30 minutes to get my bill paid after I finally went to the bartender to ask for the bill. The drinks were amazing though. We did the bowls virgin and I love that they have the option to try all their fun drinks alcohol free. Sadly they didn't have the signatue candy for our choice and they didn't offer all the drinks I saw on their online menu. I love the bowls though. Sadly they didn't tell us they were ours with purchase. That's 2 bowls we didn't get. (They cost 20 in the store)  2nd visit. Figured we'd give them the benefit of the doubt. This time we ordered a meal. Went with their steak. It was so flavorful and grilled so nicely. Ordered 2 more bowls. Once again we weren't told the bowls were for us. This time we get the bill and there was an 18% gratuity for the server who gave us our water and never came back! We had to chase down a waiter to get our bill and they didn't know about the gratuity and our waiter wasn't there any longer.   3rd visit.  This time took the cake. Got 2 goblets. Both virgin. I told them this. It was just 2 of us again. The waiter disappeared and the bar tender brings over the drink. I take a sip and realize it has alcohol in it. I tell the bar tender we ordered virgin. She told me to keep it and drink it anyway. I was flabbergasted because I was with my minor daughter. I tell her this. She looks ar my kid and shrugs. I'm not gonna say anything she says.   Are you kidding me? I made her get us the virgin because I'm not serving my kid alcohol.  Again, not told the cups are souvenirs. Try to get my bill. Takes forever and while I'm waiting for my card to run the bar tender decides she's done for the night and starts drinking with the customers at the bar that just wanted their change so they could leave. They told the tender this but she was busy pouring free shots for them and her.  So. Last chance. Go with friends. Was looking forward to the streak again since it was so good last time. This time it had no flavor. No char from the grill. Just was bland and chewy and the potatoes were sour. Another virgin goblet that we weren't informed we could keep and they were out of a few flavors. This time though the service was top notch. I told the waitress that every time we ate upstairs we had awful service and that the bartender tried to give my kid alcohol. So maybe that's why we had good service. A manager never came by though.  So that's how many goblets I didn't get to keep? I really wanted one too. The drinks are amazing every time...if they have it on stock and don't rely on the online menu.  The food is not consistent. The service is a nightmare.  I really wanted to like this place. The concept is fun, the decor is amazing, the drinks are unique and flavorful and you can get them virgin.  But I do not know if I'll give them another chance. If I did, I now know I can have my goblet. Would also be nice if they offered a gluten free option since it is a big stop on the strip.

xo4q7MuunYQrwx-kQJ4Bkw.text: We had a reservation so we were seated fast. Our service while dining was bad. When the pasta came there was a hair in It. We got our food before we got the Goblets because the waiter forgot about them. Not worth it for the money we had to spend.

l-KA4uyXmQm1Kc2ZVlxpKw.text: Although I wish I would have ventured out in terms of the menu I still loved my experience. My drink was lovely although it may not be worth 39 bucks it was a nice Instagram video. Nevertheless my food was good and I would definitely go back again.

ITU3rN9omKkHiGpYdz4CoQ.text: I had my 21st birthday dinner here and just so happened to be dining at the same place Bella Thorne was having her 21st birthday dinner at the same time. Although the paparazzi was a little hectic, it was a cool reminder of how renowned this establishment is! The food is pretty standard Vegas strip dining (with prices to match), but the candy shop and souvenirs duck cups make it worth the experience. There are also tons of photo ops which will be worth having on your Vegas vacation. Overall, a great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Her name is Quackatha

icao40J74J2yoF5y7zqAvw.text: July 3rd, 2018. First off, this was my birthday dinner with family, all 6 of us. Twins, age 5, two teenagers, 17/16, and my wife and I. We purchased a Groupon, made reservations followed by a show. Upon walking in, our waiter was clearly annoyed and expressed his displeasure. Nearly each thing we ordered was unavailable. Drinks - unavailable, starters - unavailable, dinner - unavailable. Waiter said this is how it was every night. Terrible experience, spent a bunch of money, and will never return period.

dwFqn2qUg_rJUD7S6ix2Mw.text: Initial visit (one star): Service was poor. Our poor waiter had three large parties to deal with with no extra help! The food is subpar and the drinks are disgusting. I will not be returning!  Update (three stars): Corey with management reached out to me and extended a complimentary return visit. We took him up on his offer as we were return to Las Vegas last month. The service this time was much better, the staff was attentive and not overwhelmed, and the food and drinks came out timely.

LOehG9s9JVYiQ8dCeElRAw.text: The first time I went here I admit wasn't the best maybe our waiter was having a bad day or whatever. But the second time we went back I felt better than ever. My glass was never empty, the waiter always checked to see how we were doing, and even though this place was packed we still got our food fast. This is place is good for their desserts and burgers

eFyRxZb8ZCodCsLBsDY8Tw.text: First, it started off with the four different pronunciations of my friend's last name. Second, our food came out before our drinks. Third, one of my friends ordered an entree and specifically asked for no chicken, guess what? She got chicken. Fourth, one of my other friends ordered Bolognese it came out with a touch of cooker's hair. The manager was eventually called over and our drinks were rolling in. My friends got their replacement food 20 mins after the complaint. They offered us dessert on the house but we never got it because we had to go.    Food: It was okay...  Drinks: Good. Service: Took too long.

vGviVlwGhIOPeTHaDzp7zQ.text: Was looking forward to this lunch with my 9 year old daughter because of the candy shop and being on vacation in Vegas. I didn't know about the Kartrashian connection. We sat inside and I unfortunately faced the tv - luckily she did not. I didn't let that bother me. Ladies (very close to us) at the next table had one of the fun fish bowl drinks. They didn't finish their food nor did they want to take it with them should have been a clue to me. My daughter had the chicken fettucine. We shared the $18 chocolate shake. I had a burger and fries. I finished my burger - it was good. too many fries but good. I tasted the fettucine and it was very rich, tasted fine. I didn't try any of the chicken. My kid got sick off the chicken and spent the evening and the next day in the hotel room sick and sleeping from nausea and stomach pains. Careful what you eat there. I would say - drink only.

F4QXYZ2TWYHPiG_eIfXmpA.text: Request Rhea as your waitress!! She definitely made our trip to sugar factory one of the most memorable experiences we had here in Las Vegas! Not only was she extremely attentive from the moment we had sat down, she was funny, friendly, helpful, and very knowledgeable with answers to any questions we had about their extensive menu (which is a lot to look through! But it was impressive how many different options they have food & drink wise, our party of 7, 4 of which were young children were all able to find exactly what we wanted to eat even though each meal was vastly different from the others). Also following her suggestions on desserts turned out to be the most beautifully hand-crafted "insane" milkshakes, (including one with an entire slice of cheesecake on the top, one with cotton candy and Skittles and one with a bacon cheeseburger to top it!) And they taste as delicious as they look!! I had the club sandwich and although it was HUGE in portion sjze, I couldn't stop myself from eating more and more. My husband got the steak and lobster tail which was cooked to perfection and although pricey, completely worth every cent! We ordered the white gummy worm goblet with alcohol and we're pleased to find out we could order any of them without the alcohol also for the kids. They enjoyed the lollipop and ocean blue goblets. The beer selection is a little slim but we were pleased even more when our waitress assured us it was a full bar not limited to the menus cocktails and martinis only, so my sister in law enjoyed a vodka soda. The bruchetta and spinach and artichoke dip were definitely a great meal starter. We enjoyed dinner in the chocolate lounge upstairs and loved the atmosphere. We will definitely be returning next time we are in town!!   Thank you sugar factory staff and thank you Rhea for making our experience much more than just dinner out as a family!

eZWDZ57VeD1ThjSHIvh7eQ.text: Upon walking in, the hostesses greeted us in a very cheerful and friendly manner. Our server was very attentive; she always made sure our drinks were full and that everything was perfect. The food was delicious and it came at a surprisingly fast pace; we were impressed. We ate in the Chocolate Lounge which had gorgeous views and a fancy atmosphere, although we did pass by the downstairs area which was lovely as well. When we were all done, the manager and our server thanked us and wished us a good night, which felt very nice and personal. Overall, we had a wonderful experience. Thank you, Sugar Factory!

MDwTQulOJZM9lh_5B64cEg.text: I only wanted to come here to try the huge goblet drink and I was pretty sure it was going to be overrated and disappointing but instead I turned out to really like it! The staff was very friendly, even though our waitress was incredibly busy she took good care of us and checked in frequently. We ordered the raspberry watermelon mojito. The only complain I have about this drink is that it became carbonated because of the dry ice and I didn't really think that worked with the flavors (but that is just a personal preference). We also ordered the "chocolate, chocolate, chocolate crepe" and it was really good too, but you honestly can't go wrong with chocolate really. Yes, the price is a little bit high maybe but it's a fun restaurant to go to and they have a lot of different types of desserts and drinks. I would of come here for a regular dinner, rather would just recommend it for drinks and desserts!

Aqyf1CWX3-8_juxkgEkgwA.text: ASK FIRST!!!! I thought I knew the price going in. I thought you got to keep the glass..... a non- alcoholic version of their signature nitrogen drink was $36 on a Wednesday night.  Be prepared.

nRaUBhmr_3ftQ_fR_bvcqQ.text: The experience at the sugar factory started off rocky because they cooked my order wrong but server was superb she was so patient and nice. After my order was corrected everything was great. The drinks was amazing I advise to try all the drinks.

jrLwdvf9g-zA1jrJ6c3Idg.text: We wanted to have a fun sugar experience at the chocolate lounge. When we walked in the upstairs it smelled like mold and the decor was underwhelming. Of all the items listed on the menu only 25% were actually available. Drinks were mediocre. I would not go back.

QcqmqM1CrDYg9qp43fOteg.text: This place is amazing , Goblets are delicious !!! Our first time visit was awesome. Pablo our server treated us with excellent customer service ever since we've been going to him he always makes sure that we get the best service!

dYs2D7Pc1dk9It2CyUgpOQ.text: Amazing service, delicious food & yummy drinks!!  The fried Mac n cheese bites were huge!  My son had the popcorn shrimp & there was a ton of juicy shrimp!  The melon bowl was so fun!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

C-oKYUzW5aMlbtlHV2Tm5A.text: I was excited to see that the Sugar Factory full restaurant was back on the strip and bought the Groupon to get the goblet drink of course. We orders the Mai Tai goblet, not my favorite. I would get the white gummy bear or the one with the lollipops and candy necklace ( I forget the name) I recommend coming here for one drink and that is it. The food is overpriced and not worth it. We ordered  the spinach dip appetizer which was a pretty decent sized portion but they give you like 4 pieces of tiny sourdough crisps. We asked for more once we finished and still had plenty of dip left and they come back with another 4. (Maybe it was 6 but still not nearly enough to finish the dip). I saw two birthday parties going on while I was there and the giant Birthday sundae seemed pretty cool. I'm somewhat disappointed in this new location. I miss when it used to be at Paris, it seemed a lot nicer there.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Before

qFtleZPO4ZlYaUJOmNtZig.text: Although the dessert (Banana Split Sundae) was delicious, the service was unsatisfactory. Tip was included for parties of 6 or more which helps us understand why we only saw the waitress twice during our time. Maybe they were understaffed but we did not feel well taken care of.

JbWsVQ_3viKK04c-EWJhTQ.text: Justin our server rocks as does the overall experience at Sugar Factory! Very good time and would come back

xbKKWFfbKfunJZBxOA99fQ.text: You guys tried to remove my review but in fact this was the right location and I'm going to post it again here. Nice try.  I will never go to this restaurant again. Last night was my birthday and my family and I decided to go to the Sugar Factory to celebrate. The waiter was hard to track down after 10 minutes of being seated. We had made a reservation and our Hostess didn't acknowledge the fact that my husband had told them it was my birthday and they just put us wherever. We told the waiter it was my birthday and he actually wrote my name down and then that was it. No song, No scoop of ice cream with the candle perhaps, nothing. My salad/meal was the caliber of of a side salad and it was $24. Complete rip-off! This was my birthday dinner?! Never again. And they wanted $10 To come out and sing Happy Birthday and give us some sort of dessert is what my husband told me later. If I had known this I would have gone anywhere else for my birthday celebration. Very bad service and not a good place to celebrate your birthday!

OQ7NS5xzPe7RwFBwwQSUvg.text: Went to eat here after work hearing that they have 50% off goblets. I made a reservation at 330pm and arrived on time and the hostess was very polite and friendly and sat me right away. The busser dropped waters right and away and didn't see my server to greet me until 15 mins later. All he said was "are you ready to order". Myself and my party just ordered right away being on that spot and never saw my server again for awhile. We ordered the rainbow sliders, chicken quesadillas, and the night owl goblet. Our food arrived 15 mins after ordering and our server is no where to be found and by the time we're half way done with our food our drinks arrived.. it was so disappointing to know that our drink came after mid way of eating our food. The restaurant wasn't busy during that time. I would have understood if it was peak business hours but it wasn't. He didn't even clear our empty plates, he didn't ask how our food was, or anything! He came during the end and said "you ready to pay" we jsut didn't want to be there anymore and paid and asked to split the check. Our server told me to use my phone to calculate the spilt for the amount. First of all. YOUR the server, that's your job  it's just two cards to spilt down the middle. I wouldn't go back again. They have such a good name but such poor service.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yjCA2rS_YuaWQALdGvxBkg.text: Overall, my wife and I had a pleasant experience here for lunch.  I felt like one could get diabetes just from looking at the menu, but, to be fair, this is Sin City.  I had the jalapeno burger and my wife had the mac and cheese burger.  Both were incredibly tasty.  We also got a Nutella crepe for dessert which was excellent.  They didn't skimp of the Nutella.  Overall, I would recommend this place.  I'm taking one star off because the food and drinks were overpriced ($16 for a pina colada??) even for Las Vegas.

I8ieiJfz44gUncMaYK3ggw.text: We're standing outside 30 minutes before close and they locked the doors! Come on stop being lazy. The workers just looked at us and shrugged. Thanks guys.

sC97yYdSlHirF9jEjMrjiw.text: Came here with a party of 18 for my friends' birthday. At first they set us at a table that was a bit too small. After a bit, they accommodated to make the table bigger, which was nice of them.  The waiter was very patient in checking a bunch of IDs so we could try the cocktails. Two friends got goblets, which were great! You couldn't really taste the alcohol, and they had great candies inside. I got the Sexual Chocolate. The alcohol taste was a bit overwhelming in that one, so next time I'll be getting it without alcohol (which you can do with all of the drinks).  Now onto the food. Oh boy.. again, the waiter was very patient with us as we ordered. It took a while for the food to come out, but that's to be expected when you come with a large party. We got food ranging from pasta to burgers. No one had any mix ups with their orders, and everyone's food came out mostly with no gaps. I got the Fettuccini Alfredo with a side of onion rings. Although the pasta portion was small, it tasted great! I'm actually glad the portion was smaller because too much pasta isn't always a great thing. The onion rings were great too! Everyone finished their meals without leftovers. The only downside was that it took an hour to get the check. However, the waiter was really nice in splitting all of them without mix ups.  Overall, my experience was a good one and I will be back.

MoZ3X52xMMNVIJAl-OGiag.text: Awesome time at Sugar! Richard B. as an awesome server and answered all our questions. Huge menu with something for everyone, the mac 'n cheese ball were the best! Goblets lived up to their reputation. Be sure to come here on your birthday, you get a massive bottle sparkler on a cupcake, like you're living it up in the club!

vXWXuTBYMOMBWZAoVa-Sjw.text: This place is aesthetically attractive with a menu with lots of options . Major potential to be my fave place , however , service killed it for me . The hostess rolled her eyes when I asked for a different seat ( something where I can sit next to my love , not a one top where I have to sit across from him ) , our server was annoyed and rushed and observed him being seated very close with larger parties . He forgot drinks as my love struggled to finish dinner .  As we checked out with the server we had to chance to rate him , right in front of him , I passed on the option and he kindly gave himself 5 stars with no explanation of the meaning of the review . Spoke to the manager concerning service and lacked interest with awkward silences even though I expressed my understanding of the server being overwhelmed .  Not sure the atmosphere or the food is worth 100 bucks for 2 when there's poor service .

0hu8o2pw6zbu5rXAmetJbQ.text: This was my first time to Sugar Factory and I was pleasantly surprised. My girlfriend and I wanted to have a date night tonight, and we ended up going to Sugar Factory. We started off with one of their signature goblets which was a little sweet, but that's expected. I got the turkey burger while my gf got the chicken parmesan. We both ended up really enjoying our dinners. We will definitely come back again.

sS0VsHJifYMGFihqF58pXQ.text: This place is great if you wanna take an Instagram picture with your drink and that's about it. My friend and I ordered the night owl goblet (non alcoholic since we're 18) and it didn't even have the owl lollipops that the menu promises. But that's no big deal (we didn't care but thought they'd be cool). The drink tasted like diabetes but that was expected considering all the sugar. My mom got the berry goblet. In the picture it had fresh berries and the actual drink was candy. No big deal though. But for a drink that large that costs $35 she should at least get a buzz. She hadn't had a drink for two months prior, so her alcohol tolerance was low. Considering she couldn't even taste the liquor, I wouldn't be surprised if hers was non alcoholic as well. The most surprising part for me was that it was only $5 extra for alcohol in the drinks. They should lower the price on the nonalcoholic drinks if they're just fruit punch in a cool cup. The thing that caused this place to lose stars for me was that we asked four different people for a to go cup. And the food sucks. $100 for two drinks and an appetizer. Spend your money somewhere elsewhere, maybe nobu or maggianos if you want some actual good food.

EdQnd7-Vvaes7lqeiVnjFg.text: I had never been to Sugar Factory so I wanted to check it out I know they are pretty famous for the drinks but I wanted to try the food I seen a pretty picture of Chicken Alfredo on the menu with what looked like cheese bread when I received my order the Alfredo was submerged in oil the bread was not only stale it was cold and hard the manager gave me more bread that looked similar to the one on the menu and it was also stale I had finally had enough and the second bite of Alfredo made me sick my waitress was very nice and offered to take my meal off the bill and comp me for any drink I wanted however the very rude manager tried to intervene and offer me a burger or desert instead I politely declined I was over it he was upset that my waitress offered a drink of my choice and after pretty much causing a scene he rudely said to order a drink and that his waitress had no right to comp me for my meal which may be True but he should have chose s more professional way to handle the situation the drink was pretty good but I'd recommend not eating at this place

SFJT5drOsbZ_r6voGGgpBg.text: We (party of 7) were seated quickly enough but then it stop there! The service was horrible had to keep asking for service. The only reason they're getting 2 stars is because the food was very good once we got it. Never going back though...SMH

DIuwzIkTSX-2dTCsw71F0g.text: OMG this place was amazing. The service (aka Justin our server) was superb. They were friendly and welcoming and super fun. I honestly can not think of a place with better service and the atmosphere was to die for. Thank you Sugar Factory for having my friends and I. We will definitely be back and you have made loyal customers out of us. Thank you again for everything. :)

L90shRQVnLC0q9-4DElMGA.text: This was my first time , and let's say it was awesome. Menz was the best waiter ever he asked me was my drinks amazing and was my food good . And he gave me all the facts about which drink was worth it and which meal was delightful. And he also was charming and handsome . I mean the food and drinks were good but he was even better :) . And I can't wait to come back and see him again .

qoZQktAbVCefNtEA79DHhg.text: I have been wanting to come here for the longest! I decided to make it out for my 21st Birthday! Well today is my birthday & im here & i couldn't be happier! I ordered a watermelon goblet & it is delicious! I LOVE IT! our server Adrian is also so sweet!! She was very attentive && even ordered water for us while she gave us extra time to take a look at the menu!!! I will be coming back !!!

YTNVCMpHVmDjtqerKhMQig.text: I had a great time at the Sugar Factory! Our server Mannie was super fun and made sure we were taken care of. I got the lollipop goblet and it was beautiful. Loved the presentation. It was very big, but I barely caught a buzz so I think it might be mostly juice. They say there are 7 shots in this drink, but I find this highly unlikely. Everything else was awesome though. The atmosphere is wild and fun. The photo ops abound.

PcTojuoXfCRpMrrrBVXhHA.text: Amazing food, amazing service. Will definitely recommend it to others. Had to try the fired mac n cheese balls and they were on point. Can't wait to come back to Vegas just to come back to the famous sugar factory .

POo0TJhMN7j89DfSqeWP2Q.text: One of the worst service experiences I have had yet. The only saving grace to this place was the ambiance that my children enjoyed and the table next to us that interacted with us. Our server never introduced himself. It was like we were interrupting his evening. Only found out his name is Renan by my receipt. We will not be back.

h89bMhkQbXsNhZ4GfMuM-Q.text: Diane C. is the worst server ever. We waited for a while to be acknowledged. Table next to us got seated 10 mins after us and were approached by server first. Then she assumed we were with the other table and asking "Are you guys the one using groupon?". When she was done taking their orders she left, we waited a bit for her to come back just to take our drink order. She brought our drinks and left again. Then came back to take our order. While enjoying our meal my daughter was looking for the rubber duckie that is supposed to come with her burger sliders. When server came around passing by, my daughter asked her if they forgot to give her the rubber duckie. The server immediately said "we dont have it, if you want you can speak to the manager". Long story short, After meals & drinks, we were going to order dessert when server approached us to take the order my daughter asked her if there is anything they have because we are celebrating my birthday. The server rudely said "if you are not ordering any dessert then we don't have anything". At this point I was already aggravated, and told my daughter we will not be having dessert anymore because of the way we have been treated. She could have nicely said it being that she is speaking to a 10 years old. Then on top of it all, upon paying our bill she was really rude how she shoved the receipt in my purse after I asked for it.   ---I can understand the attitude or rudeness if they were slam busy but they were not even busy.  --- She did not have to shove the receipt in my purse there is a proper way of handing the receipt to a paying customer.

DbCz80QYCB2maEfge3x0Qg.text: My husband and I brought our two girls here for lunch yesterday my husband ordered a burger my daughter ordered fruit and a bagel me and my little one wanted to order the rainbow sliders but they ran out of the rainbow buns, which was kind of disappointing but we ended up ordering the three sliders which were perfect for us since we don't eat a lot. They were very tasty my husband loved his burger and my daughter thought the fruit was delicious. We also got goblets those we're pretty pricey but we're in Vegas right every thing pretty expensive my kids liked the dry ice and my little one got a virgin bubble gum Martin and I got the adult sour apple one both were delicious.our server Travis was pretty good too. We had a great experience so good that we had to come back today for breakfast today. So we just got done eating we got food was good I think I prefer lunch and dinner better I got the fruit crepes which were okay my husband got the eggs benedict which he thought were okay (said he should have got his burger) my girls got the waffles now those were pretty dang good. The girls also got a shark goblet to share which was pretty tasty and if you check in on yelp you get it for half off Which was totally worth it. And once again our server Travis pretty good. We'll probably be back next year.

gJpQ-LErsg6alltJclp-mQ.text: I really wanted to try their milkshakes and my daughter was excited for them as well.  It took a while to get seated but I yelled out "table for 6 please" so the hostess saw we were actually waiting to get seated and not just standing around picking our nose.  15 minutes passed, no "hi I'll be right with you", "hi I'm ur server I'll give u a few minutes ".... NOTHING!  I was looking around and NOTHING!  A few busy looking servers and a few other people with white shirts talking on their walkie talkie ear pieces... but no one to serve us or greet us.  So I got up with frustration and left.  I read about the horrible service but didn't think we'd be a victim of it too.  I saw a few other angry faces looking around for their servers as well and thought to myself , if it's taking this long to get greeted and others aren't looking too happy, what more getting a milkshake!?!  On our way out is when someone finally took notice and asked if something was wrong.... I gave them the same treatment and said NOTHING.  Seriously, service needs a tune up!

yNJ_Opwi2G_fTcJEgU9c4A.text: Erick  with a ck cause he's "greedy"was the best server! He was so funny and friendly!

-ZRVsGXYyRsAkdHJ_fEa2A.text: If there was an option for 0 stars I would select it. Extremely disappointed with our experience. The service was horrible. They were not crowded so no excuses. The food is over priced. I honestly would've gotten better service at a local chain. Do not waste your money or your time. There are plenty of other restaurants in Vegas that can provide friendly service and quality food at a reasonable price.

L7nDMTYikFCsH-l4dDEELw.text: Love their new location at the fashion show mall! Food is the best and the service is top notch! Justin and Coco are amazing!

_lJndmeZWQL5i2bWnBjj2A.text: Every time I come to Vegas I always come here! Justin and KoKo are amazing!! The drinks, food, and atmosphere make it a must!

hmxVYVxXldoOOcXeMreJ-g.text: Awesome costumer service, she told us the best places to go on the strip while we are here for my best friends bachelorette! A+ Anne Marie

Y0MLrtKwF8CF7ZU6Cyx4dw.text: The service was ABSOLUTELY horrible! The waitress took forever to get back to my girlfriend on how they made the caesar salad vegan and then proceeded to get 50% of our orders wrong. The majority of us got burgers so there is no excuse for the poor service. Waitress blamed the runner, manager blamed the cooks/kitchen staff, and we still didn't get an apology. We were there for a friend's birthday party and I would have expected better service. The manager didn't even offer up an apology to us so I will probably never go back. She just said that the restaurant had been open for a month and thanked us for our patience while they sort through the mess. My friend was very specific in saying that she wanted no cheese on her chocolate burger and within a minute to 90 seconds, the waitress brought out one and asked her if she wanted it with cheese on it. She was beyond livid and so was her boyfriend.

RYSAo6u04Qk_NF8RRI6Q4Q.text: It is a tad bit overpriced and I feel the menu is highly limited. If having sugar in all the wrong types of food is your thing you might like this place, not mine.

Sv5LMuzUPpQBPUoD1qQ7wA.text: Nice decor but overrated .The goblets don't have a price on the menu, the reason why is they are $38 for some dry ice and alcohol. The food is mediocre, we ordered burgers which were ok but nothing to write home about. Asked for a duck for my son and was charged $3, thanks! Won't be back.

Go62i8LYGdLuBkeGVvFFrA.text: We just stopped by this place as we were walking by an haf an amazing dining experience!  The food was excellent and our server, Dwight was polite and attentive.  We'll definitely be back.

e2To2PpCTTKXs7jjQbbW4Q.text: We gave this place two try's the first was not so great, but our second visit was over the top. This place went way above and beyond making it a great experience for our boys and making sure our second visit was excellent which it was! We even got to see some UFC celebrities while we were there which put the icing on the cake! Our server was outstanding!

KRAEoHzpydNj606lkljZGA.text: Went for dinner on July 4th - excited to go as we loved the Sugar Factory when it was at the Paris.  I will never be back. The service was terrible.  The restaurant ran out of clean eating utensils and napkins.  The waitress told us to "just eat with our hands."  The fish bowl drinks were a huge disappointment.  We had intended to have dessert but after the terrible dinner experience we just wanted to get out of there...the manager was worthless when I wanted to talk about my not paying the full added on gratuity for my party of 11.  Terrible service, no water refills, no silverware or napkins does not equal the full gratuity!  Paid the check just to get out of there.  What a sharp decline from the former place...terribly managed.

C-pA7jPsM-WqMg4rEQxvRQ.text: Our server was sick and therefore didn't have much of a personality but that was understandable I guess. We came on a Saturday afternoon and got seated right away. For a party of 6 that's great. The fancy drinks are a little over priced for what you get but nothing beats their presentation. I got the salmon croissant- super good. and the watermelon mojito was a perfect combo of sweet and minty. Loved our visit

Pb6V_ysGEgjN8USv60wMxw.text: Went to sugar factory for my 25th birthday. Me & my boyfriend order 2 drinks & a basket of fries & we paid $40 plus a $10 gratuity (there was 5 people in our party). $50 for 2 drinks & a basket of fries?! Not to mention our waitress Chrissy was making inappropriate comments about how she doesn't like when they play Spanish music bc this isn't a Mexican restaurant... she then went on about they don't even sell Mexican food & it doesn't make sense to her that they would play Spanish music. My boyfriend & best friend are both Mexican & sitting right there so it was very uncomfortable for everyone. She was so unprofessional & didn't even seem to realize that what she was saying might make us uncomfortable considering my boyfriends name is Jose & he looks obviously Mexican.. really ruined the experience for me because I did like the ambiance. Then on top of everything she said Jose's card was not reading & she wouldn't be able to accept it. Even though it worked fine everywhere else. Super disappointed.

a2_9chS8CRx3AaAzcYt1BA.text: Amazing! This place is like Willy Wonka's Chocolate Factory without the disturbing shenanigans! I want EVERYTHING on the menu!! A MUST FOR VISITING VEGAS!

ey-Eyrd5rL8D4N3zg1bXpQ.text: I was really excited to eat here. The decor is really cute and the food menu broad and tasty looking. Unfortunately my meal here was ruined by horrible service. I'm here early on Thursday (only a few other tables worth people) and waited 15 min for a waiter to even acknowledge us. We immediately ordered including drinks. 20+ min later food arrives- still no drinks. Shouldn't you get your cocktail before your foodI ask the food runner to check on drinks which arrive another 10 min. later with he excuse that the bar is backed up. Really? No one is here... I'd hate to see the bar on a busy night. Also I could see the bar where I was sitting and my drink had been just sitting there for who knows how long- the cotton candy topper had melted and I watched he waiter put on a new one with his hands which he didn't wash. Food was nothing special. Do yourself a favor and skip this place for one of the many many other options on the strip.  Update- much like their cocktail service  the direct message from the management's comment below never came....

-Uk54RMSyw0cdTXZM5zzzQ.text: Fun for kids and adults ! Cool hand dryers in the bathroom. Drinks were a little pricey but really good and very unusual.

qHv1ZS8dWybAxf5JWvubaw.text: New location, not so great! My friends & I decided to stop in for lunch while waiting for a phone to get fixed. The milkshakes and dessert drew us in but unfortunately, we didn't even make it that far. The service was ok even though our order took longer than anticipated and it wasn't busy at all. 3 out of the 5 dishes came out wrong even though our waiter wrote down our order which prompted 2 managers to come by our table to apologize. After waiting for our food to come out correctly, they serve me raw/undercooked chicken. I understand your establishment has only been opened for a month..that may be a sorry excuse for the service but I don't think chefs are hired to serve undercooked food. We'll pass on the offer of coming back. Thanks but no thanks.

Au0-d7LMgvkgwPnOdkUJuQ.text: DO NOT COME HERE!!!!!! Sat forever and NO ONE said hello, offered drinks, or even acknowledged us. We were on the top deck. The waitresses upstairs made it a point to not make eye contact with us so that they wouldn't have to help. Initially, there was some type of confusion between the waitresses and the hostess regarding our seating, but that shouldn't have affected the service we received. We were told by the hostess that they wanted to give our table to someone else.  The male hostess guy out front with the curly hair was super cool and helpful, but I'll never visit again. Two thumbs down. There was also a guy on the elevator with some sort of microphone in his ear but I'm not sure of his position. He over heard our complaints about not being helped and said absolutely nothing. It was our first time there and we only went in after being asked to by the hostess outside. We were actually trying to go to the Benihana's next door. I've now read several reviews on the horrible customer service (mainly the wait staff). Guess I should've read up before we agreed to going in. DON'T WASTE YOUR  $$ HERE!

LdY8DIXNcFoC_55OgNt0Mw.text: After my last experience here I was pretty much set on not going back. Jennevive, one of the managers reached out to me regarding my last visit and requested that I give them another chance and come back in so I could get the service I should have gotten in the first place. I definitely appreciated her reaching out and wanting to fix the issues at hand. I decided to accept her invitation and went ahead and made a reservation for myself and my boyfriend who has Never been to a sugar factory before. I went in with an open mind hoping that this wouldn't be a repeat of the first time and it definitely wasn't. It was a complete 360. The service was amazing, the food was great, everyone was very attentive and had whatever we asked for in a timely matter. Menz, our server was AMAZING. He made sure we were updated on when our food and drinks would be coming out, made sure to check in with us even though they were pretty busy, answered all our questions without hesitation and even had a few laughs with us. The manager on duty Gerrard (Might have misspelled) was great as well. My boyfriend actually called him over to say how great everything had been and how much we really appreciated everything and he actually went over some things with us that would be happening weekly like ladies night, and I believe he said they would be having a DJ there on Friday nights soon. Overall everything was AMAZING this time around and definitely changed my perspective on this location. We'll be back soon! Thank you Everyone!

JR-QmJKxmUwhRq-GALU1pg.text: Will never return. Purchased a groupon. We were excited to try it after a Vegas show. Got there about 9:45pm. Menu is a book so took us 20 min or so to look at everything. It was apparent they were closing. Nice waiter was the only saving grace. Milkshakes come out at the time we are told they are out of the ice cream flavor that was to come on our sundae. So as you can see the sundae hadn't been started. He offers us different flavors. We are fine with that. We ask what are the options. No list of flavors. We had to get up to go see and when we did most didn't even have a label so no idea what the were. We settled on 2 flavors but very unimpressed with 2 of them.  Our sundae comes out and immediately I think something is missing. No crushed Oreos and no caramel. This is a signature sundae not something we created. We ordered coffee figuring we'd warm up with it while we waited and it didn't come until the ice cream. It was awful.  5.00 a cup we expected better flavor and the option of more than one cup. They took off for the sundae. We asked to remove the coffee and he was not happy about it. Manager says "you drank the cup right?"  The one late arriving bad coffee. Used a Groupon thank goodness but was still very expensive. Totally not worth it. We went for a fun experience and this was definitely a fail. Took a picture of my kids milkshakes and was not excited about the dirty mop pail in the background of the picture. . Save your money.

P0Qsw8ejA69NsDOZLB6I4Q.text: Food was off the hook and fun, ceilings were cool too. Pablo was great as a server very attentive. Would definitely recommend for people looking for something different.

55_mN1h2woRTxXriT8rWRQ.text: The Food was delicious. You get nice size portions. The staff was very friendly. We came for a bachelorette party, and it was a great place to start the day.

DBCMgaed7UHI5tVZbrVeBw.text: Went here for brunch for my wife's birthday on Saturday May 20th. We had only had one of their bowl drinks from a previous trip at the miracle mile location so we were excited to dine in. From the moment we walked up the host was warm and inviting and brought us to our table immediately. We sat outside as the weather was enjoyable however the sun was beaming down on our table. Moments after being seated our waiter Travis walked up also with a great genuine attitude. He immediately moved an umbrella around to get us some shade and assured us the sun would only be in that spot for no more than 10 minutes. He was absolutely right, he moved the umbrella once the sun was gone and proceeded to take our order. Our table ordered 3 of the large bowl drinks and two specialty cocktails all of which were fantastic! The drinks are so delicious you can't even taste the alcohol but trust me its there! Our food was brought out fairly quickly, Travis made sure to check up on our table constantly while having conversation with us and making the overall experience very enjoyable. I would most definitely say he is one of the best waiters we have met and will most definitely be going back on our next trip to Vegas!

2RCx9en_WVOWdG4rYOWHNg.text: Wow!!! My family and I went here on Easter for breakfast. Our waiter was chase cates. He was very fast and super friendly. The menu was huge and we didn't know what to get but he was very patient with us. I ended up getting red velvet pancakes that came with whatever flavor ice cream I wanted and a side of bacon and eggs. It was very delicious. My family got a goblet that was huge and very good. We kept the candy and the lollipops that came with it. After we ordered we waited about 15 minutes for all of our food to come out which was very fast for all the food we ordered. When we were done eating we met the manager of this location and she was so sweet it would be great to work for her. The restaurant was very clean and the bathrooms were very fun! There is a chocolate bar upstairs that is 21 and over and sooo cute and smells sooo good! Next time we go to the Sugar Factory we will be sure to ask for chase. He was amazing and made our trip there 10 times better

mC-upYd3MTFCrSc_TuKh2Q.text: jayden!!! the bomb.  he's the best bartender. i think we sat at the bar for hours. we're coming back to tomorrow during his shift...just to see him again. so cool!

84gY8Rk0t9FpyrZMtwVIHQ.text: The food was Amazing just like our phenomenal server Stephen! The insane shakes were... well insane. If you are in Las Vegas you have to try this place! Stephen gave us wonderful recommendations and was very attentive and took great care of us.

z3XimDBb0_WpNu8aICXkzg.text: The goblets were amazing and they had a coupon where you buy an entree and get half off of a goblet. The drinks alcoholic and non alcoholic were really tasty. Overall very impressed. The entrees were pretty solid. My gf got the ny strip and it was amazing. I had the seafood platter and honestly it was ok not really worth the $34 they charge for the plate. There are other viable options on there but honestly this was a great place to eat and drink and has a great atmosphere

YEMoi8k4OERp1spqvjqZzA.text: We bought a groupon here for brunch ($59 for two for bottomless mimosas and $24 food voucher for each person) and ended up going into the lounge entrance instead of the main entrance. Needless to say, sitting in the lounge was the best thing we could have done.  Annemarie and Enrique served us and they were the best!!! They made sure we were well taken care of ( even if we were being "cheap" in vegas) and made sure we felt like we had the best service!!! I would definitely recommend and make sure you have one, or both, of them as your servers!!!

0WCamEbP6y5iZcjU00lWfA.text: I was really looking forward to visiting the Sugar Factory during my trip to Vegas. I went on a Tuesday around 1 PM and it wasn't packed at all. I sat at the bar and the server wasn't very attentive at all. She seemed very preoccupied and flustered but there was literally only a handful of people in the restaurant.   As for the food, I ordered the burger that had Mac and cheese on it. I substituted the beef patty for turkey. Overall, the burger was bland and the macaroni was average at best. The fries were delicious though!  I also ordered two shots and a goblet (what was I thinking?!) The goblet was very fruity and I only drank half and it got the job done. My bill came to $70 I believe but I had a groupon deal which knocked it down to $40. Pretty expensive but typical for Vegas.  I would definitely return, try something else on the menu, and probably sit at a table instead of the bar.

a0vKleC1q10hy1wMkALxHA.text: Love love love! Back in Minnesota there is no place similar to this at all. I opted for the Ocean Blue in the goblet and it's legit. I'm telling you guys, they do not cheap you out on the alcohol. Overall, it is pricey, but I will try to make my return and try some new drinks!  :)

GHsygi_LJHLWaOwVEfrK2g.text: Came here tonight and our waiter suggested we try the Passion Punch Goblet. It was really good! The atmosphere was fun and elegant. Food was great a bit pricey but the food proportions are pretty decent. Menz our waiter was very attentive and friendly! As well as all the staff that assisted us. Would definitely come back!

yhL7nItjmPYpqvlTkZ9_cQ.text: Huge disappointment. The grilled cheese was awful, the soup cold and the fries were flimsy. The food was overpriced and the quality hugely lacking.

fq4RZ97t3M8ladhwKy5fSQ.text: Two good things about this place was the managers were nice and the bussers were very attentive. Other than that it was very blah. The food was average the drinks were alright service was bad and the quality you would expect in a vegas brunch was not there especially with all the celebrities they have flashing on the wall I am sure they didn't serve Jamie Foxx French toast with the chocolate sauce in a plastic cup or molded strawberries overall disappointed my wife on her birthday

H7wf6wO3Mp-GhIOc6dyw0g.text: First of all, the goblets had 8 shots. 8! So yea... off to a good start. Manny is absolutely amazing!! Very attentive and sweet as can be! Appetizers (Mac lollipops and wings) were delicious! Music was on point as well. Will come back just for Manny!!

C1hPiOD7XC2X-z73_JXv1w.text: Pretty pricey even for vegas but the ambiance and presentation of the food and drinks were amazing. Definitely a tourist spot and worth trying once

drf_0ZeraSDkeEc0B0oa6A.text: Spent 5 days in Vegas, went to the Sugar Factory located at the Fashion Show Mall twice in one day. Once with the hubs and friends, got rainbow burgers (they were ok) and the brie with apple slices and crackers (Yum! But would choose something else over apple slices if possible. Breakfast portions are sweet and HUGE! Everything's delicious, not much else was memorable, but the commodity of it was awesome! Went the 2nd time as part of a Bachelorette party luncheon. Our server both times was Travis and he was AMAZING! Great customer service!!! That matters more than anything!

7nNwCnqliu0Q8r8NvIsJBQ.text: I love this place! Came here with my girlfriend and it's amazing! Got some burgers, goblet and a milkshake and all of it was great! Defiantly coming back!

dLzarudfWypSEgMzsW-uyQ.text: I literally have never wrote a bad review in my life so this is incredibly hard for me. As a local, I have been to sugar factory several times when it was at the sugar factory. for about 2 years, it was actual a frequent date night for me and my boyfriend so when they closed i definitely missed it. When I heard they were reopening another location at fashion show, I had to come and see it.  So I came tonight for my birthday. Let me say, the service was absolutely horrendous. Let me start this by saying it was a Wednesday and there were literally about 5 tables sat in the whole restaurant. It took approximately 10 minutes to get my drink order in and then an additional 20 minutes to even order my food. Throughout this time span, I watched my waiter stand and talk to his coworkers and continue to do his roll ups (as I'm assuming his shift was ending soon) instead of taking our food order.  I come to sugar factory mainly for their amazing desserts and I didn't even order one because I didn't want to wait another 20 minutes on my birthday for a dessert.  I will NEVER come to this restaurant again. And as a local who frequented here weekly when it was at the Paris, that's saying a lot. I even used my last bit of cash to pay the bill so I didn't have to wait for my card to get ran.  If you are a local or even a tourist looking for a place to eat, unless you have an hour and a half to spare on just waiting for your food and drink, I would go elsewhere.

ALNNAsZky0lT6H8S7MlNtQ.text: I've been here twice and both times USMNT's been great, service is sufficient, food is tasty and my kids love the exaggerated milk shakes. They taste delicious and it's like a meal-in-one. The sliders and burgers are delicious, the white chocolate burger is just what it sounds like, sweet and tasty.

Px6K7o6n_c4Z9Ux9CBP3Nw.text: Awesome time & such a fun atmosphere! I would definitely recommend coming for a birthday or anniversary, the sparkling candles are fab! Thank you to Chanell for being such a good waitress!

hnQsCI5hQH-KYBqmYKLaDg.text: Horrible service. Ordered burgers and shakes, pretty simple...burgers came out wrong, shakes did not arrive til we were all done with our meals. Asked for the shakes to go since they came out so late and then it took our server so long to get the to go cups we just ended up making them to go ourselves. We will never be back.

S0dxoFlRgfcuBWaFEA7sgA.text: My husband and I brought of kids to to Vegas to kick of summer vacay! Our kids are teens so they had certain spots they wanted to explore and try! My 13 yr old, Kylie and Drake obsessed wanted to try Sugar LOL so I found a great Groupon, pay $40 for $80 value. We were greeted at the front and choose to sit outside. Here's what we ordered  2 classic burgers- standard  Classic steak- boring, no flavor Nutella pancakes Garlic butter pasta- boring, very little flavor Garden salad Rainbow sliders Mac and cheese balls The dye milk shake Rocky road milkshake Watermelon goblet  Bill with Groupon and checkin on yelp, $180  The food was ok nothing wow..... The goblet, it was ok had a powder taste to it. I barely drank half and you don't even get to keep the goblet! For that much give me the dam cup!  So 2 star for food, if we come again I'd do the mac and cheese balls and desserts only.  Now, the service! Ugh! The waiter didn't really engage with us and tell us about the menu, the menu is huge so it would be great to get some help here! Then after we were done eating, we sat and waited for 30 mins, I just wanted the bill and saw the waiter taking everyone's order but never came over to see if we were okay or to check us out. Finally I went in and requested the bill. Which they finally brought out. I showed him my check in and Groupon. He rolled his eyes and said this is a process and takes a while I have to go upstairs and do it. WTF???? Don't have a check in and Groupon if you all can't figure it out! Another 15 min wait, comes back and gives me my bill to sign. Never once explains there's already gratuity added, but hands me the bill with the option for tip open. So I added the tip because again I had no idea it was there already! Ugh! So he got there mandatory tip they charge and an extra tip! Ugh!!! Then I had to even ask for a paper receipt as he wasn't going to even give me one. Service sucks! Mind you the restaurant was not even packed, not busy at all! Someone needs to train this waiter!

H6dvc3DGBMSdSCgkQhx7NA.text: Not a very good place. They ruined my birthday and didn't care. They were out of most of the stuff we ordered, and it was only 6:30pm. Kept trying to up sale us. Wouldn't sing Happy birthday since we didn't order dessert. I wanted the cheese cake ice cream but they were saving the cheese cake for only the milkshakes. Very disappointing.we did say we would pay for the birthday candle, but they wouldn't do it.

h0T7ZbsSC3upDMTkQILyow.text: Love it here first time being here with variety of food and drink. Great environment and the vibe is perfect . Come here when ur in Vegas . AMAZING

aBVGYo6fOZOpygfmFte56Q.text: WORST EXPERIENCE DURING MY STAY IN LAS VEGAS!!!! My fiance and I were walking by and thought the place was so cute so we decided to walk in and check it out, it was very empty, only us and another group. We were given a menu, and the waitress went over a few drinks with us. there was so many options but we didn't want any drinks we wanted a dessert, So we asked for strawberries with chocolate. Well I don't know for what reason but they wouldn't sell them to us. She left and came back saying they didn't have that, and didn't even offer us anything else!! and took the menu away!! Basically Asking us to leave for not buying a drink!! Funny part was that when we walked past the bar to walk out, we saw they clearly had strawberries right there. I don't understand for what reason she didn't want to dip a few in chocolate, the plater only includes 6 strawberries, it's not like I'm asking you to give me all the strawberries for the rest of the day. And I'm pretty sure you guys have chocolate. It's like you either by a drink or get out at this place, Or either they were too lazy to make some. This is the First and last time we come to this place.  NO, I do recommend this place to absolutely anyone, don't let the cute looks from outside fool you, the employees are rude and lazy!

x6-kZ30BFlHOEFL7QuGn-w.text: My boyfriend and I went in for a quick dessert. We waited for over 20 minutes because we didn't have a "reservation' at 4:30. They finally sat us and no one came for 10 minutes. When we ordered the server told us they were out so we ordered two more times for her to tell us we were out. Then we finally ordered and we waited for 45 minutes and nothing came so we had to leave because we were late for a show

u8RFhRMNub4ez5hUaPMW1g.text: The food was good and the service was great. The only reason I didn't give it five stars is cause it's noisy with loud music. That isn't for me personally. My wife and daughter were able to share the club sandwich and we got the chocolate fondu. Both were great.

zLUrPzK8NAX22bw72y-iPQ.text: My wife and I did not know that Sugar Factory was also a restaurant! We went into the candy store first, and it was striking. Got to see Chri$tina (that was on her name tag LOL) decorate the ice cream. It look straight out of Wreck It Ralph!!! She was sweet for letting us watch and interact. Roberto gave my wife a sample of strawberry cheesecake ice cream so we couldn't resist getting a scoop. The only odd thing about the store is that there are no pricing around, Yolanda was able to help us out very effectively. It was still a little inconvenient, but we were able to get through it. Otherwise, the service was what hit home for us. Would definitely come again and recommend just seeing how cute it is inside. Next time, we'll be coming back for some food and actual desserts!!

pgfR1t4Hd4gCzhxMYk5ypw.text: As I sit here at the Grand Luxe cafe I write this. We sat at Sugar Factory for 15 min on the patio with zero acknowledgment from our server. He walked past more then a few times and we saw he kept forgetting parts of orders and ignoring others as well. We then asked to move inside thinking perhaps it would be better. Nope. The hostess knew we hadn't been served outside thus should have alerted waitstaff but again we were ignored. Waitstaff walked by no acknowledgement. Out the door we went. Hostess unfazed. Never again. Place was not full by any means either.  Update! 2/2/19 My husband and I had a wonderful meal today. Justin was a great server very courteous and attentive. Probably one of the best bennies I've had. SF may very well be our go to instead of Hexx for brunch or brekky

6hXSkTWao78OK3qhUe_k0w.text: First time in the Vegas location it was amazing! The food was great and the drinks amazing.!

vIpMTVKI4l6XNHU-_pkbTQ.text: Delicious drinks and deserts! This place is fun and reminded me of candy land. I can't wait to go back and try different menus items. I do wish there was a little more liquor in our drink. It was 60oz and I felt nothing.

iI5CdysxOzcEObDUIz7Ulw.text: Great drinks!!! We wanted something sweet and with the right amount of alcohol and this place was just the thing. We got the drake and the peach mango bowls. They were great! Our server recommended them from all the different varieties. We also go the sampler platter to snack on while we ate. We loved the atmosphere and the service! gu7QrTyMTY4W2nSxaVixvg.text: Only thing enjoyable here was the decor and extravagant drinks. Food is EXTREMELY overpriced for what you get, and it tastes horrible!! Waitress was very sweet, but this is the "grilled cheese" my aunt ordered for $17. She kindly asked for a new one, and by the time the new one was made we were all done with our food and she never got a chance to eat it. Disappointing to say the least, come for the drinks and get food elsewhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

M0pzlNBR27LHj0cgsqszxA.text: My wife and I had never been to the sugar factory so we wanted to try it out. We weren't too hungry so I ordered the spinach dip which was pretty good! My wife had a club sandwich. The kicker is their club comes with avocado which paired really well with the sandwich, now i feel like it's a must have for me on a club.   We also tried the goblet drink called the "Drake". They fill your goblet with peach candies, dry ice, and cotton candy and pour "60oz" of liquor over it for the show. I highly doubt it's really 60oz. It may be 24oz that fills up a 60oz goblet because all the candy and Ice in the goblet. The drink was very good but my wife and I finished it without a buzz at all. In my opinion not worth the $45 bucks but it's a cool show and it taste good.

-2C6n9D7c4eK7HSiqwiKZA.text: It's an $20 burger in a basket. Granted the burger was tasty. The price and the presentation don't fit together. The music is so loud you can barely hear yourself think or talk to anyone you are with. The main dining room is super dark in the middle but the surrounding seating has good lighting, so it's alittle odd that the middle is so dark. Our server was incredibly friendly. The coconut and watermelon martini were very good so that was a plus:

p6NqO8gPtgdDYMXn4_X7eg.text: This place is AWESOME! My group and I had such a great experience. Our waiter Jason made my friends birthday such a fun and memorable experience. 5/5 rating!!!! Love the atmosphere and always ask for Jason!!!!

Our employees thoroughly enjoyed themselves and the event went as smooth as can be. 5 Stars and high recommendation from this Yelper!

PciNXz1_oBdscer94cRYjw.text: Such a fun experience. Drinks big enough to share. Fun atmosphere. Tons of birthdays being celebrated. Rainbow burgers were very tasty.

zmxVnaVSifY9ebo44Se62Q.text: I don't normally write reviews but this place was so terrible I had to.  First of all I made the mistake of believing the positive reviews of this place.  I bought a Groupon for my family that included bottomless mimosas and food credit.  It took an hour to get the first mimosa. The food was so overpriced for what it was. (garbage) Our server Richard B., only saw him maybe twice the entire time.  Eggs Benedict came out with no hollandaise. Other entrees came out cold.  What hurt the most was the 18% on the bill of four people. This guy got a guaranteed 40$ tip for doing a terrible job.   This place was an atrocious experience for Fathers Day and I will do whatever I can to encourage people never to go here.

cErUNeoivjHWnGEo5Tw9YQ.text: All time FAVORITE spot! Their goblets are so amazing. Now that they moved locations we don't go too often but when we do, we always go all out. Part of their new menu item they added was the rainbow sliders... delicious! We went with a group of 6 recently to celebrate 2 birthdays and had an amazing time. There's a dj that plays live music and the environment is so fun! Our server Manny was so generous and kind, he had a great energy and enthusiasm. The menu has soooo many choices. Must try items... white chocolate burger, the Mac and cheese burger, chicken Alfredo pasta, ALL the goblets!! The drake is one of my favorites. The desserts are something else. The presentation of the food is so cute and well thought out. I can't wait to visit again!

MZFvf_QCN9cw6MBf10R0Tw.text: The hubs made us come here.  We ordered a choco fondue.  Totally over priced for the food we got but what isn't in Vegas?  Nicely decorated.  The kids had fun dipping their delectables in gooey chocolate so the overall experience was fun.

zOhkjfp1zgZBOPM0tfHhDg.text: Omg! This was place to die for they have the best ice cream shake ever. If you ever want to do your birthday you should come here they offer a ice cream bowl with 24 different scoop of ice cream flavor and they come out with sparkler on the ice cream. They also have fish bowls with different gummy flavors mixed with the drink along with liquor mixed in with the drink. This place gives you a chance to act like a kid in a candy store it was awesome!

WWAIS-rqDILt6wCYbyzPlg.text: I was really excited to go here for the first time because i've seen so many amazing photos and people posting about it. we arrived and asked to be seated outside because it was super crowded inside. we waited outside for at least 30 minutes with no server and no drinks. We then went and got the hostess and she assured us she was getting our server and she was coming. another 15/20 minutes pass by and still nothing. they were not apologetic at all and we literally just walked out. This was the worst experience and i am EXTREMELY disappointed.

UDGztd3w_vciBevMWbEXSA.text: What a cool place. Just had a large group dinner there last night and really enjoyed myself.   Started the night off with the Virginia Strawberry Lemonade goblet. It came out smoking with gummy bears and all kinds of cAndy. Dinner was the breakfast burger, which was equally awesome.   Finally the table got a King Kong Sundae. Oh my it was amazing. 24 scoops of ice cream smothered in whip cream, all kinds of sauce, topped with donuts, cookies, cupcakes, suckers , and ice cream cones. Insane  Staff was awesome. Really nice restaurant.   Definitely try for something good.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. King Kong ain&#39;t got nothing on this sundae.

wPmCqyhatfaWuUP0M48RBw.text: I've been putting off this review because I just don't want to have to rehash this visit. My daughter turned 21 and we came here for dinner to kick off a fun night on the Strip. Two problems quickly arose. One: The waiter was clearly uninterested in actually serving us. I felt the entire time like he was put out by having to take our order. God forbid he bring the drinks we ordered or the condiments requested (I don't think asking for mustard for a burger is absurd but I gave up after asking twice and still not getting it). Fortunately they brought my sisters wine after she asked a second time... maybe because they can charge her for the drink? The second problem: The food was the same quality as Denny's. Now I love me some Denny's, but at Denny's prices. This was a late dinner and everyone in our party was hungry, but I don't think anyone actually finished their meal.   Now, if you were going just for drinks and dessert, you'd have a good (but pricey) experience maybe. I had a drink that tasted like a root beer float and it was absolutely delicious. I don't remember what it was called but everyone in our party did love their drinks.   The drinks are the only good thing about this place. As I mentioned, it was my daughter's birthday. We told the hostess that when booking the table. Never said anything to the despondent waiter (honestly, his attitude was that of someone who just lost a loved one but still showed up to work. If he weren't such a jerk later, I would have started to think there was something seriously wrong with him).   Anyway, after we un-finished our meals, a small bowl of ice cream with a truly spectacular sparkler flaming out the top was brought to my daughter. I thought, ok, this is making up for the crappy meal! My daughter had a smile on her face and that's all any parent wants.   And then the bill came. $400 for 8 of us was expected. $10 for the small bowl of ice cream was not. We didn't order it. And if we were going to order a dessert, we would have chosen something we actually wanted. I don't want to be the asshole haggling over a few bucks when the bill was so high, but that was my breaking point. We were all kind of shocked that we were charged a birthday bowl of ice cream when we never asked for it, and my sister approached the waiter about it. He claims that it is the standard charge for birthdays and "someone" told him to add it. We asked, "Was it anyone in our group?" And he couldn't remember. A manager came out and also insisted it was the standard charge and someone asked for it but again couldn't identify who that was.   It was a truly frustrating conversation. So I told my sister, "Forget it, I have a Yelp account."  And that's when the waiter lost it. He said he "doesn't appreciate threats" and "doesn't want to argue over $10 on a $400 ticket." I agree, it's a stupid argument but don't charge me for something we didn't order.   They eventually removed the $10 charge.   Perhaps if the service were remotely decent or the food actually tasty, I could have overlooked it. We went to a fairly extravagant (to me) dinner and I was looking forward to getting Instagram-worthy pics. Literally half our group have been servers at one time. We are all very generous tippers and are forgiving of busy, overworked servers. But this guy was an ass. And the food sucked. And they charged $10 for a small bowl of ice cream that we didn't ask for. And it definitely didn't kick off a 21st birthday like we had hoped.

PVPbTntbPdYWv6qDmvkh8A.text: I'm really glad we had a Groupon and didn't pay full price.  I'll start with the pros:  the music is awesome! The drinks are tasty.  The onion rings are good.  The desserts looked amazing!  We did  not have dessert though so I can't tell you if they are as good as they look.  The cons.  Service sucked.  My date had the burger with Mac and cheese on it, I don't think Mac and cheese belongs on a burger, but he thought it would be good.  So he ordered it and said it was "ok" not worth the price for sure.  I had the steak sandwich, comes with onion broth and fries.  The sandwich was very small and not worth the $24 price tag!  The broth didn't come out with my sandwich and the server finally stopped by so I could ask for it and when I got it, it was flavorless.    I was excited to try this place sadly I wish we went somewhere else!  We won't be back.  I suggest if you're going to go, go for drinks and dessert and have dinner somewhere else.

IVY9Lrdnbdxmvriecc39gQ.text: We came with so much expectations from IG feeds and we were not disappointed. The crew on duty was fantastic, seated promptly and service from start to finish on point! The gal at the candy shop was a great help with our purchases. Drinks looked glorious and tasted superbly delicious from a mother's point of view. Food was good too but the mini burger sliders was a good looking meal!  Justin, our server is very helpful with our order, attentive, has good chemistry with my kids, carefully listening to their questions and returning with an dramatic diaplay of liquid nitrogen in the drink goblets. My kids loved every minute of it and wanted to come back for more! Justin, thank you for the kind and upbeat personality of yours!

Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our server Justin
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XlSzBEcXavCSMOHztekABQ.text: We went to the Fashion Show Mall and hadn't decided where we were going to have lunch. While walking outside we stopped by Sugar Factory. They were offering a deal with a percentage off if you ate outside on the patio. It was too humid so we went inside.  The inside had lots of flair, from its candy shoppe at the front, to its bright wall and booth padding, mirrors and chandeliers galore. They had a bar where you could sit and they prepped all the goblet drinks. It was neat viewing it from our table next to it. It was a little loud inside which bothered my son a bit.  It did take a rather long time but at least they had a kids coloring sheet and crayons to offer. My husband decided on a chicken sandwich, I decided on the strawberry brioche French toast, my son ordered the Mac n cheese appetizer, and we got the Giggles Snickers Milkshake. The food was very tasty though and had generous portions. My husband enjoyed the bun and said the chicken was moist and flavorful. He enjoyed the salty and crispy fries. My French toast was sweet, savory, and rich indulgence! It was covered in all sorts of berries. My son wasn't a huge fan of the Mac n cheese but I thought it was tasty. It came with a tomato soup type sauce to dip it in. All of us were pleased with the giant milkshake. They showed us how to scoop up the Snickers and sprinkles in the chocolate ganache along the side. It came with a full Snickers bar on top too!  We left the restaurant with some leftovers. While it was a little more on the pricey side than we normally spent, it still was fairly reasonable for the portions and taste. It was a fun experience. I would love to try one of the ginormous goblets next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JnnpOfMSqHYi5RIMp8rOIg.text: This place is definitely hyped. I've had this spot bookmarked for some time and was delighted to finally check out this Vegas trip.   We came on a Sunday night and it was EMPTY! There were about three people at the bar, two tables, and us. We honestly just came to try their goblet drinks.   They have a large drink menu with no prices written on them.   We ordered one lollipop passion goblet and it was good but really really simple. And then we get the bill and it's $42. We are from LA. Our "goblets" aka fish bowls cost $18-$25 and not just filled up with mixers. Granted I guess they charge that much because their candy and lollipops are so expensive. *sarcasm*   Service was okay. Server didn't seem like she was too thrilled to be there. Apparently a bunch of celebrities come here and it's probably because they don't think twice about having to order 3 of their $40 goblets to get a nice buzz going.    Didn't try their desserts or food since their hype was on the drinks. The drinks were simple, expensive, and left much to be desired. But they certainly put on a nice show with the dry ice. Good for pictures.

xYOUm10v2ekSGzNWOgHw2g.text: 8-27-18 As a local I'm always laughing at the people running around with the 3 foot long drinks. But for my birthday the other day I decided okay just this once + I found a great Groupon. So we got 2 duckie 3 foot long drinks. Honestly not being huge drinkers we could have shared one and not finished it. But it was fun and made for great photos!  I would recommend to friends in town on vacation!

I mean I know it's Vegas, but seriously? Waiter was nice, and didn't rush us when we came in close to closing. But probably won't be returning.. 5Xy_1s-w3CbIAnxr3DlkWg.text: We came here for my nieces 13 birthday. The food was decent and the drinks were fun and delicious. The reason I am giving 3 stars is because they don't list the price of the drinks. I guess I should have asked but when we ordered 3 drinks it would have been nice for someone to mention that they were $40-$50 a drink. It was overpriced for what we got. I could go somewhere else and have a comparable meal for substantially less. It was a great experience but I won't go back. The ambiance is fun, and our waitress was great! I just can't get over the price  Round two. My best friend and I came back. I ordered the Mac burger she ordered the veggie burger. Her veggie was good. Her fries were gross. My burger I ordered medium well. It comes out like straight charcoal. My fries were decent. They have our waiter swamped. Completely unenjoyable. I won't be back. They tried to accommodate me with a coupon. It was not worth it at all. I could go to in n out and get two amazing burgers for half the price of what I'd spend here.

8ocUi2FWWGfCM69CAemG9g.text: Upon arriving to the Sugar Factory my fiancee and I both received horrible customer service as we were not greeted correctly nor professionally before entering into the doors of the establishment on our own to then be greeted by a young caucasian woman that previously just ignored the fact that we were entering to the establishment. 9UOi3ov9xlNgHC29OPwwzA.text: We showed up early so we were one of the first parties seated. I really enjoyed the Sunday Brunch. The portions were generous. I really liked the Manhattan eggs Benedict! This is definitely a fun Vegas experience restaurant. The service was prompt and attentive. We enjoyed just hanging out and finishing our gigantic mimosas.
