WSgoShBKK7FGXSgNvjTn4w.text: Customer service: We had a reservation for 5:30 pm. We called to say we would be ten minutes late due to traffic and they accommodated us. We were seated right away when we arrived. Jade! You did an excellent job attending to our reservation of 20 girls. He was timely and if we needed something he didn't make a face when we asked. He was quick and efficient.   Ambiance: I love the decor here and the theme of the restaurant. I wish the lights on the chandelier could have been a little bright it looked really dark for a restaurant. Besides that it was a packed Saturday night and we had a great time.   Food: Of course it's Vegas and anything on the strip is pricey. We expected it but I wish the food was more flavorful than it was. I checked in and received a free bruschetta appetizer which was delicious. Also had onion rings and the breading was perfect and the sauce that came along with it as well. The chicken alfredo was okay. We paid extra for chicken and I think there was 5 pieces in the dish. The food came out at a reasonable time. The surprise birthday sparklers are $5 and $5 for ice cream which I think is overpriced but again I wanted the experience for the birthday girl and got a cute pic!   Drink: I had to get the goblet as we were celebrating a 21st birthday so it was a must! We chose Energy Bear and it was perfect because I did not want to get anything too sweet. They are $39 and have a variety of choices. Make sure to ask about taste if you're unsure. They also tell you the most popular goblets.

MuZmDkKNGYzFw7cIQkyiGg.text: So we start off the meal with a Grape crush and a Raspberry Sin...  Good choice for a thirst quencher. Both tasty and perfect for a pre game libation.  My fiance orders the Grilled Chicken Breast sandwhich and I, the signature Sugar Factory Burger.  The chicken sandwhich must have been good. I believe I saw sparks coming off of the better halfs plate.. And not word spoken...   WOW....I can honest say. One of the best burgers around. Great sear on burger to keep it juicy inside. Perfect crunch with the pickles, and a smooooooth brioche bun.   In all, I will return or eat another location when EVER possible...

yebdQahTpJXF1Le8eqWBiQ.text: Service was really good & there was no wait when we arrived ... recommend the sampler platter and also the rainbow sliders

iKyiNMpONmRbGc1r0Yi8-w.text: First of all Manny is amazing!!  Not only was his knowledge of the menu great but his energy was incredible.  Choosing the right goblet was a bit overwhelming...especially since they all look good...but he was great at assisting with not only drink options but meal options.   The food was pretty tasty. Small portions...which is good considering that the drinks are huge.   I would definitely would be coming back next time I'm in Vegas  Thanks Manny!!!

m-0vBLKP2wHbJntv8zbwng.text: My first time at the Sugar Factory and I totally fell in love. The service was great from our patio host, Richard. He was very attentive to our needs, offered recommendations, and accommodated a table of 5 very opinionated women. I ordered the tomato bisque soup, which was good, nothing spectacular. It came with 3 mini pieces of cheese toast, which was really good! For my entree I ordered the ribeye steak, asparagus, and mashed potato dinner. Here's the reason for the 4 stars instead of 5. I expressed to Richard that I wanted the steak medium and NOT pink. Richard assured me that he understood exactly what I wanted. Well suffice it to say, the steak was pink but had an awesome flavor. I asked Richard to have the kitchen cook it just a bit longer and so after waiting for about 15 minutes, the steak arrive red instead of pink. Even Richard had a look of bewilderment on his face. And so with that look and my steak in hand he took the to his manager. The manager apologized and offered to comp my steak dinner, suggested that I ordered something else at no charge and have a cocktail. They reaaaaaaaaaally know how to rectify a problem. I declined on ordering another entree but enjoyed a nice glass of wine. Overall, I plan to return with my husband and children to enjoy this experience.

gOYUUieGN7k3RwNz0cGEVQ.text: Annemarie was amazing! I brought my niece and we both had beautiful, fun, drinks and our server made the experience so entertaining! We will come back to hang with AnneMarie! Apps were delish as well! Fist time but not the last!

5LKcqK0VYo2-Dkf9zmXBOQ.text: I went here on Monday evening with my friend. We wanted to go have drinks and something to eat since our job has been pretty stressful. Wanting to stay close to the strip, we decided on trying out Sugar Factory since neither of us had been since they opened up at this location, but we had been when they were still in the Paris.  We had a reservation for 6pm, but arrived about 15 minutes early. We were greeted right away, and sat promptly. The host was very nice. The decor of the restaurant is so cute and French bistro-like. I love the black, white, and red color scheme.  The menu is pretty large with tons of drink and food options. It took us a little while to decide on what we wanted, and our server was very patient. We ended up getting the mac and cheese pops, 2 Caesar salads, and we split 3 goblet drinks (2 of the lollipop ones and a Gummi one). The goblets were so yummy and cute, just like we remembered. We were here for a little over 3 hours, and the staff was cool about it. My friend said that we would finish our drink and head out soon, but the manager who was by us said no, stay and enjoy as long as you want. That was really nice! The only thing I would improve was the size of the salad. It was kind of small and I am glad we each got our own instead of sharing.  I will definitely come back to this cute place!

4LCI26jNyoUzcvuIJ9RsmA.text: The Sugar Factory is such a cute and very popular hot spot, especially in Vegas!  I visited here with my family during our annual Las Vegas trip and it was fun for the experience. To be quite honest, the food was a little bit of a let down. In my opinion this place is overly hyped, which lead me to have high expectations for their food.  They do have really interesting desserts and drinks, but their food tastes mediocre. I wouldn't claim it to be the best I have ever tasted, but it wasn't horrible.  I'd definitely recommend the Sugar Factory if you're looking for a fun night out, and are wanting to try something new! Take lots of pictures because the food (especially their milkshakes) are picture worthy, but don't overestimate the quality of their food.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zV3Aq6dqECNZL6BHGFzQkw.text: Everything was wonderful. Chaz is an excellent server. He recommended great dishes and his smile was gorgeous. I am still dreaming of WHITE CHOCOLATE. It does not always have to be chocolate!!!

yBI4eQCRLhI8wsPTRwOW4A.text: Was so excited to take my niece here after seeing the on line photos. What a WASTE of money! The food is terrible and overpriced for the drinks.  There were four of us and no one was impressed.

dv5Fm47NGyIbIrFQMqXCJQ.text: Ok, I understand the hype and why this place is so famous but to be honest with you their food is not worth the price. They are very expensive. On top of that I had to wait over 45 minutes to get my food and the restaurant wasn't even busy at all, I feel like they just forgot to put our orders in and we were just sitting there waiting for a long time. I don't recommend this place if you are there to get a meal. Their desserts look amazing though, I would go there only to split a milkshake probably. I didn't order dessert because after waiting for 45 minutes for food I was afraid to order anything else. I also think it's pathetic how much they advertise the celebrity visitors, most famous restaurants have celebrity guests, there is no need to have 8 pages on their menu showing pictures of them, it's stupid. Anyway, go here for dessert, don't waste your money on their entrees.

aJ-aVVqkgftluNDNU81bTw.text: I truly enjoyed dinner here because the atmosphere and ambiance of the place was so delightful. Everyone seemed to be enjoying there time. Laughs all through restaurant. Not to mention the gobblers with the alcohol they were em em good.

AkCJsWl8fZ3xf2wIAzBvSA.text: Finally made it to this place and I left disappointed. First of all after sitting for over 15 minutes we had to flag someone down to get service. Everyone kept walking by our table and not once stopped to ask if we wanted to start with drinks or appetizers. I ordered a Turkey burger and fries the burger I didn't really care for, the fries were pretty good. I also ordered a side salad, it barely had any lettuce and had way too many cucumbers in it. The mimosa was decent. I bought a small scoop of ice cream on the way out it was $3.50 kinda expensive since the cup was tiny. This is the type of restaurant you need to visit only once. B8HxW3Ek_iLrdnEXVF6pZA.text: I was not expecting to receive such phenomenal service here. They really blew me away. Thank you for making my daughter feel like a princess on her 4th birthday.   Sugar Factory is a cute and lively spot with over-the-top drinks and shakes. Sure, you'll be paying strip prices and the food is standard quality for a chain restaurant, but the crazy shakes and desserts are actually pretty good value. The crazy shake I ordered had a slice of cheesecake, a huge rainbow lollipop, a sugar daddy, and the mug was huge! The shake itself was actually quite delicious, it tasted like homemade ice cream, which was surprising. I think that's worth the $19.   But really, the service was impeccable. The staff was so kind and thoughtful. I will definitely be returning for dessert because of the wonderful time we had.  *update: after trying shakes at a different, new establishment on the strip that's known for their crazy shakes, Sugar Factory is my first choice. SF shakes are a couple dollars more but worlds better when it comes to taste. Can't wait to go back!

PzR5qMmOwkrZzutp1lK2Vg.text: Really hyped up, but it's not too too bad. The drinks are good, but they are mostly ice. For the price tag I expected more, but overall it was a decent experience. It looks cool and it is worth at least visiting to see the show they put on making the drink, but it isn't a regular stop.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside

JMStxHQFHQ85UlCV5PsP9A.text: Went for a friend's birthday. We had reservations at 7:45pm and the table was already ready when we got there. Our server was friendly and gave us plenty of food and drink recommendations from the menu. He was pretty attentive through the night, which was really nice. We were seated at a booth and there was a bright light that was making everyone really hot. There wasn't enough air coming to our corner so most of us were sweating through our dinner.   On to dinner - I know this is on the strip and the prices are expected to be pretty inflated but man, oh man, they really get you here. I ordered the Chinese chicken salad which was priced at $17. The picture on the menu showed a plate stacked high with chicken and wontons. What I got was a soup bowl filled with cabbage. It looked like one of those pre-chopped bags of salad you can get from Walmart. No wontons or roasted peanuts, like the menu said it had and only a couple chunks of diced chicken, not slices like the picture. Flavorwise, it was ok. I also ordered a virgin Caramel macchiato "martini", which was $15. The drink was tasty but it was topped with a thick whipped cream which made it hard to drink the actual drink. I actually spilled on myself while drinking it because the whipped cream was too thick on the side I sipped from and it leaked off the side. I ended up using my water straw to cut through the whipped cream to get to the drink itself and had more than half a glass full of whipped cream leftover.   The atmosphere was fun, the music was blaring and some folks even danced around their tables. It seemed a bit hectic at times, with staff dropping glasses and dishes through the night. Would possibly go again but not really in a hurry to.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Screenshot of my caramel macchiato &#34;martini.&#34; Whipped cream was super thick and made it hard to drink.

f1RXoX_WZSkmZI7AB-DCNQ.text: Whew, overpriced and hype!!! Is this a fun and cute restaurant that makes you wanna eat and drink hella candy, yes! But $40 goblets bruh?? I'll pass. Ain't no drink in the world going to make me pay $40 for it LOL! I had a cotton candy cosmopolitan and the shrimp alfredo and both were delicious. However, the pasta was small, literally looked like an appetizer for $30. I was left hungry. There's a candy and ice cream shop in the front which is also hella overpriced. The scoops are $6 a damn piece... Please.  Our waitress was very attentive and helpful and the manager also was present in the dining area meeting with guest.  This place has a weird obsession with the Kardashian family, there's TVs inside that show the celebrities that have been Sugar Factories and literally almost every picture was a Kardashian or their baby daddies. I'm sure this place was more edxpensive than other locations because it's located on the strip so I will go to a different location when I'm ready to return.  Plenty of free parking located behind the Fashion Show. Check Groupon before you go!

TIP: As a bonus this location gave us complimentary cotton candy exclamation and they were big puffs of cotton candy.

-tBUds9poRWP7-IwDnffaw.text: Came here for breakfast/brunch this past weekend with 3 of my friends.   The menu is extensive and the food was pretty tasty. I had the eggs, bacon, hashbrowns (yummmm!), and toast. Ate almost every bite. We had limitless mimosas. They were very juicy as in not much champagne but they were fine.   The service was terrible except one bright spot which I'll speak about in a minute. Took us asking 4 people for ketchup including my friend getting up and asking two servers who were just socializing if they could find ketchup for her. They were annoyed, said yes but did not. It shouldn't take us asking 4 (!!!!) times to receive. We weren't checked on at times for 20-25 mins. When we received the bill and wanted it split, it took 20 mins for us to see someone again and then to find out my friend was charged double what the receipt she was given. Just lazy and they don't seem to care about their customers. Two stars notched off for that.   The bright spot was Sadie, one of the hostesses. We were seated right next to her station and SHE was the one who would notice when we didn't get something we asked for and would retrieve it. Multiple times!!!! She was awesome and so sweet. She's what saved this from being a 2 star review. Get it together, Sugar Factory! Promote Sadie!

NDzedl9-ces-oEhShgtdDw.text: Ok this review is extremely important. We had exceptional service from Carla at this location. Not only was she amazing with my kids, she made them feel like super stars! The food is so good here and the deserts, forgetaboutittttt! This place is a sight to see and experience and my kids will always remember their fun time in Vegas at the sugar factory!

oiOPNA9yEnlPOU0DLoo5tA.text: My family really enjoyed this place.  This was on the bucket list of the family to do when we visited Las Vegas.  This is definitely an experience.  The servers were real nice we even showed up around shift change.  The food tasted great and they have interesting selections.  I always like trying new things.  We got one of the goblets (i was hesitant due to not being a drinker and the price) and that was a neat experience.  Be ready to leave stuffed.  When we come back to town we will definitely make this a return visit.

XklBH7CEqNBVT4DL7WR24w.text: Came here for a smoking goblet while in town and, WOW, what a cute experience. From the restaurant layout to the actual menu, Sugar Factory is heaven for anyone with a sweet tooth. There's also plenty of places to stop and take pictures around the restaurant, which is cool.   We came during lunch. There were quite a few people, but we were able to sit upstairs without waiting. There's a great view of the Strip from up there, whether you opt to sit inside or out.   We ordered the Lollipop Passion goblet, the Grape Crush cocktail, and a mixed drink. These drinks, as sugary as they are, were reasonably strong. We noticed the shakes after ordering, unfortunately, or we would've probably snatched one of those up, too.  Yes, drinks and food are pricey, but that's honestly to be expected with the decor and theme of Sugar Factory. A goblet runs ~$30-$40. They know how to make that dry ice last! We had our drink for almost an hour, and it smoked the whole time. Food portions are on the smaller end. We didn't try the food, but we might just have to next time!

sGxkmfRisaZ7y-4iJt9Q6w.text: This place is really good I really like their Big Cheesy burger its the best burger ever that they have.   the atmosphere was very quiet I like it because it was silent the whole time me and my parents were there eating and drinking.   the service was really good our server was nice to us and she even let us put my shake into a to-go cup.   I would like to come here every time for my birthday.

p5ZRCRVPd5aBIbYrDltw5g.text: I saw videos of this place and was super excited to try their drinks and see the candy shop. We got two goblet drinks: Lollipop Passion & Fuzzy Peach Penguin Mango. Thankfully, they offer the drinks without alcohol because our waiter said it was about 6 shots in each drink.   The Lollipop Passion was green and was topped with two lollipop sticks and sugar candies. It tasted mostly like coconut, but it also has small hints of melon and pineapple. It wasn't great. The Fuzzy Peach Penguin Melon tasted straight up like orange soda, even though it was supposed to be peachy and mangoy. They had some gummy penguins in the ice and orange slices on the edge of the goblet. It was great and exciting seeing the dry ice working with the drink, but towards the bottom my drink froze and I couldn't drink the last inch of it. As fun and childish the drink was, it was insanely expensive. $34 for each goblet!! We didn't even get alcohol in ours, so I thought maybe it wouldn't be so expensive. I guess you really just pay for the dry ice and show.  This is a fun place to try once. Get ready for a big bill at the end!

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gummy candies in the Fuzzy Peach Penguin Mango

bg0I4tZO1M7sjq6hud4kcw.text: The drinks are good, expensive, but good. I ordered "The Drake", it was supposed to come with strawberry lemonade cotton candy, but it only came with strawberry. Then they poured the drink over it and it melted. The picture showed the drink inside with the cotton candy on top, so I assumed that's what I get. Any who, the drink was still good.   The food on the other hand was not good and it was expensive. I couldn't find anything I was interested in on the menu and landed on the sampler platter. The macaroni and cheese balls were gross and cold and you could taste the freezer burn in the onion rings. The chicken strips and buffalo wings were pretty good. I might return for a drink, but not the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sampler Platter

LMaVUzQtnE19ny4YrjorHw.text: I got a goblet with my sister it was pretty good I think it's overpriced just paying for the dry ice wow factor. Would I get it again though probably. The place gets pretty packed with families that have young children instead of waiting we opted to sit at the bar. The bartender was really friendly and checked on us to make sure we were happy with the drink.

bMuirkJ3pEWfJ_9VA4kbbw.text: Glad to say I came but I most likely won't be returning.   The Sugar Factory isn't your average candy shop. They are commonly known for being widely endorsed by celebrities and the ginormous 60oz signature Goblets. With it being so widely popular, there are multiple Sugar Factory locations worldwide ranging from Las Vegas, NYC, Chicago, Orlando, Dubai, and even Manila.   After numerous trips to Las Vegas and my IG constantly being riddled by drool worthy images of SF, I was pretty bummed at the fact that I have never gotten the chance to experience it first hand. This most recent visit changed all of that......  Our party arrived and was told there would be a wait for a table but if we didn't mind sitting at the bar, we could be seated right away. No harm no foul since our only reason for stopping by was for the infamous goblets.  Be advised that the once glass goblets are now plastic and being the picky person that i am, scratched up plastic fishbowls were not appealing whatsoever.   Instead we opted for 3 martinis: LEMON HEAD- described as "lemon with a hint of sweetness" WATERMELON BURST- "crisp taste of watermelon" SOUR APPLE LOLLY- "liquefied sour apple lollipop"  Overall experience- the cost is waaay too expensive for something that simply tasted soooo sooooooo bad and the portions are definitely skimpy. One added star for the nice gentleman who helped us out and insisted on my little sister looking like his cousin. LMAO.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FSEsrGxlkNq5LovwWZhk_A.text: Myself and 2 friends visited this location on Sunday, March 31st. We sat at the bar outside and had Jeremias as our bartender. He was attentive, knowledgeable, extremely personable and just a lot of fun. We ordered 2 of the Goblets- the Fuzzy Peach Penguin Mango and the Lollipop Passion minus the coconut. Not only were both drinks absolutely delicious, the overall experience provided by Jeremias was a definite highlight of my first trip to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3-00_gtfmHHyPF9XKFmL-g.text: Our first time at Sugar Factory. I'll admit we came strictly for the drinks. I got the White Gummie and my wife got a Hot & Sweet something or other. They were really good but froze fast. We did end up eating, the onion rings as an appetizer were really good. I got the fettuccine and added shrimp and jalapenos omg SO GOOD. That was the waiters suggestion. My wife got the club sandwich vegetarian style and was satisfied. The atmosphere was very fun. We'd go back!

EHaOKJPfLg_qr0zKbpFCsQ.text: Sugar Factory is known for its goblets and rainbow sliders. I would give it 5 stars, but the reason why I'm only giving it 4 stars is because they were out of rainbow sliders. How can you be out of rainbow sliders at like 12pm?! On the plus side, The "Lollipop Passion" goblet was yummy! I wish I could try all of them, but those things are ginormous!!

VfTWhH18oMA24I-sce84Hg.text: My husband and I had such a great time here last weekend! They recently have opened, and have not even had their grand opening yet. The place is so cute and beautifully decorated. Everyone was very friendly and inviting at our 11am arrival. I ordered breakfast and my husband ordered lunch. Also, a killer milkshake! (Over the top maybe but so fun and worth it! I swear we talked about it for weeks) Our food was great, server was great, talked to a manager who was very friendly and informative. Looking forward to returning!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Milkshake from heaven! Yes waffle in all!
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful inside

-SLCJwqEUcgWB6SUB3JU7A.text: This was something on mine and my girls bucket list when we came to Vegas... I don't know if we came at the wrong time or what... But it was mediocre asssfff. The food was OK... The mac & cheese bites were the best thing that we ordered. The service was crappy. Dude was nice and all but we literally watched him stand in the middle of the dining room floor texting. Not a good look. The drink is obviously supposed to be sweet and for show- but for the amount of money, you would think two smaller sized women would at least feel a buzz after sharing a whole goblet. But nope- it was basically like drinking a gallon of Kool-Aid. I would go again with someone who has never gone before because it's definitely cool to see the drink get poured over the dry ice but other than that... not too impressed.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HbiGAoybksgxIDGxpwSlEQ.text: My friend and I went to sugar factory after a long day and shared my buffalo chicken sandwich that was amazing!! They even split the baskets for us so we each had half the sandwich and fries! :) we also got a cookie jar sundae and it was really good!!! Thanks to Manny for offering to split our food when we said we were sharing and for the amazing hospitality!!! will definitely be back

A1zyNXogYGB0ZTEa9JBKOQ.text: Manny was our waiter and was awesome and deserves 5 stars! We really enjoyed the atmosphere there and the special drinks. The food I'd give 3 stars. It was mediocre but to be honest all the food we had in Vegas this trip was mediocre.

40Fa1PdFpYk7w15HYKoMCg.text: The experience there was not what I expected. Service is horrible. Place is very unsanitary and the food presentation was horrible. To kill it the food was not tasteful for the prices they ask. If you're looking for a quick picture it's cool but expect a big bill for amateur drinks, food and service.

OnlFeeImrsNh-6RBh8IDEw.text: When we came here a month ago, we were not happy with our experience with the service. We decided to give Sugar Factory another chance and really enjoyed it this time. The service was excellent and prompt. The experience is so fun seeing all the fun drink concoctions go by and overall it was a festive experience. The food was pretty good too.

qKtOz-5M2_bB_Fow7lWmRg.text: The Sugar factory was AMAZING! The food portions were enormous and the drinks were SUPERB! I can't wait to visit Vegas just so that I can go back to this spot.

rn-DwOTcEbFSXJeXKhPGLw.text: Giving three stars really disappoints me after this much anticipated visit. When we were in Vegas last year, the Sugar Factory restaurants were closed. We were able to get one of the goblet drinks at their location in the Miracle Mile. When planning our trip for this year, I was delighted to discover the restaurant had opened in the Fashion Mall. We arrived at 9:45pm on a Tuesday night. There weren't many other patrons, but there was a table of about fifteen teenagers celebrating a birthday. They were really loud and rambunctious, but we didn't mind. Their energy was contagious and went well with the music blasting from the speakers. Yes, blasting! Don't expect to have a nice, dinner conversation when you're here. Our waitress promptly brought over menus. Excuse me. I should have said' "extensive menu", but I'm not complaining. Pages and pages of mouthwatering drinks and delectable desserts. I finally decided on the fried seafood platter and the sour apple lolly martini. The drink was great. The entree not so much. Basic seafood from a frozen box most likely. At least that's what it tasted like. They were out of the dessert we wanted to try so the waitress had them make us a customized sundae. Now that sundae was an absolute yummy treat. The best part of the visit. Our waitress was very attentive also. Almost to the point that I wanted to ask her to stop coming to the table so often. Seriously, whenever we were about to start talking, she would show up. Overall, not the great experience I wanted from this much anticipated visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ice cream sundae. Yummy!!
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried seafood platter
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sour Apple Lolly Martini

1TrVVyqXNO5zpDlw-ZfKNA.text: We went in for a dessert or milkshake. The milkshake was delicious but the waitress wasn't great.  We waited over 25 min for her to come back. We only had milkshakes. The atmosphere was also not something I'm a huge fan of. I actually want to be able to communicate with my date. The music was so loud we were yelling to communicate.

T5gClXQr6WT6rXPwxlZ-yg.text: I give this restaurant a 5/5 because, firstly, the food is amazing!! Excellent burgers, and I had a virgin signature martini (which was excellent). Secondly, a member of my party had a life-threatening peanut allergy. We talked to one of the chefs, Mitch, and he was willing to adapt his recipies in order to accommodate her! Great experience. I recommend it completely!

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of my party enjoying the Cotton Candy martini!

RPjQgst_nhHxEsBkNgevMw.text: BEAWARE!!! I been to the Sugar Factory at Paris that closed down and all I have to say at Fashion Show Mall was one of the worst restaurants I been to in my life. This place has changed a whole lot and I am for sure they will go out of business. Everything there from the food to the candy side are soooo expensive, so you would think the food and candy would be amazing? Absolutely NOT! Even the people working for the restaurant have the worse customer service ever! The prices are over the top and there burgers are Blah to there cold fries. I couldn't believe on Fathers Day we have a table of 9 and ask can we sit where there was a table with no one sitting there the lady said no it's for another guest. Literally while sitting with 7 little tables that moved everywhere for roughly 2 and half hours no one came for the reservations SMH . So I'm thinking are they racist and think ? Finally we are done eating and paying for a check that was astronomical, then to find out a-white family was seated where we originally said can we move to that side of the table. Lol! I would never in my life go to a place that sells a GOBLET for 40.00 and it's the worse drink with absolutely no alcohol. Anyone reading this I promise you do not waste your time. Go to Cheesecake or Maggiano's by far.

3pNwJRh9pg23VEUw_oha1A.text: Expensive and unhealthy- but a fun once in a blue moon treat- and worth every penny.  Our 15 year olds who don't like or get excited for anything- love this place!! The menu is huge!! Great for any meal and the drinks are out of this world- alcohol to coffee to shakes.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon Benedict
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What teenager won&#39;t like this??

gt3McfESEsL04LI5YmjfhQ.text: Horrible service waited an hour and a half to get a table after we were told the wait would be 10-15 minutes and they seemed so irritated that we even asked how much longer the wait would be. They brought a table from the outside to pretty much shut us up. Our server at first seem to be empathetic that we had to wait so long then later on we got completely ignored we order our second drink which we never received. He then wanted to bring it to the table after we had another server get his attention to bring us the check. He blamed the wait for the drink cause it got busy for him which the whole time we watched him pass our table several times and serving drinks to his other tables but ours. No matter how busy a place gets there is no excuse for horrible rude service.... oh not to mention when we got our goblet we wanted a video and he had the nerve to say do you see how busy it is in here WTF! You as a server should do as much as you can cause you are working for to make me feel welcome and want to come back thanks sugar factory for making a local not ever want to step foot in your establishment again. Train your workers better.   After much hesitation I went back to the Sugar Factory today July 20th. When I first arrive I mention I had a reservation at 11 and they knew who I was and I was promptly seated even though a few members of my party were running late. We had a warm welcome from our server Travis. We had waters right away and my sister and I ordered goblets which arrived in no time. When the rest of my party arrive he greeted them with that same welcome. They also ordered drinks and food which there was no long delay. The service was great and it was all thanks to Travis and all the staff that approached our table it really changed my mind entirely about this place. I will be back!

96ppZfRUexvOA1wZJ1RBZA.text: had a great experience & our order was handled promptly.  Retail downstairs tho needs a bit training   .

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. yummyyyy

09UA1uDDb1n1CW1nOZXnXw.text: Service was really slow even though the restaurant was NOT busy. Drinks are over priced and there wasn't much alcohol to them. Food was just okay. Our waiter was nice but the rest of the employees were snobs and wouldn't talk to you when you asked a question. Dont think I will be going back.

IW4QGri5uVO8uwxVrqwwVg.text: I was finally able to make it to the Sugar Factory! I loved every minute of it, especially my Lollipop goblet. The spinach and artichoke dip was taste really good. It was also hot and affordable. The waitress with nice and even took my photos before I went into the candy shop. Thanks for an awesome experience!

2l7v-GLDfcStf8INGYBFrA.text: I came to the Sugar Factory on a Monday afternoon with my boyfriend. We were offered a 2 for 1 "goblet" drink offer which was pretty inviting.  After receiving our menus we were given enough time to watch an episode of Joel Osteen before our server came back to ask for our orders.   We didn't receive any silverware or napkins once our Mac and cheese balls appetizer arrived, so we used our hands and licked our fingers to stay sanitary and ensure we could use our hands for hunting better food at a later time.    We ordered the charcuterie platter and when the food runner brought it out he spilt all the pickles on my leg, and the container fell to the floor. My boyfriend and I were like, "it's cool...things happen." As he went to go scavenge for more pickles I noticed we did not receive bread with our meat platter. When we asked for the bread, the food runner looked confused and out of place. .... (how can you eat pate by itself or meats and mustard w/o any bread.  It's like ordering a pizza with no dough.). We were polite upon asking for our bread as it clearly states it is included on the menu.  I usually wouldn't write a 1 star review of this caliber as I see them being a decent warning, yet a waste of time. However, I wouldn't want anybody wasting their time at this establishment.

cbh_jCYUtU_ZdEx4dQZigA.text: Not sure why Sugar Factory LV doesn't have 5 stars- this is my favorite casual dining in LV. It is a MUST for all ages. Particularly fun for the 21+ crowd- I promise, there is no wrong goblet choice. The food is super good and the dessert is even better. If you're looking for a good time in Vegas- start here.

8OhP3TPPKRPscW_TXhNZHA.text: If you are going to splurge this is the place. The drinks and food are fabulous. Great customer service is beyond great. I strongly recommend you try one of the drinks and a milkshake, the hardest part is deciding which one to try.

9xv-czECULs3IAHH4GP1Ag.text: The food was delicious and the DRINK WAS EVEN BETTER! Omg, that drink was a bit pricey but well worth it, trust me. It's not too sweet and is smoothie going down.

pvV_3PPjkB-Kk0DePZ_l_w.text: Absolutely amazing !!! Marc was our server and he was awesome.  John Sweiss guided us through our experience to perfection.   The rainbow sliders were a crowd pleaser and the mai tai was yummy . Topping it off with one of the most decadent chocolate cakes I have ever had.    Thank you for a great night . Making memories one duck at a time !!

yHt1DVr845ptWtJUe6Igkw.text: I was absolutely blown away by how bad this place was. The service was mediocre, the food was what I would expect from a cheap bar whose regular chef was sick and the bus boy was doing his best to cook something similar, and the "bottomless mimosas" were 90% orange juice that was lower quality than Sunny Delight.  I can see why this place was half empty on a Sunday for brunch in one of the business parts of the strip.  1 star is being generous.

Vu2heOZBz-qhneub8yVoWg.text: worst service ever. we sat down and waited for 15 minutes in a trashy, dirty restaurant and no waiter came to us or the people next to us so we decided to leave.

Hwg3Ub87NmAYtQd0jUL_Lw.text: Don't waste your time for this over-priced poor service place.   We were an 8-top whose food came out two dinner dishes and then the other four came 30 minutes later. Unacceptable  - we won't be back.

3eGN8aXPJmm9KmIDwww3jg.text: One of my most favorite places in Vegas without a doubt! The goblets are amazing, the food is great! They have a Groupon that is available as well and it comes out to such a deal even when you spend quite a bit! I love this place, my husband and I always come back when we're in LV.

KnZskiheWPo_fR1mL81geQ.text: The ambiance was nice, the place was clean, the staff was welcoming and on top of things - they were ways making sure we had all we needed. Drinks were delicious and the food was amazing. The chicken alfredo was the best I've ever had! It was creamy and delicious and the chicken was moist and plentiful. Highly recommend this place to everyone, whether it's a date night or family outing.

EisDgmozfM5DRE0S6szFjw.text: It took about 15 minutes for the bartender to acknowledge that we were at the bar. There were about 10 people total in the bar so it was not busy whatsoever. The bartender, Enrique, then waited another 5-10 minutes to ask us for our drinks. After that, he prepared the tables drink first and delivered it before making ours.   When making small talk, he asked where we were from and when we said Vegas, he proceeded to tell us we gave off the tourist vibe. He was very awkward with his small talk.   At some point a hostess showed up at the door to greet people and show them to a seat.   Overall, it was a horrible experience and would not recommend it. The only redeeming quality was the variety and flavor of the drinks.

vUvakLPBwzfE_R-FJakPKg.text: I been to this location twice and they did not disappoint. First for my 14 yr old bday then for my 16 yr olds bday. The atmosphere is lively, the waitresses and waiters were welcoming and friendly, the shakes were over the top and the food was good. Will be back!!

jOhqHjTWJ6p31nccKsmNyg.text: I thought it was an okay place to eat at while on the strip. It is near the Fashion Show mall. Customer service was okay. However this place is all hype nothing really special besides the alcohol.

j2pH8i5-4eqs9i3W3WrNJA.text: Toooooo much hype! Been wanting to try this place with my family for the longest and I was completely bummed out. Customer service sucks! The prices are ridiculous and the food isn't even that great. The drinks ehhhh they were okay.

ScSdfv-BQ5G-9O5EjjqUHw.text: I love the outdoor dining area and the location is super convenient if you're staying on the strip. Personally I've been dying to try this place ever since I've seen their lollipops plastered across social media by everyone and the ridiculously amazing milkshakes/drinks. So I took myself on a lunch date since I'm in town visiting.   Sat, got glared at an waited....  I ordered a goblet (I'm horrible with the names of the things that I order, but I promise to work on that y'all) it was super pretty and tasted ok. For 60oz, I'm on the fence about paying $40+ for a drink that had to be followed by a few more elsewhere to get me smiley. Then again, maybe I can blame that on my tolerance. I wanted another but didn't exactly feel comfortable nor too persuaded to order anymore. I also got a Cesar salad and added shrimp ($20) fairly small salad with 5 shrimp on top. Yummy but again, the pricing wasn't worth it to me. Especially after MORE WAITING. Wasn't busy around noon on Monday at all. My server was really sweet but I waited awhile before anyone acknowledged me at the table. Just men in uniforms with ear pieces...watching....  All in all, for $75 (tip included) I got a salad and drink, you're paying for the name and experience. Wasn't too impressed by the way I was treated as a guest. I really wanted to try an entree but will have to sadly pass.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very pretty goblet, but I didn&#39;t taste what was described at all. Just super sweet with a hint of liquor.

wciunWlUI9EP7sziS8ht5A.text: Went in for dinner this evening. Took my mom we're here in Vegas on a ladies trip. Super excited for some great drinks!  Not going to lie. The drinks are amazing!  They have so many to choose from you'll definitely not get through them all. Be sure to get different ones and share! We ordered dinner and I had steak frites and mom had a burger. Both which were amazing. The frites were cooked perfectly I normally don't finish a meal but I took it down. Oh I also ordered a French onion soup and yes in this heat and it was one of the best soups I've had!  Mom had a blue cheese burger and it was great.  The fries were delicious too.  The decor is so fun and the music is great!  Outside has some fun candy and duck decor. If you're in Vegas this is definitely a place to check out!  You may even run into a celeb or two!  They have been known to have a sweet tooth and hang out in this hot spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Decor
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cotton candy martini and mai tai

0closXv0IwGH8BjnxJJ4Jw.text: Absolutely amazing and mind blown the food here is incredible and the drinks alcohol and shakes are eye candy for the eye and the sweet tooth! Brought my sister from Connecticut to see Las Vegas ! She was pleasantly surprised to have the chicken and waffles with me it was big enough for the both of us to share! My husband had the Bloody Mary and banana French toast!  I will be visiting the candy bar to see if there is a gift for my girls! Thank you so much for an absolutely amazing time! We loved it so much we bought the table behind us drinks for their three daughters the same one in the pictures!) they were so happy

2Pjv1PVpBr_zK8Ol0EIB2A.text: First time here...I've been wanting to try to place for a while now. Came Saturday night for just drinks. Place was PACKED! It's a small venue in my opinion especially for being on the strip. Anyhow, the wait for a table was 30 minutes so we decided to sit at the bar. The inside bar was full (can only accommodate roughly 10 people) so we sat outside. Our bartender was nice and moved us inside as soon as the inside bar had an opening. The bartenders inside was also nice. We stayed about 2 hours and drank a 3 goblets. $40 a pop! Not bad but at the same time, they fill these "fish" bowls up with so much dry ice and ice that the drinks do come out costly. Our drinks had a good amount of alcohol, so I can't really complain. I heard horrible things about their foos so I'm glad we didn't try any. One thing for sure I wanted to note was, we saw a few ants on the bar tables. Inside and out!  would I be back? Not sure.

bACCeg9HtQs5h5v5GxTLpA.text: Expensive but fun and kids love it too. It was almost 40 for a goblet with alcohol and like five less without. Service was good although the hostess by the bar seemed aloof.

AuUAyCs7vYphFFE_iHHvZQ.text: Went here for dinner and had the best experience. Ashlee was our server and she was amazing. The fried macaroni and cheese balls are to die for!!! We had the big cheese burger was even better! This place is amazing!

LAHUxu67CgzXu8FNUNlCRw.text: I'm so happy they're open!   My boyfriend and I came here for our weekly date. We came because we heard there was a happy hour. From the minute we walked by and we're approached to the minute we left we received great service. Everyone was so friendly and our server was awesome. Lashawna gave us a great experience. We ordered the goblet and with it came a $3 appetizer for happy hour (which you apparently need a promo card for). The goblet we got was called Energy Bear which came with burnetts watermelon vodka, grey goose vodka, and tropical fruits. It has energized gummy bears inside and topped off with a Red Bull. The goblets are filled with dry ice and they come and bring the drink mixture in a cup and the server pours it in your cup and it pretty much smokes up. We chose wings for the appetizer. Delicious Buffalo wings!!! We got The Farm burger which has an egg on top and gravy with angus beef, and comes with fries. To finish, we had the brownie ice cream sandwich for dessert and that too was amazing.  Overall, a great experience thanks to our server. Expect it to be pricey, but it's worth it. Definitely will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour, READ THE FINE PRINT!
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Iy0nribk45O1hmRIMxiH4g.text: The drinks were yummy, and pretty strong! They are extremely sweet, but what you would expect from a candy store. My husband and I shared a 60oz drink and it was plenty!

mULm9G06MML2CdszBEzeJA.text: I always see photos in magazines of celebrities eating here and it looked cool so I wanted to come here. I figured it was going to be overpriced and gimmicky with average food, but I still wanted the experience. My husband and I ended up eating a light dinner beforehand and just splitting a goblet drink and a milkshake, which was a good idea cause I don't  know if we could have eaten dinner and our drinks, we were having trouble finishing our drinks alone.   Service was pretty slow even though it wasn't crowded. I was disappointed that they were out of the night owl drink, so we settled on the drake. It had cotton candy on top but it melted when they poured the smoke in it. We also got the dulce de leche milkshake with chocolate and popcorn on the mug. The milkshake was pretty decent. The drink was ok but very sugary. We forced ourselves to eat all the candy in it cause it was so expensive. My husband said he was going to be in diabetic shock and have to get his leg cut off after the meal. They don't even give you a price for the goblet drinks. Luckily we had a yelp offer for 50% off a drink, otherwise it would have been $38. We also had coupons on the table for 50% off food but our waitress was kind of cold and said "well you can only use one, which one do you want to use?" She tried to be sneaky, she should have just told us it was better to use it for the drinks. Luckily my husband figured the drink would cost more and said to use it for the drink. The only thing we couldn't finish was the lollipop, our waitress gave us a bag to take it home.   I did like the duck theme of the place, I love ducks. The host outside was very nice and offered to take photos of the both of us sitting on the duck. I wanted to get a sparkly duck shirt but they only had kids sizes. I ended up finding one at sugar factory at the airport.   Overall, we had a fun experience. We got a lot of pictures for snapchat of our bubbling drinks and huge milkshake. I'm glad we went there, but we probably wouldn't return because there's better places to eat.

igHbqZwGYF1Qd34CC7TOlw.text: We came here for the very first time and Harlan was our waiter who was amazing. He gave us great service and was very attentive. Great food and amazing drinks. Must come back here again!!!

2yHHtzo0u3h8FaxvvgalXA.text: My short review: relatively loud environment, ridiculous wait times, not really worth the money.  The long: Not the atmosphere I was expecting at all. But that's on me. Loud pop music and the whole restaurant was relatively small. They have small upstairs lounge so I suppose that could make up for it. The food was good but the main problem and the real reason behind my rating is the wait time! Do not come to this restaurant if you have somewhere to be afterwards. We started by ordering drinks. 15 minutes later we ordered appetizers. About 15 minutes later they brought our appetizers and we ordered the entree. 20 minutes later they. Rought the entree. And then 10 minutes later they brought the drinks we ordered (remember those?) after we were done we asked for a to go box which took about another 10 minutes. And then we waited about 25 minutes for them to bring the check! All in all we were probably in this restaurant 2 extra hours that we didn't need to be. I don't plan on coming back any time soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The chocolate cake!

onV1RVwTrGMs93fK6JT5BQ.text: Brenda or server is great, very sweet. She made the experience. But if your not here for the alcohol it is a mediocre candy shop. The ice cream is nothing special, but the presentation is amazing

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rEJuBx4Rm8NxuIjFwjwdow.text: Drinks are very cool, definitely an experience but way over priced! Online they will tell you that you can keep the glass when you pay $36 for a drink (no alcohol!!!) but then they say there is a $15 fee unless you give them a good Yelp review. It's very deceptive and I didn't like that at all. Our server seemed like he didn't care for his job which is crazy considering he makes a killing. $6 for a coke seems over the top and the food was also way over priced and just ok, nothing special. Probably a one time deal for this crew...$161 for 3 people and we didn't get much for it (one person only ordered an appetizer and a coke). I was excited to order the rainbow sliders but they were all out of the colored buns at 5:00 PM!!!

zhtAnROJ8u2vPhUd8PS5Tw.text: The one in Planet Hollywood lets you keep your cup since you're already paying about $50 for it. This one you have to pay an extra $15 on top of that to keep it the cup you've already payed for which is ridiculous. Set up is nice. But they really ran out with that extra $15. So if you want the nice sugar Factory cup souvenir, go to the one INSIDE PLANET HOLLYWOOD. Get more bang for your buck

-3Ccs8Yg88LUR8Y7lHNttA.text: Koko was our waitress, and she was outstanding! She made our Sugar Factory experience one we'll never forget!   We came to celebrate a 30th birthday and there couldn't be a more perfect place to be! Located right on the Strip, great music, and a nice fun crowd.   The drinks were well worth the price, and the food was "to die"!   Highly recommended! Enjoy!

UopZSw6YCQ0uW3PCUvJWew.text: Love this restaurant! Wonderful service! Chaz was our server and he was quick on getting our orders and made sure we were happy with our food and drinks. We didn't like the taste of one of the goblets and they replaced it without hesitation. Alex the manager even gave our children lollipops for free. Definitely will be back!

nUVFSm9T07UA4bLbhmpZ3A.text: I don't even know where to start...we walked up to the restaurant & of course my kids want a picture with the big yellow duck. They get up by the duck & go to sit on it & someone from the restaurant comes out & yells at them. Put a sign up if you don't want kids climbing on the duck, it is an attractive nuisance! Then we go to the front to be seated & are seated at a table that is very wobbly. I ask to be moved to a different table that is not wobbly; they move us to another slightly less wobbly table. We wait at least 10 minutes before our waiter comes to the table. Actually another waiter had to tell him to wait on us. So we order...it takes forever to get our coffee which is cold and the orange juice the kids ordered comes when they are almost done eating. The OJ was GROSS, dark in color. We got our meals & mine was the completely wrong thing. So the waiter takes it back & brings me what I ordered. My husband got an omelette that had no taste & some toast. No butter or jelly is offered for the toast, so he asks for jelly. About 10 minutes goes by & he asks again for jelly & now fresh toast. The waiter told us they were getting fresh jelly out of the fridge...what?!?! What, really...it takes over 10 minutes to get jelly out of the fridge...ummmm ok.   Now the coffee situation...you would think that when you order coffee you would get a hot cup of coffee...no, not here. And when we asked for new, hot coffee the waiter brings one cup and tells us that is the last cup & their coffee maker is broken and the coffee they got from Starbucks is gone. WTF! Seriously!   Now, I expect a place to be very nice when I'm paying $15-$18 for one breakfast dish. Not the case. As I stated both tables were wobbly, the crevice around the table had old, nasty food in it, NO COFFEE, black cloth napkins stuffed under table legs to make the tables not wobble & there were wires hanging down from a chandelier. It is really the little things this place is missing! It's all the little things that add up!   We will never, ever go back. The manager did offer for us to come back later for dessert...nope, no thank you, not even for free!  Update to this review: we did get our meal for free. This still did not change the experience we had. I'd rather pay full price & have 5-star experience!   After I posted this review we were offered to come back. Management said they would make a reservation & provide us with a 5-star experience. I accepted as our kids really wanted to have a huge milkshake. Then I get another message stating she didn't realize our meal had been comped & she was confused that I still gave a one star review. Really? I was a little shocked. Yes, our meal was comped because it was a horrible experience. I was told they would give the kids free milkshakes and basically asking me to post another review & make it positive. I declined & then was told basically that I am trying to take advantage of them.   Really think about choosing a different restaurant if you are considering this one!

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

n8Yl3c0cB4PlWpL9fsiGMQ.text: We came here on a Monday night. Not too crowded. We were seated immediately. The menu is huge and it's so hard to decide what to order, but we settled on the lollipop goblet, rainbow sliders, mac and cheese pops, and white chocolate burger. They were out of the mac and cheese pops. :(  They started us with the goblet. It's pretty messy. When the waitress dumped the liquid into the goblet it boiled violently and got all over our table. We had to use our napkins to soak up the mess, she didn't even seem to noticed. Be careful when drinking these goblets because the dry ice creates gas and that gas is pretty painful when you inhale it if your straw is unfortunate will enough to hit an air pocket.  You will end up with a mouth full of gas up your nose and it's pretty painful. The sliders were pretty good that was probably one of my favorite parts of the meal. The burger was OK but super messy and not at all visually appealing. The fries it came with were pretty good. We decided to try a milkshake for dessert and had the Smore's milkshake. Be forewarned this thing contains a lot of espresso! I stayed up all night easily after drinking that milkshake, but it was so good. Layers of chocolate and marshmallow. The marshmallows were toasted to perfection! Service was a bit slow for how empty they were on a Monday night, but it's a place you want to hang out at for a while anyways. I will definitely have to make a return trip to try some more of their menu items.

qVbluhQPzN6BQzNZooIy6w.text: Fun experience but be prepared to spend A LOT of money. We did not get food.  We got 2 drinks and a milkshake. These drinks were created for the selfie generation. Even when the waitress arrived with them she asked if we wanted to video her pouring (the dry ice has an 'ahhh' effect). We spent our time snapping pics and oohing and ahhing over said drinks. We got one with alcohol and one without so my daughter could share. They were tasty too. Then my daughter's milkshake came. More oohing and ahhing and pics. Taste was so-so. A Friendly's Fribble is better. Then the bill came. Did I tell you there were no prices on the menu? 100.00 for these three drinks! What stays in Vegas is our money! But it was fun. Oh, and those Huuuuge drinks had so much ice in the glasses they were pretty much the size of an average drink. So if you're going to go, be prepared

C4LwbfKXHkBsg0iJshNk1A.text: We ate here for dinner on a Saturday night. We were immediately greeted at the door and seated. Our waitress was prompt and came to check on an appropriate amount of times. The music is fairly loud and energetic! The tables are close together, not so much room for intimate eating. We ordered the calamari, it came out over cooked and salty, the outside crust was terribly crunchy and the calamari itself was hard. We then ordered a turkey burger, which was good, not worth $17. It was average is size and came with a small helping of shoe string fries. For dessert we had the bananas foster. We were so excited when it arrived. It looked so delicious! Our excitement left us the moment we tried to cut the macadamia nut cookies, but couldn't. They were so hard.... just disappointed. Would not dine here again. Glad we used Groupon and saved some cash!!!

B8v4jMfrFH2OaOi8nMEnBw.text: I really can't put into words what an amazing experience we had here. I believe there were 36 of us who attended dinner here for my bachelorette party, and we were blown away by the food, drinks and most of all the service.    First of all to have that many people order food and to all have their meals within 5-10 minutes of the first meal being brought out is super impressive and shows how well the staff work together. The manager (I believe his name was Shawn introduced himself and made sure anything we wanted was takes care of. Our servers name was Eric and what a fantastic guy!! Such patience for dealing with such a large group and so so sweet and professional.     They truly made it an unforgettable experience. I'm going back again tomorrow and would highly recommend a visit to anyone!

fmMz0hnh6OLkbHS--IaICg.text: This is an Update:    My husband and I came in there last night, we weren't pleased by the 2 hostesses that seated us. My husband asked for a booth because I have a bad back but the hostesses didn't even try to accommodate that so, he finally said "my wife is pregnant" I'm 7 months pregnant. The hostesses finally agreed to seat us in a booth but I noticed one of the hostesses look at my belly as I pass them by. After that, they were rude and my husband and I could hear them talk about us since we were seated right next to their podium. I, too was a hostess in my lifetime. They are the first people you see, they are the first impression. Here, there representation was indecent and unacceptable.   However, the star of the night was our Server, Shawnee. Without her this review with be a '1 star', this review right now would not even survive. We were there because it was our daughters birthday and she has been requesting  to have dinner at the 'Sugar Factory' for months.  Shawnee took care my family, she came to our table because she noticed we have been waiting for a while. First she served us our drinks, like how it always should be, we were ready to order our food by that time. The entire time we were there; I can't count how many times she came to check on me and my family. Shawnee was so attentive and amenable. She and the food runner were the only ones who smiled at us and treated us really good. The food was delicious as always and so were our favorite goblets, we had two virgins and a non-virgin for my husband.  Shawnee got a really tip at the end of our meal. She came back to thank my husband, Thank YOU Shawnee!!! and the cooks. We had a long day, we were exhausted and hungry. We wanted good food and to be treated right, thank you for making our night Shawnee, food runner and cooks!.

nQVuNQX9y-hFpVYBAjmjDw.text: For my husband's 30th Birthday, I surprised him with a dinner to Sugar Factory. I ordered the Pan Roasted Ora King Salmon and it was sooooo good! The salmon was cooked to perfection. Crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside just how I like it. My husband loved his meal as well. He ordered the shrimp alfredo. te0s8Iab6B88sGJvUzLpvg.text: When it comes to overpriced gimmicks but super cute, Sugar Factory is the place to go. This place is the wonderland place to go for Instagram photos, and memories with crazy drinks. Their theme is basically ducks & candy. So there is TWO locations on the strip, and yelp photos does not help because it is all mixed up. The location at the Fashion Mall is the one you want to go to.   The location at the fashion mall is at the end of the strip next to Treasure Island. The sugar factory here is the place to go, because there are tons of photo opportunities. The restaurant, yes it is a restaurant too, is located along the outside of the mall with a giant duck outside to take photos with. Upstairs, by taking the outside escalator, outside is a field of photos wanting to be taken with tons of candy, carousel, gazebo, bunnies, and tons of marshmallow looking roses. It is one of the cutest setup I ever seen! The menu has food and drink options. Reminds me of the Cheesecake Factory since there is so many options. Also, inside the restaurant, there is a small candy shop where you can shop for duck things and fill up on candy.   The other location is at the planet Hollywood. This is more of a small shop where you go to get only drinks and candy quickly. There isn't much to do since it is more like stand where you can sit if you like, but it is more of go get your items then leave because of the lack of space.   NUTELLA DE LECHE MILKSHAKE: This is one of the cutest thing I ever seen. It is a giant mug that is half covered in chocolate and sprinkles. On top there is a small chocolate covered banana, candy necklace, and a giant unicorn lollipop. This is seriously a kids dream, and adults heart attack with all the sweets. However, even with the beautiful display, it was just not good. I hate to say that it was all looks, and nothing to show.   THE DRAKE: This was a giant drink with cotton candy on top. Basically they serve you a drink with dry ice, cotton candy, and gummies in a giant cup where they would pour the alcohol over the entire thing to basically get that smoking and bubbly effect. Like the milkshake, it was just not impressive. However, the taste of it was just plain gross. It tasted like medicine with tons of sugar. I could not drink it at all, and we just left it on the table to look pretty.   Like the milkshake & the crazy sugar alcohol drink, there is tons of variety to choose from. You can order the sugar drink without alcohol, which I forgot to do because I feel like it would have been better. Either way, the two drinks set me back $70 which is very high but not bad at the same time considering the size of the alcohol drink. I did not try the food, but from the lack of people I would guess that it was not that good.   This is a place that you need to try for the cute factor especially if you have kids. It is expensive but what isn't on the strip?! It is one of those places that you need to experience at least once. Even with the bad food and drinks, I got tons of great photos and i think the desserts are the best thing to go with here.

_Tvwc8hL-4CENkC9G6rhOg.text: Been dying to come to Sugar factory so we decided to come to the Fashion Show mall and saw that they have a sugar factory. The drinks are super cute and makes every picture so fun and cute. The actual drinks are super strong and sweet! The bowl is good enough for 2-3 people to share. There's no price in the menu but a bowl is a whopping $40. It could range from that price and higher, I'm unsure.  I heard that the Lollipop passion goblet is their most popular. It's pretty good but in my opinion too sweet, I felt like I was having a real sugar rush. My friend had their Peace Love & Hermonie, she enjoyed it very much. Pretty pricey for such a small cup she received but it's alright. (Not pictured)  I probably would come back here next time but just share a goblet with a family or friend. Their food looks amazing too. Low key wish I ate here, we saw a lot of people getting the pasta. Until next time!

ZdkdIY_PacVKZxF45yACDw.text: This place gets packed on the weekends but during the weekday it is fairly quick to get a table. The food is ok here but they are mostly known for their goblet drinks and their desserts. Ok, the sundae here for two is ridiculously huge! It really is meant for four! It was crazy good but so huge. We celebrated our daughter's birthday here because she absolutely loved the desserts here few days before. They delivered a big birthday wishes with those giant sparkling candle! She loved it! They have a very large menu selections from food to beverages and most of all their nice selection of desserts. It's a huge celebrity endorsed place but my kids had a blast. Definitely a place to go celebrate a birthday. Something to try too! Just make sure you bring your sweat pants to eat those huge size sundaes and milkshakes!

x8BSS9LpWwgmkHIv8dQz-g.text: "Life is short, make it sweet!"  My experience at Sugar Factory was one to remember! I had such a fun interactive dining experience from the second I walked into the establishment. This is the place for date nights, birthdays, and celebrations! It's not too over priced...it's honestly the same price as going to Cheesecake Factory. Definitely ditch the chain dining and come check out Sugar Factory.  My server Jason was awesome! He made sure my boyfriend and I were taken care of from start the finish.  I ordered the sugar factory cheeseburger and it was SO DELICIOUS!! It was $18 and came with French fries (not bad). The food also came out very quickly!   I did make a reservation ahead of time but it wasn't really necessary even though it was a Friday night. I'm not exactly sure why it wasn't busy, but I'm not complaining because we had a whole section of the restaurant to ourselves which made it perfect for date night!   Alcohol is a must! I know $39 is a bit much for a drink but I assure you it's worth it!! Get the drink!! You will totally regret it. They are strong and sweet...the perfect combination. I had the Ocean Blue because I don't have much of a sweet tooth but I was really impressed with how well everything went.   Don't forget to check out the Chocolate lounge upstairs and the gift shop! Great experience!! Definitely coming back!

wIgsebdUz1uMn6dqAfghMg.text: Got a Chinese chicken salad that looked nothing like the menu picture (might want to take the pic off the menu if you can't replicate it). Small salad for $20. Not much of anything in it. Taste was okay but felt like they cut corners on quality. I do think they put the wrong chicken on it-looked grilled or roasted in picture  but was a small char grilled chicken with a tough lacquer crust. My friend got same salad and returned it. I would say good this place is especially good for kids, teens, young adults. Giving it three stars for the ambience and concept which is fun and  cool and also excellent service. Food is average and overpriced.

iQnDf8ctX78OMKcgJtgm9Q.text: Oh how I wanted to like this place, but I left unimpressed.  I had the tomato bisque $9 and onion rings $12.  The soup was tasty but was no more than 5 spoons in quantity.  The onion rings (8 qty) were decent.  My wife had the big cheesy burger which was $19, she rated it 3 out of 5 stars.  My mother in law had the club sandwich which was around the same price of the burger and decent size.  The ice tea came out in a 6oz glass that had to be refilled constantly.  I felt bad for the waiter, the size of the ice tea made zero sense.  My daughter had the mini burgers w/ special sauce.  Those were not good at all, over cooked and their special sauce must have been put on with a teaspoon.  I would give them one star specially for the price.  Since we were celebrating my daughter's 6th birthday, I thought the sugar factory would throw in something special, the only thing special was the price $10.  The dessert was made up of 3 scoops of chocolate ice cream, whip cream and a sister sparkler type candle.  The menus were dirty and needed to be wiped off (really gross actually), the seat we were sitting at was ripped.    Food 2 stars out of 5 Value 1 star out of 5 Waiter was a 4 out of 5 Cleanliness 2 stars out of 5  I would not recommend sugar factory for dining or dessert based off of my first visit.

bqIiWXuNB02ziyFxsai4Xg.text: I went here with a friend to celebrate a special occasion. I got the lollipop passion goblet and it's SO GOOD! I'm usually able to taste the alcohol flavor after awhile of drinking, but I didn't taste any alcohol while drinking this one. I think the lollipop in my drink helped it taste better bu hiding the alcohol flavor. I'd recommend sharing these goblet size drinks with others, but you can always ask for to go cups at this location if you don't finish. We also ordered fried macaroni and cheese pops and some type of cheese quesadilla. The food was a bit pricy for the amount you get, but the macaroni and cheese pops were very good. The quesadilla was good too, but there wasn't really anything special about it.  At this location, you have to buy the cup separately if you want to keep it unlike other Sugar Factory locations. I'd recommend this location if you're here to relax while snacking on food and not just here for the cool goblet cup.

ZP4wLj9YfYmp9sPDxlvhkw.text: I'm sure you've seen this place all over social media and on various people's accounts. Apparently it's also a big spot for celebrities like Drake, Amber Rose, The Kardashian crew, and many others.  Honestly though I don't know what all the hype was about.  Don't get me wrong the shakes were good, drinks were interesting, and ice cream was decent at best.  In my opinion this is more of a place to check out just because it exists vs. somewhere you actually want to visit. I rarely bring up prices, but $19 for a milkshake is excessive. Again though this is all opinion and due to the attention this place has received it's worth a shot.   The actual restaurant itself is nothing out of this world. Looks kind of like a more current version of what a 50's diner would look like today. Music was on point though.    The waitress who helped us though definitely deserved 5 stars. She was able to memorize all the different liquors in the various fish bowls. Pretty impressive.

K6DpUUnB-1b7kwZSQeq2cw.text: It was a great experience. Our food was really good and the service is way fast never expect that our food will be ready like a snap on a busy night. If you are going here you have to try the goblet drinks it's pricey but definitely worth it. Milkshakes are great not too sweet just right after munching a monster burger. All in all definitely going back to try some more.

rrfiKeHPUE7uTmeLD3BzWw.text: My family had such a great time here at the Sugar Factory at Fashion Show Mall. We celebrated my nieces 18th birthday so my family reserved a space in the Chocolate Lounge. When you first enter the lounge there's a step and repeat sign (photo backdrop) where you can take pictures in front of it.   The chocolate lounge is upstairs and right off the back patio where you can ride a carousel and take beautiful pictures. It's very picturesque! It has spectacular views of the strip and the lights are breathtaking at night.   So much food was ordered for my niece and her friends. They each received red candy buckets on the table. But why not! It's the sugar factory! They each ordered the infamous Goblets. Each one ordering from their own taste. Hers which ones they ordered (Virgin of course!) duh!   Lollipop Passion   The Drake - I ordered this! You can always count on me for cotton candy   White Gummi Watermelon Patch   Each goblet is super cute! You can take the cup home for an additional $15 on top of the already $25 drink. You decide if it's worth it.   Anyways, the food was delish. I ordered the rainbow  sliders.   Other food ordered (which was all family style) was:  Banana Split Waffle Country fried chicken and waffle -  Baskets of fries Fried Mac & Cheese Pops Spinach Artichoke Dip Grilled Mini Burgers Sampler Platters Chinese chicken salad  The Signature Sugar Factory Burger - my husband ordered   All this food came around a thousand times! So much was ordered and it was all delicious.   Service was great! Especially for a party of such large size.  Parking was fine. We parked in the Neiman Marcus parking lot and walked right up to Las Vegas Blvd. we did get lost by going to the Miracle Mike Shops. That's not the right one if you're trying to find the chocolate lounge. She did give me a couple coupons for the mixup. Lol   I really cannot wait to go back there.  I think the one in Los Angeles is open. I wonder if they'll have the same flair. I'll definitely be going.

bScaro3wDs88UiT4WWE9dw.text: I was pleasantly surprised by the food and service at Sugar Factory based on other reviews. I knew this was going to be a novelty experience eating "pretty" food, so I didn't have huge expectations beyond the aesthetics. Of course we had to try the rainbow sliders.  Nothing amazing taste-wise, but not bad. The prices for entrees seemed steep, but the sandwich prices were reasonable. My husband and I split the filet sandwich, and it was PLENTY to share since we'd had the appetizer. We steered clear of the $40 cocktails based on the advice of other reviewers, and opted instead to splurge on the $19 Tie Dye milkshake. It was big, ornate, and tasty. Again, you're paying for the novelty... no different than paying $50 for a cheaply made concert t-shirt.  Several reviews mention poor service. Our server was very attentive, but we went on a Monday night. The restaurant is huge, and I imagine it's a madhouse on the weekends. I wouldn't let the possibility of bad service deter you from dining on a weekday.  Cons:  I could've done without the endless stream of Kardashian photos flashing on huge TV screens throughout the restaurant. Not my idea of dinner entertainment.  Also, I wish I'd checked the math on the tip amount suggested on my receipt rather than just checking the box. Another reviewer's photo showed it was calculated almost double the amount! I know some restaurants will suggest gratuity based on amount before discount if a coupon is used, but otherwise that's super shady. I'll be interested to see if other people post receipt photos now that someone has pointed it out.

_AgG51aDYfgd-WgKDBIEXg.text: Extremely disappointed over all experience for my daughter birthday last night. Very slow service, and they were out of sliders, onion rings, Mac and cheese etc. Tine to close down and regroup.  Needless to say, our daughter birthday celebration feel short during our visit.  Update: The restaurant manager reached with a sincere apology and offer to make it right by comping our next visit. As my daughter really wanted to dine at this place we will return as Corey is attempting to make it right and display that they are much better than our experience. More to come after our next visit .....

bfXxt5IytJVy8x6R4L1ZnA.text: This establishment knows customer service. I had a minor issue that they promptly fixed. The waitress Nancy was spectacular! Food is awesome, drinks are great. I will be back!!!

ApWS0dNuKschEe6BjHncfA.text: Great spot for desserts! Visually there is no better spot for a sugary treat. Milkshakes are unreal. Super creative combinations for dessert. We enjoyed the ambiance. Fun spot for kids complete with a candy shop

WPjEDX2HDGzoyAwW_bpk7Q.text: What happened to this place? Everything was so much better before they relocated from Paris. Food is mediocre nothing special way too pricey for what it is. Only 1 star because the server was super accommodating and nice. If it wasn't for him they deserve zero star.

WxMyM7whiWozgLrrgbu2mg.text: This place is just plain CUTE!  There are bright rubber duckies in all colors and sizes throughout the place.  But when you look up, you see sexy chandeliers and mirrors.   The menu is just adorable! There are fishbowl sized cocktails with lollipops, rainbow burgers, and milk shakes covered in chocolate, topped with candied bacon and a slider!   Everything looked good but I finally decided on a fettuccini Alfredo with shrimp, an apple pie crepe with coconut ice cream, and bottomless mimosas. The food was buttery, heavenly deliciousness and washed down well with the mimosas.   Our server, Mark, was really cool and even got us to-go cups for our last mimosa.  I love Vegas!!

z_or0FTEZ5bUq53Unq2RHA.text: I have had a few drinks from the Sugar Factory, but this was my first time eating here. Love the decor, if your into the Kardashian's you'll love it even more they have pictures and videos that pop up around the room.  The atmosphere is a mix between loungish and restaurant. Great place to get a night on the town started, large and sweeet drinks filled with different candy's. I had the white chocolate and apple bacon burger It was messy to eat but a finger licking good. I need to go back when I can have one of their out of control shakes.

eTH1mkCzLxEXDcdsdMaaQg.text: Came here for with my daughter well on vacation and I'm giving four stars because of the experience! Great customer service and the food and candy shop were so much fun. The ambiance for the restaurant was classy and cute with an added candy shop/ice cream parlor. We paid about $110 for appetizers and one of their custom milk shakes. The food was just okay nothing special and our rainbow burgers were a little cold with the buns kinda hard around the edges. We also ordered wings which were also a little cold and their French onion soup had a burnt taste to it. The milk shake we got was the sugar daddy with a cheese cake slice on it (not to sure the name) it was just ok and didn't taste like it had chunks of cheese cake in it like the picture described. Over you pay for the experience like I said not for the quality.
