YfbvFeBTEQJEHX3mt5xJGg.text: This place is definitely all hype and only for the aesthetic. It's definitely IG worthy, but the fish bowl drinks in my opinion was too sugary. If you like sugar and alcohol than this is your place. I think it's cool that famous people create the drinks. The food was actually pretty good and reasonable pricing. The staff there were very nice, we got seated at a table right under the air vent which made us really cold, and they switched us without any problem. Overall good for a sugar rush, but personally not worth it to me.

b-ZVeWVSBDZIIBMB4jHTgw.text: Horrible service ask for booth. My back qaa killing from walking. She took us to a dirty table. Then told us to wait. Called ua back and took us to regular table. Asked again for a booth. Place was not busy she looked at me with a blank look. We left.

xGuJb6JqV1nh4DvHPYpQ7A.text: I wish I could give this restaurant negative stars. We went here for breakfast. I ordered the eggs, sausage, home style potatoes, and toast. The toast was to be delivered on a separate plate so my friend could have it because it could make me very sick. When ordering I made it very clear that I had a wheat allergy NOT a gluten free preference. The top of the menu CLEARLY STATED THAT THE HOME STYLE  potatoes came with the meal I ordered.    The meal took 21 to be delivered to the table.  When it arrived I asked about my home style potatoes.  The server was new and said he didn't know why they weren't there.  He then came back with his trainer. They said they did not have those any longer, and that I could have hash browns like my friend was having instead if I wanted. I told them the menu was clear, and I wanted what I ordered. I also stated that I was not able to eat the hashbrowns that my friend ordered. Their hashbrowns are the same kind that McDonald's serve! Really? for the price you charge, Sugar?!? That aside I can't eat them which I told the server. He asked what I would like instead. I said to speak with your manager.  6 minutes later (yes I timed all this) I got up and went to the front counter to find out where the manager was? I was told they were on their way. Soon two were at my table.  They wanted to know what the problem was... I explained again. They said that they had new menus coming the next day that would be corrected and not offering the home potatoes. They said that the hashbrowns contained no wheat. I told them that the preformed items they had been serving were not wheat or "gluten" free. The packaging would say that they were. They also would say that they weren't on shared equipment. They most likely have a binder and that is why they can maintain that shape! The waiter had taken a photo of the box. The ingredients did not ot include straight wheat or flour. They did have dextrose and other ingredients that are so li g to be honest... I don't even know how to spell them, much less what os in then so I can't eat them for my own safety.   I explained all this to the two condescending managers. They offered me asparagus to go with my eggs and sausage which were almost gone. I told them no thank you that didn't sound like an appetizing combination. They said, "then what do you want?". I said to not pay for my meal. They did end up waiving our bill. This was a horrible experience. I felt that thes people were just obnoxious. More importantly as a landmark food establishment they didn't care that they could have put me in a situation of truly dangerous illness.   I did get my bill waived. My actual server was very nice. His trainer was not there to help him at all or this wouldn't have happened. Our food was late. I could have been made seriously I'll. The management was nasty and condescending. Strong work Sugar!

u7SI6f6LW2K_qL6IhyOvfg.text: I love this restaurant! So beautiful inside, the atmosphere was really awesome. Drinks are delicious- chocolate martini? YES!   They had great service and everyone was so nice and attentive!   The food is amazing. I ate the white chocolate burger and it was juicy and the mix of flavors with the white chocolate is genius! I loved it. I will definitely be back again for that!

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Absolutely delicious white chocolate burger

6_jevZizzoS3VMRI7c-S0A.text: I was embarrassed! My daughter and I had been wanting to eat at the Sugar Factory for some time now. Being that we are locals we don't get out much in our city so we decided to invite a few family and friends and turn our first trip into a celebration for my daughters 19th birthday.   I thought this would be the perfect place to do so that is until we arrived. Once we arrived we had to wait about 10 minutes in the retail store which was not bad since it was only 4 people in our party of 10 that had arrived. When the hostess escorted us through the restaurant we were taken upstairs and seated.   There was not much staff present which was made aware by the staff complaining to one another at the bar near our table. When I made reservations on the phone the week prior I advised that it was my daughter's birthday. The waiter came over and wishes her happy birthday and asked if we were ready to start off drinks and we let him know others were still one the way and that seems to be when we were forgotten about. Our additional guest seemed to have trouble finding us when they arrive despite them giving the name that my reservation was made under and one guest was even advised that they were NOT aware of our reservation. Once the rest of the group arrived and ordered we had a special request from our pregnant guest and I thought making it known that she was not just sending the food back to be a bitch but was sending it for adjustment for her dietary restrictions but that did not go well when her dish was adjusted a hair was also added to her meal. I even had to shh her and another guest when it was discovered so as not to make such a big deal in front of my daughter. A man came over not sure if he was the manager or what because he did not address himself as one at all he of course apologized and offered her something else and of course she declined. The one person that should have been served first was the one that did not even get to eat. Once the rest of the food arrived and was finished our plates sat at the table and we watched as the few staff walked back and fourth busy doing something else. The first chance we got to wave someone down we asked for the check and still had to wait for that as by the time I got my change the entire table had already got up and was headed for the door.   No Happy Birthday song or dance for my daughter and not Happy Birthday memories at the Sugar Factory for us. What really made me upset and write this review was as we all gathered on the elevator to head out and arrived to the restaurant where all the others were I saw all those there having a good time servers happy and waiting on them having a good time listening to good music and a great atmosphere I felt like our reservation was rush or not even accounted for or forgotten and they stuck us upstairs hoping we did not notice. Maybe they thought we were from out of town and that is how they treat them because they don't know any better but this native was NOT impressed by this place and I will not recommend it to anyone else or have dinner there again. Glad that everyone else enjoyed their food at the least and there was only ONE hair found.   I don't know what it was but they need to get it together. If I could give starts for food and then starts for service then this rating would be different but with my background in customer service their bad service out weighted the food and once you find anything in your food that does not belong in the first place it just takes the joy and carelessness of the evening out the door because with every bite we all had our eyes on everything we touched. I am going to cut it short because I could certainly keep going but the fact that she should have know that the service was bad and made no attempts to correct it showed us a lot. Maybe our quite party of 10 was too much for them.

Z1pFF4RBZICtd4mYw6rxGg.text: I really enjoyed this place for my birthday. I decided on the Mac and cheese burger with the peach goblet. It was an all around great experience . Our waiter was fast , friendly and on top of things. The whole night went smooth. I did the groupon voucher and that definitely helped a lot. Good for special occasion, a bit pricey

wfjHWCSLbBzL_B9Z2xqL0A.text: Loved the service we had for preparing a large party on a Saturday night. Staff was so accommodating and generous. Food was surprisingly good. Burgers were awesome. Mac n cheese balls were really good. Drinks were just okay. I do not recommend the chocolate martini. Now desserts I cannot comment on because our party brought in a cake so boooooo! Candy bags provided for each guest was so cool, watch out for the chili pepper gummies!

L1yV__12YgOX3qrpDJZOew.text: Absolutely amazing. Went here to celebrate my birthday with my family and had a great experience. We walked in expecting it to be all about the atmosphere, drinks and desserts. But the burgers were delicious and the staff were so friendly. I can't wait to go back!

Zkoe4BKF1R-7MxlJQuavIA.text: I purchased the Groupon for 2 people (40 dollars worth credit Mon- thursday)   1 goblet is 40.00 with alcohol and 36.00 without (what the heck?!?)   We ended up not drinking and ordered:  1. rainbow sliders (comes with a free mini duck)- the flavor was on point and the colors were def IG friendly. I loved it! The burgers had a lot of flavor and the right amount of filling to meat to bread ratio.  2. Calamari- keep in mind it is like tempura style (fluffy and airy- slightly seasoned) I really enjoyed the calamari because it seemed not as greasy *please note they do not have tarter sauce and have marinara   For dessert we got the cookie jar sundae (meant for 2 people)- it was massive there were 4 of us and we barley made a dent. The ice cream is from San Francisco and absolutely delicious.   I will be back with another Groupon to try more but it is really pricey. They have special events- new years and superbowl which is 100.00 a person and includes food and goblets for free. I will do that in the future for sure!!!

TMjntEP7tb2IllEG60yusQ.text: Soooo glad they reopened this sweet place!!! I loved the one at the Paris Casino so when they closed that I was really bummed.  This location now has added the Chocolate Lounge upstairs to the Sugar Factory. So this trip we decided to check  that out.  We had a wonderful view as we ordered two sweet drinks, my daughter had the Bubble Gum cocktail and I had a Raspberry Martini--even though not on their menu they will make any cocktail for you.   The dark chocolate fondue for 2 was delicious! It came with small bites of brownies, lemon cake, angel cake, marshmallows, bananas, gummy bears & strawberries.  The wait staff are beautiful & sweet too!! Although pricey ($70 including gratuity) it really is a cute place to have a dessert, specialty drinks. They also have a candy store & full food menu. It totally reminds me of a new age version of Farrell's. I am def a fan!

Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dark Chocolate fondue with--Lemon Cake, Brownies, Gummy Bears, Bananas, Strawberries, &amp; Marshmallows (not shown).

TA4MPMPV1Ab_oaU2GgYcBQ.text: I'm a big fan of Sugar Factory's candy cocktails so I was happy to see a full service Sugar Factory was coming back to the Strip at the Fashion Show.  The opening date kept getting pushed back but now the downstairs at least is finally open.  Upstairs is a Chocolate Lounge that is coming soon.    We wanted to sit at the bar for happy hour but it was full.  We were offered 2 for 1 goblets if we sat at a table.  We took them up on it but that was a mistake.  Our server wouldn't let us keep a menu at the table and rushed us out before we finished our first round.  We planned on having more drinks but ended up just leaving.  Drinks were good but I prefer the small cocktails to the goblets.  Next time I will sit at the bar where hopefully we will get better service.

9X-XaEjk6k6ceYFZr3RlXA.text: Jeremias the bartender at the front daiquiri bar is awesome. Super sociable. Managed the bar and patio tables effortlessly. He was informative about drinks and made great suggestions. Didn't intend on coming here but definitely stayed for the vibe and conversation

7Vs5RnMx_1mSmbc0NzgtpA.text: I say this is something to try at least once. The drinks are pretty strong, but have a lot of sugar in them so it can get you sick. Drink lots of water, you will get dehydrated drinking this mixed with the Las Vegas heat!  Pros: you can get some cute videos and pics from these drinks  Cost: $40 per drink

eKMtcH58hBPuTkd3bIu9zQ.text: Just ate there today food was good but service not so well i had to ask repeadly for a spoon and sugar for my coffee and by the time i got it my coffee was cold, also when paying for the bill i had to do the math while he carriers a tablet that im pretty sure he has a calculator on it to do the math for him thats why im paying and tipping you for also had to chase him down in order to pay the bill after i wrote the totals. We also were asked if its my girlfriends  birthday they asked for there names and made it seem like they were gonna  do somthing and nothing happen i believed they forgot as my waiter Joshua M forgot as well im sure he is nice guy but service was not good espeical for what i paid for

TLDt3w9DZ9i9I15fdvjCTA.text: We have been going to the old location for years, when they closed we were sad.  We recently tried the new location at the Fashion Show Mall. We went on a Sunday evening and it was busy, but not crazy busy. The decor is beautiful. There was plenty of staff visible and the service was great! The milkshake was to DIE FOR! We shared one and it was plenty. We will return.

bpduoF7v4ZgzlGZ9kabB4A.text: Terrible service! We were a group of 6 and went for breakfast. They only had herbal tea, no regular (but they had coffee -??) We had to ask 3 times for jam and in the end only got it for the table when I had to go inside and track someone down. Food was cold by that time. We waited well over an hour for eggs and when we finally did get our food it was wayyyy undercooked for two of us. We waited another 30 mins for a fried egg to be redone -??? AND THEY WERE SLIMY AND UNDERCOOKED AGAIN!! In the end the two meals got comped but when our friends got their bill there was an automatic 18% tip added to their bill. Ridiculous!!! Oh and they also said they would not accept change. Give me a break. The Kardashians might get the royal treatment here but not everyday people and we were not the only table complaining. Never again!

G4jKcqvgz9GrZPcCji5ahA.text: I am giving it 1 for staffing reasons... Start off by its a fabulous place. Its fun and a wonderful experience. Most of the staff was awesome! However the management is a piece of work. It was busy took a long time to even get our order placed while sitting AT THE BAR. At the end of our drinks I take off to the restroom. Come back and see a receipt infront of me on bar. My husband then goes to the bathroom. Yes its my fault I assumed he paid! He comes out bar tender says bye and we go to candy store. My husband assumed I paid. Total misunderstanding! Yes it was my fault! But I was in store almost hour wondering picking stuff out. Then go to leave and am scolded and embarrassed infront of others on the strip for not paying... Excuse me!!! It was an accident and I promptly turned and paid. There was no need to let me walk around for an hour and then yell at me! I am beyond pissed and believe they overcharged us on purpose after so. We will NEVER be returning and I wish I could have returned the items I bought.

TmIgiGIFnxNbCfhp7Xybcw.text: Everyone was so nice the drinks are liquid gold the milkshakes are fun and delicious and the food is amazimg definitely worth stopping in 10/10

F8szieFng-ID5T7gmvRCQg.text: This place definetly did not live up to the hype. Food was ok, but not worth the money you spend. There was food under my table and it took 5 minutes to get mayo and mustard for the burger I ordered.

qJzZGnkTiM0SkxwmMCggIw.text: decided to try out sugar factory in vegas after a good experience at the sugar factory in nyc. Ordered a pumpkin spice latte , it was very sweet and small. Isn't worth the money. Also got the apple pie waffles which were very delicious and the mixed berry crepes. Both were great.

5lmRFDDTRPpcQhFqcoOhng.text: We order ice cream for dessert... for only $14 really!!!  It's the worse ice cream I ever had !!! Taste like water .. No flavor !! Cheap quality!! Chefs what the he'll are you doing ?? Try your food !!  No wonder you guys close 2 times at the Paris casino and Town Square mall locations .. Never come back !!! Save your money !!!

sbYNsYs4cOfebA35-ZLIwA.text: I had the worst experience with a waitress/server by the name of Mijka on my birthday! She made rude facial remarks toward me after charging me incorrectly. She thought my friends didn't pay their tab & in actuality they did pay their tab! Although she charged us 2x for the same tab! I had a party of 10 & she was very disoriented the entire time she waited on our table. Almost like a deer in the headlights! She needs to work on getting the customers engaged in what the Sugar Factory has to offer by displaying a more positive/upbeat energy with the customers! She's lifeless. Luckily Gerard, the manager is the BEST in life! He literally made everything better & made me want to go back. I rate his service a 10! Mijka on the other hand need's a lot of guidance & coaching from upper management in order to be successful. If the proper coaching isn't given, I'm sure Mijka will continue to be rude, provide poor customer service & cause a deficit in revenue for Sugar Factory. The atmosphere is fun & is great for selfies. The food & Goblet drinks are the best!

Wz8P5_hPF1bmaphRXey_Sg.text: Food good. Appetizers came out same time as entries.  Service pretty good.  Energy great. Nice place.

RrCIxHbddBEZMMW2r1FQsA.text: Went here with my fiance for a date night and it was great! We tried the white gummy goblet and that was super good enough to share. Our server Erick was amazing! Definitely entertained us and made sure we were having a good time. It was a Thursday and it so happen to be ladies night at the chocolate lounge upstairs, they had drink specials and a giveaway which was pretty cool. The music was good and the decor was very cute especially outside on the patio area! Would def recommend coming here for date night or girls night for sure!

sGYuys3KM2KbGEvioOqzSw.text: Stay away from this place if you're coming in a group. We spent almost 45 minutes trying to split up the check ourselves because they couldn't split up the check in their machine. The food was mediocre. We waited 30-45 minutes for a flavorless burger and fries. The only cool part about this place is the drinks. $40 just for one of the goblets though.   Update: It's obvious that the managerial staff takes pride in their restaurants. One of the managers reached out to me and completely apologized for the experience and invited us back to the restaurant. This visit last night was 100x better than our first. We constantly had our drinks full, the food came or very quickly, and our waiter, Jason, was just very prompt in general. We got the appetizer platter and the pretty patty burgers. It was all pretty good. And we finished the meal with a fondue that was pretty awesome too.

X_5CS_cbsrekBkC5xurOaw.text: Food was good but our waitress barely stopped by our table and then didn't bring is all our change from a $143 bill. We figured the change could reflect in her tip.  My husband complained to the manager about our terrible service and keeping the change from our bill. The manager then followed us out to the walkway to bring us the change and tell us off for not tipping well enough. Tips are not and should not be expected! We are very good toppers when we get good service,  do your job well and you'll get paid accordingly! I will NOT return to this overpriced establishment.

sPfkHJyx8QowiFWMJj1-AA.text: I came here on Memorial Day around 6 pm and the restaurant wasn't busy or anything. I wanted to order the burger sliders with the colorful buns, but was told they ran out. We ended up ordering what I think was something like popcorn shrimp. It was alright, nothing amazing, have definitely had better elsewhere for cheaper. I ended up ordering a goblet. The goblet was amazing. I almost drank the whole thing by myself but barely got buzzed though and I'm someone who rarely drinks so if you're looking to get turnt then I wouldn't suggest spending that much money on a goblet. We wanted dessert so we ordered a brownie ice cream thing, I don't remember what it's called. We were then told they were out of brownies (shocker) but that they could substitute the brownie with a cookie. We were down because the lady said she would make it really special for us. Yeah...no. The cookie was basically concrete. We couldn't even eat it. I was genuinely scared of chipping a tooth trying to bite the cookie. It was ridiculous. The service wasn't great. The only friendly person we encountered was the guy outside leading people inside. Two stars- one for the cool dude outside and one for the good tasting goblet.

Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7Xg6C0YsXTVBxZecLnXltw.text: This place is a bit pricy and not worth it. Spent $14 on a piece of chocolate cake for my bday and it was horrible. The cake was served cold and was very dry. Nothing tasty about it. After that I purchased the smokey goblets for $40 and that was not very tasty either. I realize it's the sugar factory but this drink was way to sweet. Tasted like they added 5 cups of sugar. It was a nice representation and fun environment, staff was nice.

eZaVBHTkiNIlGqdNui91hw.text: We went back to the Sugar Factory and had a completely different experience this time. Our waiter was incredible and so was the food. We really enjoyed it this time and will definitely come back to this location! Thank you Sugar Factory for changing our opinion, it showed you really care about your customers which is a rare find!

c_Ipkq5svm9c6T-imqQHDw.text: Mike was amazing. I got the best server. My food was so good. The burger and Mac and cheese was absolutely amazing! I can't wait to come back to this place. My ocean blue drink was amazing!

V4piv9PqE0kfDe3_Ocp1Qw.text: Beyond Terrible service. The waiters and waitresses are like clueless zombies. Bad for kids. No kids menu. Not kid friendly- don't get fooled. This is not a place to bring your kids except for the candy store. Cute decor but that is about it.  Food is barely edible. Everything we ordered came wrong. To top it all off, they gave us someone else's check.  Total waste of money. Gimmicky.

Hja8Xw4R5kLHv2NTnKHaiQ.text: So, I ordered the Lollipop Passion and loved it! It is extremely sweet, so if you don't have a sweet tooth then I don't recommend it. The really cool thing about it, though, is the dry ice. At first, all they serve you is a bowl of ice but then they pour your drink in and steam pours out of the huge gauntlet. The process is really cool and if you ever see one of these places you should really go. The only bad thing about it is the price. Each one of the drinks is 30 dollars... Also,  we came around 5 and it looked pretty dead. It would've had a better atmosphere if more people were there and the Vegas lights were lit up. Other than that, it is a really cool place I that I really enjoyed going to!

mQN4KGdmEOEVL3R5P0NZEg.text: Had my 21st Birthday dinner here about 4 days ago & It did not disappoint! I called ahead of time with Sabrina who is the Events Coordinator. Since I had about 15 people joining me, I had to pre-order the food and everything which was understandable & insightful. We were escorted to the 2nd floor with a beautiful view of the strip. First thing, wow being escorted pretty awesome, and it was very nice because the 2nd floor was a little quieter than downstairs. It was a bit dim, so we asked if they can turn up the lights a little more which they did with no problem. After dinner we decided to take some pictures outside where the gazebo was which came out very beautiful. The staff, Emon, Ellie, Omar, Courtney and Dave you were all awesome and very welcoming. Special thank you to Sabrina who handled the whole reservation, I wish I could've met her in person & to our main host Emon for his patience and incredible service. Overall, the ambience was truly amusing and charming. My friends and I had never been to this location before so we were all exceedingly impressed and loved it. I would absolutely recommend this place to anyone celebrating a special day, they will take care of you! Will definitely be coming back sometime soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PTa_lRmFY-0U-xb-Ex-hoQ.text: WORSE Restaurant  on the Strip...STARY AWAY.. When it was located at the Paris hotel this was an awesome place. Great food and service.  Then they moved to Fashion mall, it sucks big time. I went there when they reopened and had bad service and the food tasted bad. They took off the menu, the great tasting drinks. My Well done  hamburger was raw. sent it back and it came back medium. Just ate it and left. My wife's club sandwich was dry.   We tried it again on my birthday. Again, really bad service, several of our party had to send their food back. We bought a Big Smokin drink for the kids for $35.00. mostly filled with ICE. about 10 oz of fruit punch and very little smoke. we sent it back because the fruit punch was sour and tasted like crap. the kids hated it. it was suppose to be a sweet drink. My BLT bacon was raw.  We all left their vow to never come back.  HOWEVER.   Last week my wife and I were at Wynn and she bought a groupon for breakfast at the Sugar Factory. So we though, How bad can they ruin breakfast? Well they did. I ordered an Eggs Benedict and my wife got a Bacon egg croissant.  Mine came with salmon on it, and my wife got a ham croissant sandwich with no egg. I told the guy who brought it that it was wrong and he goes, OH and walks away. We finally got our waitress  to sent it back.  30 min later, I got my eggs benedict cold. my with got bacon and eggs. eggs were raw and bacon was raw. We talked to the manager who was ruid and she said she would comp  another meal for my wife to go. I just ate mine cold. so they took back her bacon and eggs and she ordered a Club to Go. So basically we gave them a groupon for 2 meals, I ate one, sent one back and the Club was suppose to be free. we got a bill for 3 meals. I was pissed. she said she would take that off and then came back and wanted $5.00 for tax. 20 min later still no Club. At that point my wife and I left. NO CLUB. $60 groupon for a cold egg benedict.   The next day we went to Denny's got 2 breakfast for $14.50 and it was hot and yummy and quick.

aEdCGTctOM6EtPSwIjUcmw.text: Amazing service and friendly staff. I had the Apple pie waffles for breakfast a couple days ago. The waffles were amazing!!! Deff come here and check it out. Dave the bartender is awesome and very friendly!

KCkboxssuhwm6LSL4u5kUA.text: We had an awesome experience! The drinks are great and we had excellent service from Carla.

WbIBjhcLkSpv-0ClESIMjw.text: Saw pix of the cute place & drinks we decided to try out this place for a bday dinner. Our drinks & food order was taken pretty quickly. Food was ok. I ordered the Salmon nothing too great. If it wasn't for the lil sauce they had on the plate I think it would have been too dry. But the sauce was yum. The drink was tasty but too pricey since you don't get to keep the cup. I ordered the same drink the day before on the strip paid $38 & got to keep my cup. The restaurant was $42 (I believe) & if you want the cup its $15 more. We also ordered a shake that we kept asking the waiter for. The electricity went out therefore we were not able to order anything else so our dinner was cut short. Note: we never got the shake we ordered from the very beginning yet he said because the lights went out they were unable to make it. Yet it was ordered & asked for over & over. I can't say I'd recommend this place. I don't mind spending but as long as I feel its worth it & the experience wasn't great here.

73fAvtp9DJcohZuuwQ3PCw.text: Anne Marie was amazing, she took such great care of my friends and me. The bowls are so good and the food definitely helps with the drinking - so delicious. This is a MUST VISIT when you go to Las Vegas!

D7QG3t0eneuOCccXFLCYLA.text: Great! Our server was Adrian E we got the energy bear goblet

f9HZ1j8RbRCyXVbyC_9hyQ.text: Update: I decided to give this place another try and from what I see, they have improved extremely since their first opening week. Jennevive, Sean, and my waitress were very pleasant and made sure my boyfriend and I were well taken care of. I absolutely enjoy their menu. It's full of yummy and interesting sweet beverages (you have to try one of the Goblets). The ambiance is lovely, classy yet hip and the environment live and fun. I'll definitely be back with some friends and family!!!  Not a good experience. I sat at the bar and was served by an Asian guy, I believe his name tag said "ST"... unfortunately he wasn't as enthusiastic with me as he was with other patrons. I sat at the bar and was ignored for about 15 mins, even the patrons sitting next to me were inquiring and wondering what was the deal. So I finally spoke up and asked if I could order. I ordered my drink but I wasn't given water like the other customers. He poured the drink and walked away and never gave me a straw. I had to ask another bartender, who I also had to make my food order with. She was great (sucks I can't remember her name). The drink was delicious and though my food order took forever and a day, I was comped for my second drink. All in all, I probably won't return. I'm unsure why I didn't receive the keen service as others but it was very disappointing to experience such at a reputable restaurant.

JyOpdkTlKQDQ3DkRrF3jCw.text: A great exprience...good food big portions. Staff is wonderful. Ejoyed it so much came 2 days in a row.

QJIZZTFSryF4lYH2B3gF9w.text: We are in town for a soccer tournament. A few of us purchased a Groupon to use and our boys were so excited about eating there. There were four adults and six kids. We sat down and the server was extremely rude when he said he wouldn't split the check with us. Then we told him that two Groupons and he said we could only use one and we should've read the fine print that there was one Groupon per table. We asked to speak to the Manager. The server then came over and threw a laminated copy of the Groupon fine print to us. We asked to have us sit at separate tables and were told no. The Manager didn't come talk to us and my husband went and spoke to someone else. They explained that since we came in together...we are considered a group and they wouldn't do it. Oh...and the restaurant was empty. They wouldn't even consider letting us move tables. Needless to say, we all got up and left. Hoping that Groupon will give us our  money back. Worst customer service ever.

B32A3WYcBUXzuHsIZGTg6Q.text: Breakfast was inedible and expensive! Eggs dry and tasteless.  Shocking server!  Manager is pathetic. They don't care. Complete tourist rip off!

pxmrWXH_HA2pKuaySTag9g.text: In theory, it's great. The shakes look fantastic and creative. They are disorganized and unprepared. We wanted to have the special ice cream with cotton candy that we read about online, but that was a special so they didn't have it. That's not so bad. Since it was over 100, we walked really far and 11 o'clock at night, we decided ice cream would be refreshing. We sat down at a booth and were served ice waters by a very nice waiter. There was no ice cream on the menu, only specialty shakes and $50 troughs of ice cream. The waiter told us to wait in line where they served the custard, sorbet and ice cream scoops and then take it back to the table. This was confusing because we were taking up his table and paying at a different place. No one told us where the line was so we waited for a really long time without anyone helping us.

gDbFkX2KKTnRf9abBuGDEw.text: We celebrated my son's 12th birthday with two of his friends, and they absolutely loved the whole concept.  They ordered the Lollipop Passion Goblet drink and decided to take our waiters advice by having them share it (Huge).  Then, after each having the Signature Burger, we ended our meal with the Signature Fondue.  The staff all sang happy birthday with a festive sparkler that made our lunch memorable!  Thank you Sugar Factory and Justin!

H-apz5gFrJxxEMPmrsVRjw.text: The first time we came to sugar factory it wasn't the best experience, unfortunately. However,  they reached out and wanted to make it right. I told the young man at the door I had a reservation and he knew my first and last name which I thought was pretty awesome. He walked us in and to our table and almost immediately our server Terri came and introduced herself and went over some menu items with us in a way that wasn't so "robotic". It was very conversational and when we asked questions she was able to answer them for us. Terri was super sweet and friendly.  Now, you may be thinking "well, they're gonna be extra nice this time around. They're making up for last time". Not at all. We noticed the other customers were receiving the same treatment and service, which shows this wasn't just for me. I strongly believe my first experience was a one off, and I thank Jennevive for extending out an invitation to show us. We had a great time, great drinks, food. Can't wait to come back! In the mean time I'll enjoy my own drinks out of my souvenir cup! Couldn't resist!

wziVkq1754IqvqrwaPjrPg.text: The kids loved the milkshakes. So much that we went twice. The chocolate martini was delicious and, of course, who doesn't love the smoking goblets. The food was mediocre at best and not worth the money. My friend had an average grilled cheese. I didn't get my omelette because we waited so long for the server it was 4:02 and they stopped serving eggs. That was just one example of the awful service. The first time we went for drinks and dessert service wasn't bad although it took about 20 minutes to get an extra spoon and another 20 for the check. The second time it took 30 minutes to be seated even though there was nobody waiting. Then about 20 minutes for the server to take our order and then about 40 minutes for the order to arrive. We had to ask a different waiter about our food. We made sure to ask for the check when the food came. Of course, they charged for the omelette I wasn't allowed to order. They took it off obviously but it was just another example of the horrible service. This place desperately needs a good manager and a better trained staff especially with the prices they charge!

YzNiccKNHZnz_mBXBw7DPQ.text: I should have wrote this review back in May when I went for my birthday. After reading everyone's reviews I feel I need to speak up. I use to go to the Sugar Factory at the Paris for years! It was amazing, never had a problem. When they closed I was Devastated. I was excited when they open a new at Fashion Show. I decided to go for my birthday, we went on Saturday, May 13th, I called and made a reservation. We went to the chocolate lounge because I was excited for their menu compared to down stairs menu. Every time I passed by when shopping at fashion show I would look at their menu board outside. I was so excited!  Well we get there and they don't even have the menu available. Strike 1. The place was completely empty. (Red flag) we were the only customer for a long time.  We order, it takes an hour for our drinks and food. Food was cold. It was the menu from downstairs. We were the only people there. I was trying not to cry. My friends had asked for sugar factory to do something special for my birthday (I didn't know). Which ended up having us sit there for an extra 30 mins-1 hour for 2 scoops for vanilla ice cream with sparklers. Apparently they had forgot and then changed us when they said they were comping it. And then over changed my cousin $20 on a $40 bill ($60) and they denied over charging her. And she had to dispute the transaction with her bank. She also had a $7 ice tea that tasted like fish, it was disgusting!  We all ended up getting food poisoning. My birthday was ruined. I tried to stay positive but after we left I started balling my eyes out. I will never go back to Sugar Factory. It's nothing like how it was at the Paris.   The manager on duty said he was going to take care of us for my birthday, but didn't do anything.   Over priced. Horrible food. Long wait. Food poisoning.   You can't pay me to go back there. Thanks for ruining my birthday.

eyNsA8upAaOr6nO5B5XRYA.text: I have to admit I don't write as many of these as I should. We stopped but the store wasn't open yet. Anxiously waiting and eager to try the Strawberry french toast and Apple waffles. The coffee was excellent and food off the hook! The prices were as expected for Las Vegas. The thing that made this first time experience was our server Justin! Justin's attention to detail was beyond my expectation. We eat out A LOT and there are VERY FEW servers that exceed my expectations. Justin may be only one of a handful of people I've sought out the manager to tell them about how wonderful they were. "Examples: Justin brought us new silverware because he didn't like that they ones we had weren't polished. He brought me extra strawberries when I questioned if I got the mixed berry or strawberry french toast. (They only have a strawberry version that has a mix of raspberries, black berries and strawberries.)" I can't give enough stars to how much this experience has raised the bar even more for the rest of the serves I encounter!

e1SnYjCTpNPlVJv49Lqezw.text: 1. The prices are out the roof for how much food you get 2.waiting for food takes an hour .. when I went the place wasn't full 3. Food was cold 4. Drinks didn't even come 4. waist of money don't come here they ain't good hummy

RE3mZEzrNei8ttosH_80vw.text: Run! This place is so NOT what it's hyped up to be. They must pay up the wazoo for these celebs to promote this kind of crap. The food was bland, the wait was long, and the service sucked balls, literally we got 2 visits from our server and never saw him again UNLESS he was tongue kissing the ass's of the larger parties around us.

P_zS3bwvruX_LxCWf3uCLQ.text: Came here for breakfast because we had a Groupon. I was really excited about this place and been wanting to try it for some time. The host was sweet and talked us up a bit which was nice. Our server was very attentive and friendly which is why I'm giving this place two stars instead of one. The reason for the low rating was the food. It was cold and bland and terrible. Prices were way too high for that quality. I got a creme brulee latte for $13 and it was served in a tiny cup and halfway through it it got terribly sweet. I've had creme brulee lattes before so I am aware of how sweet they get but this was gross. I drank it anyway needing the caffeine. I could've gotten two coffees at starbucks next door and still had change in my pocket. The potatoes were stale and cold and they give you half a scoop. I can't even compare it to the freezer bag of potatoes you would get at the super market because even those taste better. The New York steak and eggs was a joke. The steak didn't even look grilled. There were no grill marks and it looked like someone slapped it on to a cold pan. No good looking sear or anything. On top of that it looked like a cheap diner piece of meat. It was a very thin small over cooked piece of meat. The picture makes it looked like a thick cut beautifully grilled slab. They give you one piece of toast too. For $22 they couldn't even give you a full order. $7 for an order of bacon that wasn't even thick cut but looked like something you would get at a drive thru. I got the Alaskan Benedict. You know when you forgot to zip up a bag of meat in the fridge and the edges become hard and brown? Yeah that's how the edges of my soles salmon looked. I work at a breakfast lunch and dinner spot that sells food half the price but higher quality and properly cooked. Unfortunately my boyfriend and I aren't people to complain and ask for new plates especially since we didn't have time for that so we just paid and left.

CAk_fPmmkQywhzWTXX8YHQ.text: Came here during the afternoon after seeing online promo for buy one get one free for the famous goblets. The manager then came over and informed us this deal was no longer available even when we showed said coupon. Food was actually very good. But when the checks came I found out my drink, not a goblet, was the same price as entree. Menu does not show cocktail prices so watch out. Also be warned, the "souvenir" cups you get for the goblets are in no way free. They are an additional $15 after paying $35 for the drink. All in all, I would recommend avoiding this touristy gimmick of a restaurant.

MBwzLbTpRYuN_DksUICulQ.text: Chaz was great. Had a wonderful experience at the sugar factory. Jamie is doing a great job at managing. Great drinks. Great atmosphere. You have to try it.

NA274CQAnDYtm6cdUx59Mw.text: Sat down and we're told...after 10 minutes that someone would be with us shortly. In the mean time the music was so loud it was impossible to have a conversation with the person sitting next to you. 10 minutes passed and the waitress said..."I'll be with you shortly...wait...I just told you that...I'll bring waters in a minute". 10 later no waters so we left. On the way out told the manager and hostest and got the "she was bring your waters right out"...in other words it was out fault and she didn't care. The restaurant was only half full in the middle of lunch so it must be a trend to not serve thier customers. We ate at the Stripburger right around the corner and had a great burger.

CdHrlJW3vqJ5JN1Vnq2wPQ.text: Good time with our team bonding over SUGAR! Yummy drink and sundae!  perfect for sharing!

KqTJfQd21FLVJHP0Zu-hcg.text: Not sure where to start with this review. This was by far the worst dining experience and it really comes down to our server, Alatise.   We were a party of 11 that had a reservation that we made through opentable. Being were in Vegas and such a large number we had to Uber to the restaurant, so we all arrived within 10 mins of each other. The first 4 arrived and seated pretty quickly. Server greeted them in a very rude manner with "what do you want to drink?" No, " Hi! Welcome to Sugar Factory. Can I get you started with something yo drink?" Second set of our party arrived just a couple of minutes after the first and again no warm welcome! The last 4 of our group arrived and waited a good 15 mins before they were acknowledged. I understand it's difficult when a large party doesn't arrive at once, but this is Vegas and should be expected. Finally after about 25 mins the last group got drinks in. Orders were placed and I will say the food came out as ordered, but the quality of the food for its price is a huge disappointment. Best I can compare their quality of food to is McDonalds! Our dinner service continued with our server being continually rude to the group, so rude that one of the individuals in the group couldn't take it anymore, so they asked to talk to a manager. No much was done except we did see her pull the server aside and talk with him. You'd think that would make him step up his quality of service, right? Nope!!! The evening proceeded with continual poor service and our server being rude. After telling our server multiple times we were celebrating a 21st birthday he finally managed to get our daughters birthday dessert to her. I will mention the manager did have our server bring out the $60 birthday dessert, which was very impressive. We finish with dessert and had to flag down our server for our checks. This took a lot of time. Then we asked for separate checks and he said he'd be back to separate them. Instead he returns with 2 checks. 1 that did need to be separate but another with 4 other checks on it. When we asked why he didn't separate the checks his response in a rude tone was "because I didn't know how it was gonna be split" Our response was "it's because you didn't ask!" Then to top it off we got charged with the birthday dessert we never asked for! The server made us write down on a piece of paper who's check was who's! Seriously?! After we do it ourselves we decided to talk to another manager. He listened but honestly didn't seem to concerned. He did give our party 30% off each check and gave my daughter a $100 gift card to spend in their gift shop. The night took a total of 3 hrs for dinner service. Server rude, lazy, and incompetent. Our Sugar Factory days are over!   The entire meal should've been comp'd.....after all we complained to 2 different managers because our server WAS that bad! 30% off our bill and the $100 gift card to buy stuff in their store to promote them just wasn't enough. Big picture is we paid them to treat us poorly. Thanks Sugar Factory!

8RfbrBROJvFbGEyq6gjpdA.text: The service was amazing! They were pretty busy when we arrived but they made huge efforts to know they would be right with us.The atmosphere was super cute everyone was very hands on with our experience and the food is a little pricey but it was just as good as the service!

iknGv_FS0t9wRpZQSfnZuA.text: Had dinner here with my hubby whilst in vacation in Vegas.  We started by having one of the goblet cocktails whilst sat outside before our reservation,  the bar man was great really fun to chat with wish I could remember his name, he was from Bosnia though.   We moved inside for our meal, hubby had the NY strip and me a turkey burger, I also had the Lemon head martini which was very good.  Food wise it wasn't the best meal I'd ever had but not the worst either.  I wished I had room for one of the crazy sundies or milkshakes as I think that's probably where they shine.  Crissy our server was just lovely and we liked her a lot.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kMxkbRJn-FYoJ51T2YZpcw.text: Food was great and our server was super sweet. I had the chicken fingers which were good and my boyfriend had the club which I tried and was equally as delicious. The drinks are the greatest part. I had the Grape Crush drink and it literally tasted like Grape Crush but it came with a nice little buzz ;) We shared a dish bowl with gummy bears and the RedBull in it and it was SO good. Total was $100 for 2 drinks, 2 lunches, and 1 fishbowl which was a little steep but when in Vegas... Will return!

68lXXRMvHrq8jcKv8xJyIw.text: Great food and exceptional service, Chanell was very helpful and kept our table with drinks at all times. Definitely the place to visit for a birthday, splurge on the birthday cake!

qGOkTJdMMAzZQWlJ7xIk2w.text: If you love candy and sweets this place is great, if you like really delicious desserts, do not expect it from here. I was hoping for a delicious warm gooey fresh baked brownie and the one we got was hard and tasted like it was baked the day before. The fudge was cold, it was just mediocre.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jNXlm_crTyKbVcrhoD7c3A.text: I really enjoyed my time here today. The food was good I ordered eggs Benedict and my husband had the steak and eggs with a side of bacon and everything was reasonably priced and well peppered. The place was clean and the mimosas were deliciously fun. I would definitely eat there again our servers were Jonathan and venespa... I hope I spelt that right they were awesome polite and very tentative. Five stars!!

bN3iIjwbnM11ZOAsxzAzeA.text: Great atmosphere good food. Fun place to have some food. Had the ribeye steak. Food prices are a bit expensive but I think it's worth it.    The service was good. We will come back to try new foods for sure.

3-l1DK455zUIP8wbzjb5Vg.text: The service was so great loved our waiter. Coming from Oahu hawaii I was waiting for this .Food was awesome and also a must try for the signature  drinks is called the "raspberry watermelon mojito " ! Thanks sugar factory for this amazing experience.

Lix8VSnPcR5Y9VlaZY_pBg.text: This is a mostly touristy spot, but fun place to grab dessert BUT only dessert. I'ved lived in Vegas most my life and theyve changed location about 5 times but looks like it will stay at fashion show.  Prices are steeeeep. A goblet with alcohol is $40 and we could not even taste a hint of vodka in ours. My friend said her crepe was good and my $17 burger and fries were just average. Her crepe was pretty small and I actually think more expensive than my burger at $18. Service was friendly and fast. Again, come here purely for their milkshakes and desserts. Goblets are tasty but only worth it if you want a nice Instagram picture.

BQSdqAK6_dQlvrLM8TUPFw.text: The drinks here are amazing to look at for the kids and adults. For cool factor this place earns 5 stars...but it ends there.  The food is mediocre. Stay away from the burgers. The buns are either stale or just really dry.   The burgers don't have any flavor at all. The club sandwich is good and the fettuccini is really good. The desserts are pretty cool as well. This place is just so over-priced.

VBE0a-8RecPnbvHWE341QA.text: We stopped in for some dessert cocktails. We had the chocolate peanut butter and the red velvet cake. The service was great. The red velvet cake cocktail was awful- tasted kind of like pepto bismol, rather than robustly chocolate. I won't order that one again, but the chocolate peanut butter was amazing.

CCZvasSNJO1upZI7kktTFA.text: Came across a post on IG about this place and thought it would be cool to try it when I came down for a visit. Finally had a chance to try it and man it was exactly what I expected. Our bartender for the night was Jeremias and he did a Fantastic job with our drinks and took care of us that night.

cawG5nauKIla3GNattCgnQ.text: Cool spot, cool vibe, cool menu.   Menu is expansive. Wanted to try all the drinks and milkshakes.  Got 2 of the big 60oz punch bowls. Menu doesnt have prices. Watch out. $40 a pop!!!  Drinks were good, but it added up quick.

ZmNrvqJoLb22dg-Ef1x13g.text: Wonderful place and great atmosphere !! Our server Rhonda was awesome  would definitely recommend

VQ4gCdVZTpumh6sV851_dQ.text: Ohhh myyyy goddddd!!! It was so good, drinks and food excellent. The only thing better was the waitress Channel, a must see and ask for Channel. One of the managers Rula was super awesome and accommodating.

YGjVTDskbHfADyjLtwMpww.text: Went in last night to try this place out after hearing about it. All I can is this place is just trendy. The food is not good and service is terrible!!! I ate on the patio, which allowed ALL menu items 1/2 off, however, I was later told AFTER I ordered my food and received my bill it was only for entrees and appetizers. My waitress never informed, maybe because she barely interacted with me

rcMqRIrvgmSTIGuaHNlzPQ.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE! If you go here to eat I would recommend to go downstairs. First of all, it's beautiful! It's themed like a carousel! How fun! The music is BOMB! If I could compliment the DJ of the playlist maker I would! I was singing and dancing so much I barely noticed the wait for the food! The drinks are amazing, you can share the big drink with 2-3 people. Food was great! I would def tell everyone to make a pit stop here!!!

3J6RD4UuDaSAmf9iXeKV2g.text: I was a bit disappointed with our experience a few nights ago. My husband and I were celebrating our wedding anniversary and was hoping to have a fun night because we rarely have time for date nights between our busy schedules. I asked the hostess if we can go sit outside and she said yes and she would send a server out to us. We are very patient people but sat there for more than 30 minutes and no one even came to greet us. We almost walked out until my husband flagged down a server. We stuck it out to make the most of it because it was our anniversary but I don't think we will ever go back again because of the service alone.

IXQ8yQTQdREajrg87hAjSg.text: Music was very very loud and dining room had a very strange odor like maybe they had used a sour mop to mop the floors so that didn't start it off well for us. We ordered two of the goblets (price isn't on the menu but they were 80 dollars!) mine was terrible and I only took a few swigs out of it my wife's was good tho but not 40 dollars good. A lot of money for a drink that cost about 10 dollars to make at the most. Next we got two milkshakes that were completely different ones but tasted exactly the same just bland with no flavor. The server was very nice and came back and forth a lot and made sure to check on us that's the only reason I gave them two stars. I didn't try any food only drinks and sweets. Attempted to order a dessert but they said they no longer sold it. Two milk shakes two goblets was like 130-140 dollars. Same price as my multi course meal at Hell's Kitchen take my advice and just go to hells kitchen and not waste the money at this place

hwJpHUlZC2QcCg3BLBMN8A.text: Food is awesome and the drinks are amazing. It's in the Vegas strip and the view is great if you dine on the second level.

Tn4DmhgkDmXdTg8WJhwyOQ.text: We had a 4:00 reservation on Saturday.  The restaurant wasn't that busy and we would have been seated without a reservation with no wait.  Our waiter was very slow and not very personable.  We had one of their novelty cocktails.  It was definitely a unique tasty drink but the alcohol was very weak.  (The drink was $30+, so we expected it to have plenty of alcohol.) The food was good but not great.  The waiter didn't even offer us dessert.   We had to ask a manager for the menu to decide whether or not we would have dessert. I am glad we visited the restaurant but don't plan to return.

xqsMsnjo0rYyCDeoQ6LjCw.text: I don't even know where to begin....  I messaged sugar factory to ask of they had discounts for locals because my mother was coming for her birthday from California and i wanted to take her someplace fun! I received a message from Jennevive. She let me know about a 20% disc for locals and made my reservation for me on the spot. I asked what she recommended I should order for my mother for her birthday and she stated she would provide "a little something" for her on the house she was sure to enjoy. So sweet!! Well...... they did not disappoint!!! When we arrived we were greeted by our waiter Brandon M. Great service from the moment he said hello. The atmosphere was upbeat and beautiful. At least three different people who worked there asked us how everything was and made sure we were happy. I cant remember a time I received such good customer service and with a smile on every single one of them!  My daughter ordered the Dulce De Leche Milkshake. It was exactly how it looks in the menu and absolutely delicious. My mothers martini had her feeling happy and relaxed. The food was top notch. Not joking... the fries...Yummy!! My mom and i ordered salads. I know that was silly at a place like this but they were so good!!   Well when they came out with the " little something" for my mother......I couldn't believe my eyes!!!! The lights dimmed and at least ten people followed our waiter singing happy birthday to my mother. I didn't know who to record my mom that was brought to tears or the huge gathering that was singing. Brandon was holding the biggest bowl of ice cream with ice cream cones, whipped cream, so many toppings, candy and fireworks shooting out!! It was HUGE!!!!! The look on my mothers face says it all. I was so happy to see her this excited. She was like a kid on Christmas morning! This was not at all what I was expecting. They went over and beyond!! I truly am grateful to every single one of you at Sugar Factory for making this a memorable birthday experience for my mother. I wish i could go back and hug every single one of you...... Jennevive, thank you, thank you from the bottom of my heart. That night meant so much to us.

IlKJ06evbXCP_JgysRR24g.text: My time here at the sugar factory was very satisfying! It has a great atmosphere and the staff is more than friendly. The goblets are huge and can be shared amongst 2 or 3 people if you'd like. I ordered The Watermelon Patch and it was delicious! Overall, I highly recommend stopping by if you are visiting Las Vegas!!

C85NpNenOCO5DMsaDGxPHA.text: Very loud. Like a night club. Barely can hear.   Food good.  Turkey sandwich dry. Nothing special.  Calamari good.  Blue cheese burger great. Love it. Would have another burger for sure.  Salad ok

I9r2kszlJaX86xzFcamenA.text: One of the BESt LV recommendations!! Staff was AMAZINGLY nice, service was great, SHAKES WERE AmaZING! Super sugar overload but worth EVERY calorie #GigglySnickerShake

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. GIggly Snicker Shake

1BPK5nJ55U9tVYq3OUxihA.text: Dinner and desserts were actually really good and our service outstanding! We are always looking for a kid friendly fun restaurant and we thought we found it until a bald loud mouth man came yelling as we were taking a picture  of my daughter and her cousin in the front the restaurant next to the yellow duck. He completely embarrassed the sweet hostess in the front as we let him know she gave us the ok to take the picture. Not knowing who was this loud mouth man yelling from a distance as We later found out it was the owners brother! The approach should have been totally different, perhaps some training when working with the public not just because you are the owners brother does it give anybody the right to speak to anyone the way he spoke to myself and my family. We will never be returning to this place! My 9 year old daughter and her cousin were shocked!

TX7SR4Oy-JTRnL-0UpP5yQ.text: While visiting my day daughter, son-in-law & grandson a few weeks ago l had the opportunity to buy a Groupon for the Sugar Factory! The pictures of the deserts had fantastic presentation value. We all went there for a late lunch. The restaurant is beautiful on the inside with chandeliers on the ceiling. The ice cream shop is to the left when you enter. My daughter and I tried numerous samples of the many fun flavors there while we were waiting on our meal. We ordered the BBQ Chicken pizza and a Mac and Cheeseburger and Blue Cheeseburger with Fries. Overall the food quality of the burgers and fries was average in taste. I expected more from the Mac and Cheeseburger. The Mac and cheese while overflowing onto the plate looked and tasted like it came from a box. The BBQ Chicken pizza was my favorite food item. It had a nice tangy BBQ sauce and a delicious presentation. For desert we ordered the Brownie Bread pudding and the Chocolate Peanut Butter shake. The bread pudding came without brownies but this was quickly fixed by our server who provided friendly and attentive service the entire meal. The shake looked awesome with peanut  butter cups on top. It was thick and had the added tastes of marshmallow. The Sugar Factory is a little pricey but it is a great experience just to go there. Someday I want to return to try other menu items and the ice cream parlor.#yelpvg

Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate Peanut Butter shake#yelpvg
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. First version Brownie Bread pudding without brownies#yelpvg

FLWSoLja6bEp3WwgCDCpxQ.text: The decor is nice but the service is horrible! My chicken on a salad was so dry that made it hard to swallow so it was wasted. Server never brought a drink requested, billed for a $19 dollar milkshake that they ran out of and charged for the other milkshake that was ordered instead. When asking the person delivering food for something he said to ask waitress. It would have been nice if there were more than one servers in the restaurant to help, especially when there were only a few tables in use. We brought a cake for my daughter's birthday dinner. After the server suggested to add a $5 sparkler to the cake to add sparkle, she just brought the sparkler on a rice crispy and the cake was left on another table. We ended up taking the unused cake home to celebrate.

7SXlus_O13BzAjv3M3iUIg.text: The sugar factory itself has a nice concept, as well as service, and is even located just outside of the fashion show mall. However, I must say that once the food arrived, my family and I were disappointed to see the very small portion of the crepes we ordered. The worse part was not only the size of our servings, but the price of it. Every item on the menu was SUPER pricey, even for the smallest portions. I highly recommend that you shouldn't come here, especially when your on a budget. Overall, the food at The Sugar Factory is very disappointing, when you consider the price. Unfortunately, it's just a giant rip-off.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZoboSXOgn8lpWI5qNe_lqQ.text: It's exactly as it's described. Not something that I myself would get more than once or twice a year. Postmates brought it our way and Sugar Factory made sure everything was in tip top shape when it did. For that one splurge it was perfect. Insane. But perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Q8pDHhC7T6ZrYFNJy50lFA.text: A good place for kids. That pretty much sums it up the food is decent. I got a burger and fries, which were ok. Not really a place for adults in Las Vegas. Really touristy, which equals inflated overpriced. I will definitely be taking my daughter when we go to Las Vegas as a family. Take the family

4rzhXfrH-amvr8aClihZAg.text: We came here with a Groupon and brought the kids to try it out. The kids enjoyed the playfulness of the food art. We ordered the Rainbow Sliders, cookie monster milkshake to share, and a basket of fries. I would say, if you love sweets, come here for dessert for sure. We wanted to try more, but didn't have the room.

kSZHORoMWsJD3KbCFQThXg.text: Warning everything is expensive. But everything is over the top. Goblets 60 ounces with dry ice loved it. There is a candy shop with all sorts of gummies and gelato. Drinks were wonderful avaign just expensive. Cute cute place.  The brownie sundae was only ok brownies were hard. Will be back. Park (free) in red zone of parking garage go up escalators and turn around - go out door to strip.

BoH9T7s5kjsULTIgJqf2Kw.text: This was our first visit and likely our last. This place is definitely more about the drinks & atmosphere. We were looking for a nice hearty, delicious lunch after donating blood and this certainly was not the place for that.  Everything was quite pricy on the menu, but the pictures looked amazing so we figured it was worth it. I ordered the big cheesy and my husband ordered the farmer, we both asked for well done on the burger. When they came out, they looked fairly decent, but with one bite, that changed. They were a frozen burger patty with a lot of fake smoke chargrilled flavor, very reminiscent of Burger King. My burger had macaroni and cheese on top, it was simply some Stouffer's frozen macaroni and cheese. My burger was cold as was the macaroni and cheese. My husband's burger was still bloody inside.  One thing I can say is that the service from Betty was superior, but the food was definitely not worth the price.

cI2RkPqxq0KcAEdrCSAXZw.text: Took a long time for the food to come I ordered a well done burger it was super pink in the inside my wife order chicken alfredo noodles was over cooked wish I could give it zero star

dYbWRGX0afnGcfl45Dj9bw.text: I absolutely love coming to the Sugar Factory when I am in LV. The goblets are a must if your over 21 and coming here to eat. I have quite a few of the menu none of them are a bad time , highly recommend the lollipop or the ocean blue if your apprehensive.  The food is amazing and the service is too. Our waiteress Auriel was informative about the menu. Asher provided awesome service for our table as well keeping the watering flowing and energy up. We will definitely be returning during our trip Id invite anyway who enjoys good food and drinks to go as well.  Thanks again guys

LfVfzJFDXclR0lJTvpt9ug.text: Came to the Sugar Factory to meet with Sabrina about planning my best friends bachelorette party and was greeted immediately with the hostess's warm welcome. I talked with many employees about the extensive drink, food and dessert menu and everyone was more than happy to suggest recommendations for us, as there were many awesome options to choose from. I ordered a raspberry watermelon mojito goblet which was brought out and poured in front of us, delicious! After meeting with Sabrina and seeing the restaurant I am so excited for the bachelorette and pleased with how smoothly the planning went.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3JmRaXYA32N5YVja0cTz1g.text: I was super excited to try this place and was extremely disappointed. Went to get a goblet which was $38 dollars  (which i knew) but you do not get to keep the glass.  You can get a cheap plastic knock off for $15. The drink itself was way to sugary.  Drank the whole thing and no buzz just a headache from sugar overload.  Will not go back.

k2Reo_syhASDxMt9bD_MKw.text: Ariel was freakin amazing! She was very informative and attentive. The salmon was absolutely amazing. It was perfectly cooked.

ppxzgZ4lPNDdvj2FT4WWoQ.text: This place was great. Our server Travis was very professional. He recommended the best food for me. Sugar factory was a dreamy place.  Next time I visit Las Vegas, i will come here again 100%.  ThanK you Travis

Kf03hFG9gdjPcB3GTSYkrQ.text: The service was friendly and the food was good, though the prices were high even compared to other places on the Strip. The main reason to go here is for people who are interested in their large selection of deserts and sweet drinks.

88K93vqv5YGrDWCTgbyvkw.text: This place is amazing! Came for my 21st birthday dinner and had a blast! Good music, good food, and great drinks! Our waitress Nikki was the bomb! Love the atmosphere! Prices are good for the quality and great service!

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Mlckz1MESuCK99fj4LVlLw.text: I have been wanting to dine here forever!  The food did not disappoint!  It was so amazingly perfect. My friend and I shared the rainbow sliders (how freaking cute are those?!), the garbage salad and a red velvet sundae. The reasons I'm not giving it a solid five is because it was so incredibly loud in there I pretty much had to yell at my friend across the table from me.  It was hard to hold a conversation with anyone..I wish it hadn't been 115 out or we would have sat outside where it was slightly quieter. I get that it is probably part of their ambiance. The service was meh....Nothing special.  She kept my water glass full.  The one thing that kind of turned me off was the use of profanity at the table by the server. There is a certain level of professionalism that should be maintained and I was a little put off by that.  Not that I am a prude by any means but those words shouldn't be used in conversations with your guests--especially when you have a young child at the table with you.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Velvet Sundae...sooooooo good.
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rainbow Sliders!  And yes, they taste as good as they look!

hi9bHcbXioSSNHmx6zcFmA.text: My crew treated me to Sugar for my graduation celebration dinner. All of the food was tasty, even though there was kind of a wait for it, but the staff was very friendly. The environment was very active with the music going. There were many celebrations that night so the air in there however quickly became stuffy with all of the heat and smoke going from the fireworks on all the dishes they provide everyone. They need better ventilation. We all had a lot of fun nonetheless.

gVQpNe0FLr6MHD8mlMCe1w.text: I never yelp but our experience today calls for it.  There was a mix-up somewhere along the line with our order. (we were a slightly high-maintenance party of six with kids and cocktail-drinking adults) When the mix-up was discovered, our server and the manager were jaw-dropping responsive to get us all squared away.   Exquisite customer service today!

-EKKukCDDV7mb37zyRKDGA.text: One of my friends wanted her 21st celebration at Sugar Factory at Fashion Show and our very kind friend Adrian surprised us with coupons to use, which was unexpected but very exciting! The surprises didn't stop there, our server for the night had the best customer service, Dan. He took his time with everyone's order, gave us a special walk in the sugar factory backyard with the carousel and handled each goblet drink with care and of course surprised the birthday girl with a dessert. A regular 21st dinner turned into an exciting night thanks to Adrian and Dan amazing welcoming.

DRXhDmAZ-e5LKECBqSLY5w.text: Came here to celebrate our friends 21st bday. Made a reservation and walking we were greeted and taken care of all the wonderful staff. Ambiance and music was perfect for the night. Everyone was friendly and they really want you to have the best experience here.   Our waiter Dan, who was more than wonderful, took care of our big party and made sure every single person was satisfied and happy. Adrien, another worker, went the extra mile to make sure our experience was as memorable as possible. If it wasn't for these two we would not have been so happy. They even let us into the carousel to take pictures and gave us a cake and sang happy bday to our friend. Thank you Adrien and Dan for everything, you guys made this an unforgettable experience!

AtemXfRT4Bi1hkMLCXJ3jw.text: Not only was the food excellent, but the entire staff was friendly from the moment our party walked! Our servers Dan and Adrian were great. They hyped up our party's birthday girl, helped us get some great pictures and snapchats, and of course, provided excellent service! 10/10 recommend coming to this Sugar Factory specifically!

YOO_3KTJdy8vFAHhWYRQbA.text: Adrian and Dan provided excellent service! They were kind, helpful, and provided an uplifting vibe to the environment! I will definitely be coming back!

sNuixQRs5EilApNTm9KHkA.text: I mean what could get better than sweets and alcohol, well good service just adds the cherry on top! Absolutely amazing staff, CASE, KIM on the main bar down stairs you both are amazing and the reason why people sit at bars to get an experience with a little bit of excitement thank you for keeping us entertained! AND ugh Shaun the manager absolutely over the top service, checked on us and even recommended a MUST have goblet! We shall be back ! Keep up with the sweet service and the drinnnnnks!

Kghvtom6KCchbb7cKkkkPQ.text: Let me just start by saying this, I was expecting A LOT more than what we got. It's very fancy but we waited almost 25+ to get water, then our waitress was VERY rude cutting off the little girls at the table and being snappy. By the way his name was Ricardo. He rushed us and then expecting a $20 tip even though he only interacted with us twice and both were rude interactions! The food was good but I wouldn't go there again unless I was guaranteed GOOD service!  It was my boyfriends moms birthday and I'm sure that ruined it for her. Thanks Sugar Factory!

Jf8P4STq_e40Hgps9YQ4gg.text: I believe my sister was also doing a review but I wanted to do one as well. Only thing knocking this down to a four star was the wait process if you want to place that under poor management be my guest. Had a reservation for 8pm and arrived early and wasn't seated until 8:20 8:25. The hostess was visibly frantic and very apologetic as there was other tables with reservations also waiting. Our server was Menz and he was the best part of our experience beside the goblets and food. I'm one to casually observe my server when the restaurant seems busy. I noticed this young man was handling at least 4-5 tables, 2-3 of them being rather difficult tables of 8 or more from the looks of it that is. (I think a dance competition was in town) Nevertheless my small party of three was taken care of from beginning to end. Menz gave his drink recommendations and checked in to make sure we were okay. Sad to observe what I assume was the manager giving him a little talking to (hopefully nothing too bad as I just said this young man was handling multiple tables and large parties and on top of things). When my friends and I come back to Vegas and should we come to visit, I will be requesting his section. Now onto the food. The goblets were amazing! I had the white gummy and was very pleased. I had the buffalo wings and they were hot in all the right ways. I will say the wait time for food was a bit obnoxious but not Menz' fault so no blame there. My sister had the alfredo pasta with shrimp and ate every bite. I had the grilled cheese with tomato soup. My soup first came out with the bowl barely half full and cold. Menz happily and quickly took it back and brought me a filled hot serving. It was very delicious. We also shared the fondue and that too was yummy except for the brownies. Oddly didn't taste well with the milk chocolate. All in all if the wait periods for tables and food weren't too long I'd give this place a 5. Cheers to Menz for AMAZING service.
