issZl3HeNCKAUFoTcUMYcw.text: Love the atmosphere. I visited your Las Vegas location on the strip and had a awesome time. I treated myself to a mid day brunch. I was in town for my cousins' born day celebration for the week. I was exploring the strip alone and saw the Sugar factory and stoped in for food. I ordered the Peace,Love and Harmonie drink was really good.I got a really tasty waffle and eggs.I got to say I though it was rather pricey but it's Vegas Had a great time and the food was awesome with a very attentive staff and when I return to Las Vegas, I will return. Also my area has a location  I can't wait to visit.

y5F8Nb56vvZ0QWYFKRBgEw.text: My nearest and dearest know I'm always hunting cool & colorful places.   When they come across something visually appealing they haven't seen on my social media feeds, they'll tag me. Sometimes demand to know why I haven't been... appalled even.   That is how I came across this place a friend tagged me when she found out I was going to Vegas, then I started to google it and found out they were having a grand opening, a few weeks before we were scheduled to arrive.    Immediately made reservations for our first night there. Online reservation was easy, I didn't even have to print out anything we were on the list.  Day of: We were not going to make it timely, I tried calling to make them aware but was told to get there ASAP.  She didn't have time to go let their hostess know.  We were fashionably late. They were packed, large crowd in and out doors.  I gave my name and the look upon the hostess face. Priceless.   "We mark you as a "no show" after ten minutes"  *insert annoyed emoji*    Good news, I wasn't turned away, but we lost our table indoors. I was told THE Backstreet Boys were to make an appearance. They did, I have pictures and video, shaking hands and hugging. (worth the extra wait)  We waited about 30 minutes to be seated, which is not bad considering the crowd. It didn't feel long due to the hustle and bustle of standing directly in front of the celebrity dudes. *no longer boys*   They were going to seat us outside in front of the crowd, my girl friend was not having it. N.O. *they bicker* The hostess looks over at me and I say "look, I know we were late, I am sorry, but I booked it because I saw the beautiful decor and the fancy drinks, we are not here because of the backstreet fellas." *insert pouty face*  She said "I only have outdoor tables, let me take you upstairs", we walk out of the restaurant, around the crowds, up the stairs, & up to security.....  My eyes and smile couldn't get any bigger. Started wiggling in my skirt doing my happy dance, "Yes! This is what I want, no better place! Is this where we are sitting?" *dancing, clapping, silly ear to ear grin*  The most beautiful "willy wonka" (not willy wonka but you get it) area I have seen in real life. It's so pretty!!! We sat in a gorgeous gazebo & the lighting was perfect. Yes, I am outdoorsy, like getting drunk on patios too! I was asked a million times by my friends are you okay? I had gone over my limit but I was in magic land.   We sat just on the other side of the Backstreet Boys, window between us, their waitress was our waitress.   She was slow, but because she was busy, and she made it up to us.  Service, although slow, was great! She was a sweetheart. Appetizers, Steak, & Goblets on point. If you have anything here it has to be a Goblet. Just for fun!

I would definitely recommend this place to EVERY single one of my friends!! So you should come give this place a try and have the stereotypical 'kid in a candy store' experience!

mb8xZ_GZ9z5oOzglrZ6KxQ.text: After all the celebrity hype over the years, what better time than a bestie girl's trip to try out Sugar Factory for weekday Brunch.  The location itself is eye-candy from the outside in. The top level includes a lawn area of white tulip-esque flowers, rather reminiscent of marshmallows, alongside a huge rubber ducky, cupcake and lollipop statues. Inside, the place has a sort of candystore/ice cream parlor vibe with lots of black, white and red. Chandeliers hung practically everywhere.  I had made reservations on OpenTable beforehand, although upon arrival, I realized that it was unnecessary. We were seated immediately and chose to sit by the window facing the strip.  The menu here was no joke at 46 pages. I would say half those pages were used just to detail the elaborate goblets and drinks. At $40 per goblet, these babies are not for people on a budget. But seeing as we were here celebrating my bestie's bday, we decided to go all out and split one. We decided to take the waitresses recommendation and ordered a Watermelon Patch. A waiter brought us our drink when it was ready, the liquid inside a shaker and the goblet empty with just ice, dry ice and watermelon candies. As he approached he says to us "Would you like me to wait as you take your phones out and record? Now is when I'm about to pour, which makes a good Instagram" This was hilarious! I mean, he was right, but I had just never heard a waiter straight say that before, definitely gave us a good laugh.  The drink itself was pretty good, sweet and actually decently strong. Tasted exactly like a watermelon sour patch kid and omg the huge watermelon gummy sliced that came around the rim were FREAKING AMAZING!! Best watermelon gummy I ever had, for sure!  Part of the reason why I chose this place for brunch is because its one of the only places on the strip that offers a weekday brunch menu. We were both in the mood for benedicts, so decided on the Sugar Factory Benedict x2.  The wait time from ordering until the food was in front of us was decent. The plate itself overall, was a bit underwhelming. I will say that I really enjoyed the fact that they layer a nice crispy hashbrown in it, and the asparagus was also a nice touch, though they were a little overcooked. Thankfully, the eggs were nicely poached, delicate and jiggly, with a nice yolk-y center. Hollandaise could have been a bit more punchy when it came to the lemon flavor, but was silky and coated the eggs nicely. The english muffin underneath was completely limp and not toasted, too bad because that little touch would have made such a big difference!  Although the experience here wasn't terrible, it also wasn't that great. The food and drink is pricey for less than desirable quality. In the end, the price point reflects "Wow-Factor" more than taste. If you're hellbent on trying this place, by all means do so. You won't be 100% disappointed but also no guarantee that you'll be 100% satisfied. Only time will tell if I give Sugar Factory my vacation time again.

A9x6hp_r-d4uyEcj3OrAbA.text: Just got out of a show and wanted to grab a bite to eat so we headed off to the Sugar Factory, another place we had to check out while in Las Vegas.  It was a quick walk from Treasure Island to the Sugar Factory in Fashion Mall, the Sugar Factory is super cute on the inside, pink, black, white lush and sticky sweet.  Since Valentine weekend was coming they had a special Goblet going, it was Bubby Kisses Goblet, it was Brut Champagne, strawberry rum, strawberry liquor, grenadine, fresh strawberries and gummy kisses. That's what my friend ordered, and I got to try it, man was this a great tasting drink and it was fun watching it be poured with the dry ice and smoke.   I went with martini's that night, started off with a Caramel Macchiato Martini, it was an espresso martini with caramel and chocolate swirled in the glass and fresh creamy whipped caramel vanilla foam, perfectly sweet. Then I went for a Chocolate Mudslide Martini, it was vodka, Kahlua, baileys Irish cream with chocolate drizzle & chocolate rim and dark chocolate shavings, oh hunny this one is dangerous, this is a grown-up version of chocolate milk, so smooth you don't know what hit ya till you stand up. Give me more!  After checking out the menu I went with a Grilled Chicken Breast Sandwich which slow roasted chicken, swiss cheese, avocado, romaine lettuce, sliced tomatoes herb mayo on a toasted French baguette with French fries. The toasted bread, the avocado, tender chicken, so dang good! And the fries were delish too!  Sugar Factory lived up to the hype, this is a fun spot to eat and people watch. I'm sure I will be back.

1iBxpl_RXB7Z05cJiETTNA.text: All around good eats! Everything was on the bigger size of portions and tasty! I kept it simple to a Club Sandwich and only consumed half! sVi9XeSyoknKkJsN9KjHgw.text: This is my second Sugar Factory experience and my opinion remains the same. Aesthetically pleasing drinks/desserts! It's a bit pricey, but I do feel like the experience is worth it if you've got a little money to splurge with. My friend really wanted to try them out because I told her about my experience at the Miami location. She was so excited to try a goblet drink. We ended up getting the watermelon one and it was honestly pretty good. I'm not a drinker at all, but I really enjoyed it.   We both ordered burgers. I'd say it was a pretty good sized burger served with a side of fries. I wasn't really up for too many sweets, but they do have a candy store in the front for some extra sweets! We went on a Thursday night and there were lots of parties there so I was expecting slow service. It ended up not being bad at all.  As a bonus, I got an offer for free avocado toast with entree purchase when I checked in on Yelp. I didn't redeem it, but I thought it was nice to have.

WlpH6x4omBRWb8xd8kui1A.text: Really only came here for drinks and desserts, but did end up ordering the appetizer sampler.  I gotta say was not expecting much from the food here, but the sampler was fairly good.  The wings tasted pretty legit, chicken tenders were fine, onion rings were good, and the fried Mac n cheese was pretty tasty.  The main event of course was the goblet for $39.  The server brings the glass without any liquid than pours it in front of you and the drink begins oozing gas everywhere pretty cool.  We ordered the watermelon raspberry mojito.  The drink was outstanding and refreshing, all of the candy went well with the theme of the drink, would definitely order these again even at $39 very much worth it.  My son ordered the Cookie Monster milkshake he went insane eating this absolutely loved it.  Obviously a great spot for dessert and drinks with surprisingly decent food as well.

sPeUFiGSzuShBSgAwrXE8Q.text: Was invited back here to give them another shot. So I decided to have my birthday dinner here. We requested to sit upstairs to have a quieter space to enjoy our dinner. We were given the menu and our waiter took our drink order.   I ordered the chicken Fettuccine Alfredo and the bf got the donut burger. The pasta was good, I think they did go a little too heavy on the wine though. The burger was alright, sweet and savory isn't my thing so I didn't enjoy it as much. We did get the watermelon mojito goblet and it was very sweet. Then we ordered a king kong sundae for my birthday.   The sundae was great! There was so many layers to it and the ice cream was surprisingly very good! We killed a good 60% of the sundae. This time around, the food was definitely better. The server was alright though....he was very slow at responding and wasn't tentative. There were times where we had to really wave him down. The bartender was great though! He would come by and check on us multiple times. I wish he was our server. Overall, my friends and I really enjoyed ourselves and the food.

nhubpzjEhE8OK1gvi7qwsg.text: I was trying to live up to the hype because so many people I've know or celebrities have been here and I couldn't understand why it was so great. VERY expensive, and A LOT of sugar... had me leaving feeling a little qweezy if you ask me.   My friends and I stopped by here on our last day in Vegas to try it out before our flight took off. The place is definitely very cute, old school diner/modern kind of a theme. We didn't try the food, but decided to get the huge sugar bowl drinks without the alcohol.   I don't remember ever seeing any prices on the menu when the waiter handed it over. It was honestly a mistake from my end for not asking, but I guess a part of me though "there's no way it could be that expensive". The drinks are definitely aesthetically pleasing, but after learning that they were about $30-$35 each WITHOUT alcohol, I felt a little ripped off. I can't imagine how much it would've been if it was with alcohol because our bill totaled about $70-$75 NOT even included tip yet.     If you're curious to see what this place is all about, please let this review save you the time and money and go somewhere else! There are many delicious places throughout the strip that cost 80% less than this place & definitely doesn't fill you up with straight sugar.

-0ccBIV6O1al6WDQ0WOk8A.text: My son chose Sugar Factory for his birthday dinner. The music selection is always great. The food is ranges from good to great.  We ordered buffalo wings, Sugar Factory Signature burger, buttermilk onion rings, sampler platter, fish and chips, blue cheese bacon burger. My son also enjoyed his ocean blue goblet.   The onion rings are amazing, just wish the portion size was larger. The burgers were great but fries didn't seem as fresh. Our daughter loved her fish and chips, it was the right amount of food. Our sons are a big fan of the buffalo wings. Next time I will just order dessert since it always looks so good.  Overall, since the kids love the atmosphere and the food, we will be back.

0CA7q6uas9kUKfOp5Q6bIQ.text: At the mall needed food. Ive never ate here before and decided it was time as I had heard wonderful things.   We came in and at first we were seated at a little table under dank lighting. We asked to be moved to a larger table as we had a bags with us. We were able to move. During this time we were given the standard water.   Our waiter came by asked if we had been helped, I said no not at all. So he explains why we haven't been helped,  then takes our order. When you check in on Yelp they give an appreciation Bruschetta. I show the waiter this, he asks to take my phone to his manager so it can be taken off. I was hesitant at first to just pass my phone over.   Our food arrives with the Bruschetta at the same time, not separate how a appetizer would be. I thought this was odd. We ordered the club, the grilled cheese.  Nothing else. We were never even asked if we wanted anything to drink. So I just watched. At this point Im irritated as the food isn't cheap. Not extremely expensive but still.   Finally after eating, I ask the waiter for the check and boxes. He asks do we want dessert. So I asked him why didn't he ask if we wanted something to drink. His reply " I saw you had water so I thought that's all you wanted" I responded, I would have spent good money on drinks in here, but you never asked. I stated I always drink hot tea with all my meals. SMH  I give him my card to run, thinking this tab was a little high. Then I look at the receipt, they still charged me for the Bruschetta. I point this out, he takes it to the manager comes back with a new receipt, stating it is a new manager and that is why I got charged for it. ( they took my phone in the beginning of this )  I came in here because I thought it was going to be a better experience than it was. I don't think I will return. This was a big disappointment, as everyone brags about this place.  Location is at Fashion Show Mall 15/ Spring Mountain.  Ample parking.

-365Yc56XawS3yS5ndSfxg.text: The goblets were cool and entertaining. But the food was okay. Not worth $20+ for an entree. Tried the fish tacos. The tortillas were raw, and were quite small for the pricing. Guacamole on the tacos had no seasoning. And for a side it was just chips. I have definitely had better tacos at del taco.

GkoeVrFMYq8unwN9WSQkzA.text: Not a high end fancy restaurant but the prices are expensive for cocktail drinks so be prepared.  The desserts look fun and so do all the different shakes they offer. My husband said the chocolate shake was very good!   I ordered a Caesar Salad with grilled shrimp. It was good. My husband ordered the filet and expected it to be just ok and instead said it waS EXCELLENT! Not bad for a ice cream shop style restaurant.   Fun place to come with a group after the club or before! I wish I could afford to eat high calorie desserts because I would have tried their brownie  sundae.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peace, Love, Harmonie

M_pKmSB7wxfq_wU8iyzekQ.text: Were having a good time! I'm loving the decor in the restaurant like old school ice cream parlor. The chandeliers are breathtaking! The food is good and big portions! Our server has been on top of taking care of us! And the goblet drink is delicious!  Definitely enjoying myself and would love to come back in the future! Definitely helped us to enjoy our vacation!

PmMS7QGla8OWwStAx-rJvA.text: Shawnee n ashley are the best ever. They were very helpful and patient. They exceed and r truly the definition of quality costumer service. If only there was more people with this type of attitude a lot of business would have  returning guest!!

DTu9PjI8QkjMtKZMcUdNFQ.text: They had great service and great food. Fries were seasoned well, steak was melt-in-your-mouth amazing, Yukon mashed potatoes were a delicious delight, and asparagus was grilled to perfection. Definitely recommend to anyone !

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6FNv1gKrzPzFYXW9t3PFog.text: Great service. Food came out fast. The food was amazing. Really upbeat music. The milkshakes were our favorite they are really decorative and they taste amazing. I definitely recommend to come here if you're ever visiting Las Vegas, you won't be disappointed.

l43-i2rkMA_MyPNkOxo78Q.text: My birthday is on Valentine's Day but I work all day so my husband asked me where I wanted to go and I have been wanting to go to the Sugar Factory so he took me on Wednesday cuz that was my day off we sat there for like 40 minutes a manager came by and said that he would send a waiter to her table he passed by again 20 minutes later told us that he would send us a waiter then he told us that he was sorry and that he would send as an appetizer to the table so my husband is l atino and looks Latino so when the appetizer got to the table I noticed that my husband's expression kind of changed a little bit and it was because they sent us chips and guacamole I asked if there was something wrong and he said no so after this happened they sent us a waitress and we ordered and everything was fine and then when they brought her food out we got our drinks last after this my husband's face when the food came out he didn't eat and I was I kept on asking him why and he wouldn't answer and I think he didn't want to make me upset for my birthday so yesterday I asked him what was wrong and he said that nobody had ever treated him like that that first the manager passes by and give them chips and guacamole and then he saw when the manager told a waitress to please go to the table and she turned and looked at our table and made faces so he said that he was very uncomfortable the whole time that he was there cuz he felt like they thought maybe he didn't have no money to pay the bill and that made him very very upset and he says that every time he thinks about that place that gives him a bad taste to his mouth and this is why I'm giving this review because I do not think that people should be treated like this or even feel uncomfortable especially when they're paying for the food and for the service and not just because you're Hispanic or any other race you should be treated differently...

Nfw6MYQastJZqaYkFQ4neg.text: This was a huge disappointment! My daughter has been wanting to come here for 2 years to get the huge goblet drink. We ordered the Lollipop Goblet, one of their most popular, and the waitress said sorry we are out of those, so we ordered the Watermelon Patch and asked if we could get the lollipops in that one since they were out of the drink, sure for another $8.00. This drink was completely full of dry ice and hardly any alcohol,  it had so much ice we could barely get our straws in it. It ended up costing us $46.00! Now we ordered the Rainbow Sliders and a salad for lunch, the sliders cost $24.00 and the salad was $19.00 with hardly anything on it. The sliders were barely warm and had no taste. Since we drove 3 hours to come here we wanted to have dessert of course! We got a sundae the triple chocolate one, now I have to say it was wonderful but not worth $16.00!  Now we had assumed for $46.00 a drink you would get to keep the glass, wrong!! The glass was an extra $15.00, so since this was her #1 reason for wanting to come here I bought her the glass. When I asked the waitress if we could get a clean one since this was still full of dry ice and candy she said no, it will be an extra $10.00. I about flipped out at this point, I said surely you can dump out the glass because we can't take it like this, and she said well I  don't so, I told her to go find out that there should be no reason they can't do that. She then came back with a clean one.  The waitress was not attentive to us at all, first of all the presentation of pouring the drink is a big deal, and I had gone to the restroom quickly, when I returned she had already poured it, she couldn't wait 1 minute for me to return and there was only 1 other table with people in there. She never came by and asked it we needed condiments or water the whole time we were there. Now to top it all off when we left a girl was sitting at the outside bar drinking a Lollipop Goblet!! So they were not out of them!! This small lunch venture costs us $150.00. I will never go back it is a huge rip off!!

X82xEa24JYfyOEdT0MWUxA.text: Wanted the milkshake and was so pumped for it. The server kept ignoring us and served everyone else but us. We waited for 20 minutes before they took our order and he kept walking back and forth, not even acknowledging us. He even served people who came after us. We are soft-spoken so we waited quietly and just as we were about to walk out he came. It would have been one thing if he said I will be right with you guys. Shake was good service... not so much. Probably won't be coming back.

pxZcuRx-68dG23woogoQ4w.text: Updated: went back with friends to sugar factory and requested Manny. Cannot get over his service!! He had multiple tables (including a demanding high profile one) and you would've never known because his service and attentiveness remained 10/10! Thanks again, can't wait to return!

jOZfYd3o_7a8c53HBngDeA.text: Horrible service, incredibly loud music, over priced drinks, and terrible food!!! The food is like a bad cafeteria. Worst turkey club I have ever had in my life. Had three different waiters who knew nothing about the menu and were quite annoying. Oh and the bathrooms were broken and they were out of milk shakes, pizza, and several other sides. What a joke. I took my seven year old nephew and luckily he liked the the thirty dollar candy drink he had. Bad bad bad experience.  Was contacted by management to atone for their subpar performance and when I reached out to bring my mom I was never contacted again. Wow! Lived in town for 15 years was a concierge for7 years. I have never been to a more mismanaged restaurant on the strip. It is the Chuck E Cheese of Las Vegas Boulevard. Don't waste your time go to a real establishment.

x0HWpY-HEVbDESmiIMXwWg.text: Came in for my birthday and everyone was so kind. Everyone from the hostess to the lady who took us up the elevator. Jeremias the bartender was fantastic!!!!! Thanks man!!! Birthday made!

pOTEfh5I-sq4aDtm-wQShQ.text: Love coming to this place! I have never once had a problem eating here and the last server I had, Jake, was probably the best so far. I would recommend requesting him to anyone that hasn't had a good experience. I'm always hesitant about eating out by myself with an 8 month old but they have been so accommodating and don't make me feel bad about him screaming and yelling at times. I'm a huge foodie and ice cream person. If you're going here for dessert, you HAVE to try an Insane Shake! Chocolate Rocky Road was to die for. If you don't know what to order, go with a burger because they are delicious!  The atmosphere is so much fun. Thanks for doing a good job, with as busy as you are, guys!

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate Rocky Road

RkZf3fgRCXUgww440AL9eQ.text: They had a large line which is usually a good sign. We ordered two regular shakes which came to over $20. The shakes were much much smaller then you would expect for the price they charge. Once we got the shakes they were good but not nearly as good as other shakes we have had. Long line, expensive items and not the best I've ever had. Would looks for another option next time.

t2TRKCV3reGcf6lSoXHRzg.text: This place is a must do in Vegas especially with kids. The lunch was delicious, the goblet drink was good! Got a little tipsy, husband too, rainbow sliders my kids said were yummy, my chocolate covered milkshake with a cheeseburger was yummy, my husbands club sandwich was good too! We ended our visit with a ice cream sundae with a sparkler for my son's birthday! Everything was great, slow service with one waitress... poor girl, but we were patient and she tried her best! Now this place was good, heck a'pricey but I knew what I was getting myself into and won't reduce their stars because of that! We left satisfied, full bellies, and happy.

mYoyS6FZrIYNCoVPAWEKuQ.text: Horrible here now they ran out of cups, got no water for about 30 min after seating.  Almost a hour to get food, waitress never check on us had to walk to bar to order drinks.  Just absolutely horrible experience and this my first time here. Oh yeah finally got food in incorrect bowl they ran out bowls.

aHlaQ3wUa144fB1QfZcq7g.text: Extremely slow service. Waited a half hour for food and when it came the fries were not included. They forgot they took them off the menu. Credit to the manager for comping the entire meal but the sloooooow service is inexcusable when they had 10 tables full and 20 people on staff. Love their drinks but their food is not Vegas quality.

ZwxglR81labqrGVl3Y5tKg.text: Great experience!!! It didn't hurt that the food and service was excellent, as well! If you're ever in the area put the Sugar Factory on your must do list. Ask for Jonathan, he's awesome AND patient.  Memories made!!!!

ahezCPzn64iLVI1YDQ05XA.text: My friends and I decided to see what the "hype" was all about and go ahead and make reservations at the Sugar Factory. After you get over the initial shock of their $40 drinks (it IS Vegas after all) the prices of their food were pretty much what was expected and the drinks though pricy are good. I ordered the turkey burger which was surprisingly moist and delicious. However, the fries weren't all that great. One friend ordered the Caesar salad which noted as being good and another friend ordered the quesadillas and returned them because they were very bland and got the shrimp Caesar salad and also enjoyed it. This occasion was also my birthday and the server noted my pretty "birthday girl" sash and explained the birthday packages and I pretty much said something on the lines that, "I don't pay money to have someone sing happy birthday in a restaurant". So in short, no fancy music, ice cream or servers singing, "happy birthday".  The hype of the Sugar Factory is at best overrated but may be worth the stop if you gotta say, "I've been there in Vegas".

NhqoaPh_bfyyT0B8OI9lJg.text: This place is sooooo good. My fiance and I split the watermelon patch bowl which is huge. You can feel the alcohol hit you after you drink one but you can't even taste the alcohol in the drink which my fiance loved because he doesn't usually drink. We also got French fries and a berry crepe. He thought the fries were good and I love how generous they were with the berries in the crepe. It's a little pricey but definitely worth it. We'll be back the next time we come to Vegas.

rSU2WMVvoBJV94OV0svDJw.text: Let me just start my post by saying myself as well as my family are all in the industry so we totally understand "busy service" however on this particular night there wasn't more than 10 tables in the entire restaurant.   My family came in for my sisters 16th birthday as it was her choice of restaurant. After being seated the server came over about 10 minutes later (not terrible considering we sat with an incomplete party) and brought water and about 10 minutes later returned to take a drink order. Before us ordering he never informed us on what they were out of so every time we tried to order something he would say "o sorry were out of that" it got to the point where we were asking "what do you have" once we gave him our drink order we informed the server who appeared to be for sure high and possibly drunk that we were ready to order our food as well. It wasn't for over 45 minutes that we then received part of our drinks. We originally ordered 2 goblet drinks both non alcoholic, one milkshake, two glasses of wine, and an iced tea. When the drinks arrived he only brought the two goblets one of which did have alcohol so that had to go back and he forgot the other drinks. After waiting 45 minutes for the wrong drinks and not even getting them all we spoke to the manager. A blonde woman very professional and courteous she assured us that we would be getting the rest of our drinks shortly. Then to come find out they didn't even have the wine we ordered so we had to change our wine order twice because all they had was Chardonnay. Once the drinks were resolved we questioned when the food would be out because at this point we had been waiting almost an hour and a half since ordering. Mind you WE NEVER SAW OUR SERVER AFTER HE TRIED BRINGING US THE WRONG DRINKS. AT THIS POINT IT WAS ONLY THE MANAGER TAKING CARE OF US. When the food came, they brought two additional entrees we did not order so they took them back to the kitchen. I originally requested for my sandwich to be made plain and it did not come plain but I feared saying anything in the case it may take another hour and a half to receive a new one. There was a puddle in front of the women's restroom that I personally had slipped on with no wet floor sign. HELLO !!! Are you asking for a lawsuit ??? To top it off we saw our so called "server" trying to grab the managers butt while on the dining room floor how ridiculous can you be? They tried to make it better by bringing us the King Kong sundae which was a very nice gesture however the awful service for the two plus prior hours was not forgiven. Not to mention those two extra meals we were brought that we did not take we're on our bill. 9 people eating with 11 entrees come on really ? I'm not sure if it was a lack of training with the staff or just overall carelessness but it was definitely an experience to remember and not in a positive way and as a local I will not be returning nor will I recommend people to come here.

0WoPjPqt-eoE7ctyjmpv1A.text: We had a great time there and the service was great it was a bit expensive but It seems like everything is expensive here in Vegas so you have to stop looking at the price And just Enjoy yourself.

PshV_fVvXjy8f-f81K1GRg.text: Rylee was an awesome server.! Extremely friendly and willing to accommodate any requests. Request her if possible. Great food and atmosphere!

Qam34YnoMejZo5khh_tYPA.text: NIKKI is aaaaaamazing! Came here to celebrate my birthday and had an amazing time !! Totally recommend coming here :)

JLbMvKVVVFgyl6ODMnQxQA.text: Meh...just ok. The atmosphere is is super cool! The food was ok and the service was awful!!! Like really bad! We had to ask for EVERYTHING...refills, ketchup, the check...the guy never even checked in to make sure that our food tasted good! I don't think it's worth the high price tag.

THrBqMVBfRT1bXEyGeadaA.text: We felt very welcome by the manager Luis. Our server, Trevor, was fantastic and the bartender, Nell, made the best martinis ever! First time ever ordering a black and blue burger; it was rare and delicious...highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A delectable selection of chocolates...our fav is the dark chocolate basil truffle!
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy chocolate orange truffle martini

tUHaga1V7tFQsfY4z7S2Nw.text: Coming back for their waffles!! Serves the cutest drinks but I wish I could have gotten a hot drink with my waffle. Couldn't pass on the eye candy.

WctuQ4qeViRZmVlxLU_bMw.text: Extremely discouraged at the service.    It took over 45 minutes to get my food.  The diner was not that busy.    I was not alone with this as I saw two other tables walk out    It appears the management staff just walks bout in a trans and doesn't even comfort the customers with the delay on food delivery.  After all the waiting, they we considerate enough to reduce my bill in half!

AR0uXthhsz1xzlgRnQxNaA.text: WOW. This place doesn't seem like anything till you get inside and order your food. I suggest getting coupons from the people outside for the food and goblet drinks. My fiance and I ordered the goblet drinks with the coupon that said 2 for 1. We saved a lot of money because the goblet cost about $36? The experience is amazing though. You see everyone recording when they get the drinks. Yummy candies inside and one drink does you good! The desserts are amazing as well, but if you come for food, I'm not sure how much you can eat the dessert! The food comes in good quantity. The spinach and artichoke dip was my favorite appetizer along with the chicken wings. Shoutout to the waiter Chase, who was really kind and gave the best serve in Las Vegas to us! Definitely recommend this place. It is a rememberable treat ;)

QXDAQyAZC8Rr3r-uKdFx_A.text: I'm very disappointed with not only the service, but the food is awful as well.  I don't even think they deserve 1 star. When I made the manager aware that we hadn't received our milkshakes in an hour and a half, he didn't even apologize. He just asked who our waitress was. It's almost as if this is normal here. The waitress told us another table was waiting 1.5 hours as well. I would not waste my time or money on this over priced "restaurant"

Tr-y4y2EiSiRDIOul5fMSw.text: The service was friendly and quick. Food was delicious. Drinks were out of this world. The milkshake was fab

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Signature drinks for worth. Worth the money
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate peanut butter martini

W5jMKWt7N42xxOpH2pd0Kw.text: This is my favorite restaurant on the strip! You must get a lollipop passion goblet! The sampler appetizer platter! As locals we dont mind driving 45 min to come and sit in Erick's section. He is hilarious and will give you the full experience you deserve to sit in his section. Amazing customer service satisfaction everytime! Thank you again Erick and Sugar Factory

YdWbjJ5F6FGe9TNfdA72lg.text: Try the candy bar shakes, they are amazing!  I had the Twix shake, and it was a taste of heaven.

gNv1YIJB-oTmcFZHQZmASA.text: SO RUDE! Went with a group of families, excited for a fun and memorable meal. We had purchased Groupons to help off set the cost of the $19 milkshakes, etc. Upon being seated we notified the server of our plans, I feel it's courteous to address it at the beginning. Our server immediately lashed out at the idea of us using more than one per table. Apparently that is a rule of the fine print, which he ran back to prove with their laminated copy, laminated- which tells me this is a recurring issue. He refused to accommodate us in anyway. Not even moving to two tables - "we all walked in together so we are set as a group."  Following even misguided rules is fine and had the server, or any of the staff we spoke with, addressed the issue with the slightest compassion for the inconvenience or miss understanding, we would have happily stayed. I am still appalled at the lack of costumer service.  Instead we left and it became a good learning experience for our children to see that you don't spend your money at rude, disrespectful establishments. If they are so against using Groupons, they shouldn't offer one.

DNESXUy-EfO7fg6-kpsr2w.text: It's a tourist trap so ended up here with visiting family. Definitely a dessert place, my burger was good but the milkshakes and ice cream cookies were better. Received great service from Josh. Will return when I have a craving for sweets.

tUg7WF0vpkZpi3rFXCtrAw.text: Crazy bougie expensive for what you get, but the mac n cheese balls are life changing. Wish it was less of a touristy spot. Would be really good if the prices were more fair.

goTHDrOHgzdb_Bz80wSrCQ.text: We had a great time at this place! Zoey, our hostess, was extremely helpful and sweet as she guided us through the numerous options. She made our experience 10x better! Thanks again, Zoey!

I4yBJuYHaPRNENp4C7Az8w.text: THERE IS NOTHING SWEET about the wait staff at Sugar Factory. 2nd visit, multiple waiters EACH time, SAME OLD SALTY STORY. DON'T EXPECT patience, eye contact, a smile, a refill on your water, to keep your menu without receiving an eye-rolling, or to keep your plate until finished. DO EXPECT a mild tug-a-war with that plate you weren't finished with, borderline attitude, to see more staff than patrons cheerfully conversing in an alcove while the floor remains practically void of staff, & your bill thrust in front of you under the watching/waiting eye of said waiter who says, "You can add your tip in here". I've given 2 stars due to a hip club-like environment, & trendy but decent/varied food choices (great salmon benedict), with some uniquely tantalizing desserts (yummy & plentiful cookie jar sundae) & huge, smoking dry-ice libations. I gave this establishment another chance after a year ago when my daughter had one of those libations explode all over a new shirt. This was met by a waiter who disappeared & never came back, & a manager who, when notified, could've cared less & didn't even offer to adjust the bill or pay for the cleaning bill. Maybe Management's attitude is responsible for the way staff present themselves. 3rd visit won't be charm because I'm not going back.

e8SGtej0cmZl5bSoRu_9NA.text: Took my 16 year old niece visiting from out of town and son here.  I was excited to experience the Sugar Factory with them.  Turned out to be a bust.  The goblet drinks were "ah" worthy and tasty but way over priced at $34 each with no alcohol and you do not get to keep the goblet. The fact that no price is listed on the menu should have been a clue.  The food was not good and was expensive for the quality. The fried fish for my tacos were not seasoned.  The alfredo with shrimp was bland. The hamburger was not cooked to specifications and was greasy. Although the server was nice, she seemed overworked. It took longer than expected to get food, to get the tab, and she only checked on us once. I would have rather spent the $140 elsewhere. I can't recommend this place and will not return.  There are too many other restaurants in Las Vegas with good food that is reasonably priced and good service.

qGWQlcE1DEiD1UiGzPaohA.text: Love  this place! Can't wait to go back in july. One of my absolute favorite places in Vegas great food, drinks and desserts.

7QprXHrCufP1UC4jdCAqiw.text: Very poor servicethe waiters did not pay attention to what I needs and completely ignored, I never accepted such a poor service, I was a guest should have this service?I will tell my friends not to visit this restaurant

kKa2-KBwseFcMjV-p3iyNQ.text: Is there an option for 0 stars? Third time I came here and tonight for my birthday. 1st time around grand opening had a reservation for Valentines day and they neglected to call and say they were not opening on time, we showed up and had no where to eat on Valentines day- I wrote to restaurant on FB i think or company site got no response. 2nd time decided to try the place for my sisters birthday about a year later, it was terrible. Food was gross sent back a couple things (waitress even said meat looked terrible) the "fried" ice cream my bf ordered was soup and disgusting. Our waitress gave us a 50% off food card for our next time she told us they may have had an off night and to try again. So here we are my birthday. Came with some friends ate, had the kind kong sundae. Our friends gifted us a groupon we used for 2 duck drinks, at the end of the meal were told we cannot use the groupon with the 50% and we cannot use the groupon on a separate check (in a group couldnt split the check I am pretty sure they could but ok probably just wanted auto gratuity cause I definitely would not have tipped)  Waiter said he told us that in advance and no he did not. So we ended up paying an additional $65 for drinks that were gifted to us and now we return the groupon to her? LOL because no def not coming back to get them another day. I am sure there was a much better way to handle it in the view of customer service. 3 times now and each time was a terrible experience, oh not to mention a goblet is $35 even with no alcohol that is ridiculous but side note and not fully part of the issue. I used to love this place when it was at Paris even Town Square was better than this. Also your menu online for fashion show doesn't really exist in restaurant (also part of 2nd visit). Terrible choice for my birthday dinner. thx

QEcb9rUO7azOst009h1giA.text: Absolute worst service I have ever had.. management was unapologetic about our service.. we waited 40 min for a server .. then an additional 30 for the rest of our party to even order a drink.. food was cold.. beyond disappointed will never come back

TuBstVVtI2LhdnKizQPP1A.text: I truly had an amazing time, Nikki, our waitress was very polite & kept up with our demands. I can honestly say we are pretty needy but she was definitely able to keep up with our high maintenance. I will be coming back for her service once again. Thank you so much!

Lblp23HIrHQ1irWaXDFgMA.text: Yum! Good food, great drinks, great service and a great ambience! Love this new location!

IiP6waqoJdnw1YGXfug6uA.text: I had my birthday dinner here and Sugar Factory by far surpassed my expectations. This new location is way better then when they were located near the Paris hotel.   The management staff was present and on top of things, the service was as incredible as the awesome milkshakes. I use to think that the Sugar Factory only had good desserts. Now, I know the food is just as good too!!   Thanks SF staff for making my birthday memorable!!

EOGGJc-nCxntrLuafa2I7w.text: First time trying this place ever.  The food and drinks were really good.  But the 5 stars doesn't stop there.  The customer service here was amazing.  From our great server DJ who was so personable and we could tell he loved his job.  To the manager and louis "the fixer" who turned an unfortunate spillage incident into a very great experience at this restaurant.  I was unfortunate to have hot sauce spilled on me and even in my hair, complete accident,  it happens.  The entire staff was so nice and apologetic.  They made sure we had everything we needed and more. Offered to cover any dry cleaning costs, made sure we got back to our hotel without issue, covered our meals. Many might think this was a no brainer to do but I've had really bad experiences in other restaurants and sometimes you barely get an apology.  You can tell they want their customers to be happy. Goblets large enough to share with 2. I ordered a grilled chicken sandwich that was delicious.   Food, drinks,  customer service,  and even the music, all 5 stars.  Would definitely go back.

QHy8TXNhsrU8oMn9g482mQ.text: We came back to try out Sugar Factory again. Totally different experience from our 1st. Our waiter was very attentive and great with our kids. The food  all came out on time and it looked like the pictures. Food is delicious. Will be coming back.

2se_FUbKO9-Ehr1yVhiXaw.text: This a review for their retail store in the restaurant. I came in here with my niece and we got one small gelato and two bags of candy they came out to $42. When we got home and finally tried the candy it was stale. I was already annoyed that it was $26 and then it was hard. I love the restaurant but I'll never purchase anything from their store.

7Lg9eD_KZ3uS516XPhqfFA.text: Brought my girls here all for the first time for a bachelorette dinner & we loved it so much. Very clean, fancy, everything is GREAT. Very pricey but what do you expect from a restaurant on the strip. Lol Love!

1ZMqM_A6VQiya4xAtbv0zg.text: Server was great food was cold waited over a hour for our food. Manager said it was only a 20 min wait which was incorrect as social media showed the exact time we ordered and recieved  our drinks. Manager tried to act like he cared which it was obvious he didnt. I would strongly recommend not going here!! Expensive cold food!

DIOq22Y0HI-kulVlTJ6c3A.text: Where should I start. The service. Probably the worst services experience of my life. We had to be beg for our waitresses attention which is crazy since we are a party of 10 ! Once we ordered several of our guests received there food late or about 45 min after everyone else. The food arrived cold! I even took the time to let the waitress know that the service was bad and all she did was agree with me ! So not call for a manager or nothing. We paid our bill and will never be returning. It's probably the reason that sugar factory has had 3 failed attempts in Nevada!

CBgGB2kkOKXPEdatr4dWYA.text: Wonderful! The staff was beyond friendly and the food was great! The presentation alone makes you want to try everything on the menu. Reasonably priced and in a central location.... I fell in love

zzvDRE2qOkG1yiGj9D8MPA.text: Me an my whole family came here tonight and it was the worst experience i have ever had in a restaurant. First off took around 15 minutes (after we were seated) for the host to find out who was serving our table then another 10 just for Jason to get to the table.   Yadioa one of the bussers walked passed our table several times without checking in on us clearing dirty dishes refilling our water glasses, Christopher on the other hand helped us a lot, there was one kid don't remember his name either that dropped off stuff at our table 4 times through out the night that wasn't ours but for a different table, when the food finally came out after sitting for an hour and half the food runner just started auctioning off all the food to the table and even had food for a different table with them they tried to give us. then our server Jason only came to the table to take drink orders food orders and desert orders and that's all never came to check how the food was or any of the drink witch was afoul we had the red velvet, raspberry sin, sour apple, and s'mores. Every drink was way to over powering of alcohol and no flavor to them, Or just straight out gross. The food wasn't that bad but if i wasn't that hungry tonight i would have sent it all back. After all that tonight this place is a good place to go to if you have a sweet tooth and want to be ignored or spend along time waiting for your food or any drinks.

PYoPJgPDCbiO1Qha_tnJUA.text: Omg where to begin!!!!! While visiting vegas this past weekend i decided to stop here and check this place out. It seems pretty popular and well known. The ambiance has an upbeat diner feel. I ordered some sliders to start and it took forever for them to come out i knew it had been sitting on the food line because it was almost as cold as ice when we received them!  Before putting in our order for the sliders we requested that the sliders would be light on the salt the server then says SHE DOESN'T MAKE THE FOOD i was in complete shock for hearing such a rude comment i was so frustrated. i have been working in the industry for years and would never say that snarky to a guest and obviously it is your job to tell the kitchen our requests that is essentially what a server does? Anyway, i ordered the country fried chicken and it was a nightmare the chicken was greasy and burnt! Probably from being on the food line for so long or the cooks must have really had a long night. I don't recommend this place at all unless you're drinking. This is more of a I'm too drunk to care what I'm putting in my body type of place or maybe if you have a sweet tooth otherwise 0.5 stars.

NIURpJXHrZf6IPxiCoXF2g.text: The goblets are fun and always good for anyone that hasn't tried one. I ordered a chicken Caesar salad and there was nothing special about it, definitely not worth $19 especially after waiting 30 minutes for it. We also ordered a dessert and someone had to remind our waiter about it because he came back after another half hour and asked what dessert we wanted and said it must have slipped his mind. I'm a very patient person and will usually put up with a lot but this service was so bad and I will definitely not come back.

BHgg1aNWurku_VFHdkY3Dg.text: Horrible! I would never come back. A horrible, small and overpriced steak au poivre. Theu fill out your plate with tons of fries to fool you with the miserable size of the steak. 3 times I had to ask for my aoda to be changed because it tasted horrible and then we couldn't eat dessert because they were sold out!! Unbelievable how the quality changed compared to when it was at Paris. It was a total rip off!

gBdtuKVhwqtqvGOMeIkw4A.text: I had a great experience with my fiance here! Our severs  Ariel and Asher were  super friendly the food was great and so was the service! I'll definitely be coming back! Thanks sugar factory!

or-bb_35Fr9idJpqSsVBBg.text: We went to music bingo in the lounge upstairs and had a fun time but the food was sooooo bad I can't get past it. We tried multiple items and even had to send stuff back only to get equally terrible food. Liked the goblet drink but will NEVER eat here ever again! So expensive and so crappy! Plus automatic 18% gratuity for bad food and slow service with an empty room. Eat anywhere but here and save yourself the headache and empty wallet....

U0nWVIcthzy_dsNZDl9WnA.text: Annemarie & the manager went above and beyond for us tonight! Great experience! Definitely will be back !

uJjmtlSKbwqXZ8v0BYyxdw.text: Where to start,   I made reservations (for 14) to celebrate my birthday here. Once we got there at our reservation time, they had no tables to sit us at. That's when the hostess asked if we wanted to sit upstairs in the chocolate lounge. Sure. Once upstairs and got settled in. We ordered our drinks. Then we ordered our food. Sitting for 30min we still have NOT received our drinks we ordered. Our drinks FINALLY came as well as only half of our tables food order. The rest of us sat for several more minutes until a couple more of our dishes came out. At this point we were waiting on 2 steak entrees for the last food to come out (steak bordelaise and steak bearnaise). It came totally wrong!!! My friend ordered hers med-well and my BF ordered his med-rare. Their steaks were mixed up on each others plates. And to top it off, they gave mushrooms (in a plastic container) instead of caramelized onions on what was supposed to be my BF Steak Bordaise. The server did not seem to care and blamed the kitchen staff on their mistake. We had to ASK for the carmelized onions!! Obviously, it's her job to make sure the food she's delivering is the right order. A friend ordered the alfredo and it came out like a kids meal size. Wth. We also did not receive an appetizer until after our dinner. The busser kept coming around trying to clear off plates that we were still working on, seeming like they were trying to hurry our meal and get us out. They also won't split checks for you.  I really wanted to come here to celebrate my birthday with friends and try their desserts but after the terrible service We just skipped dessert to get out of there.  So bummed this place could've been fun.   This place is 1)overpriced for the quality you're getting 2) terrible service, server will Just pass the blame to others and won't offer to Fix it nor apologize.

R7--pXdizz3A8U3dayuQtg.text: Went here for my birthday weekend! Awesome service, drinks, and food! Definitely a place to come to every time I visit Vegas. I usually would pass on the food and only come to get the goblets, but the chicken club was great and my moms meal was excellent!

unJiwMxOgUt5q5hzlCPnhg.text: First off, this place is just way over priced. It's def just for taking pictures and putting it on your social media. The decor is gorgeous and fun, reminds me of some of the bakery shops in Paris. The big bowl drink I got here is $38 without tax and tip, including with tax and tip I spent about $10. Total $48 for this drink. It was really good and def a fun experience buuuuut it's def my last because it is not worth $48 to me. You could go on Groupon to help with the price. I found a coupon for $24 and you get a $40 certificate which could help a lot. I haven't tried their food or shakes which I'll be coming back again because it looks delicious as well!  They open from 11am to 11pm.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_PI0GxAVnSuVptMHT30hHQ.text: If you're in the area, STOP BY! You'll love the ambience, the music, your waiter/waitress. The place is what you can say, "POPPIN'!   Let me tell you about the food... It does not fail! The portions are pretty big where I suggest you can share. I ordered a ham and egg breakfast sandwich that came with a ton of yummy fries. I only ate half because, the portions of fries were pretty fantastic! I did like the food but, not my drink.   Sadly, you come here because, of the pretty drinks. That's what they're known for and the candy. Well, I ordered the "Watermelon" and they had no watermelon gummy wedges for the rim of the cup and the mini ones in the inside. I know you're thinking, "Who Cares!" Yet, it's not so much that but, HOW they handled it! I was pretty bothered by it. The bar tender instantly had made the decision to make our drink and add these horrible "coconut wedges" gummies that tasted old. Then he threw in some old sour patch gummies. When the waiter came he said, they ran out of supplies and that the bartender gave us another set of gummies. Like, really? Just like that? Geee, thanks! That's not what we ordered. The situation could have been handled a bit different. Like, "Hi, I'm sorry we don't have the gummies for that drink. However, what other drink on the menu would you like? Or did you still want this with different gummies?" I mean the guest are paying $40 for the drink. I'm I wrong for thinking this? Also, at the restaurant YOU DO NOT KEEP THE CUP!!! There's no disclosure and the waiter does not tell you! At the Planet Hollywood Hotel-Mall Area you're allowed to keep the cup and you pay $30 for the drink. I honestly, don't think I'll be back. Even though the food was good-I was disappointed in the drink experience! I JUST WANT MY CUP!   Lastly, I noticed they keep on eye on everyone. Ensuring no one walks out with out paying. I guess this happens a lot here. The hostess could be a little more chipper and pleasant! The restaurant is soooo EXTRA and pretty! I would think they would find a personality that would match it! The waiter matched the ambience and I wondered why everyone else wasn't like him. Pssst, like our bartender who made are drink!  Don't forget to CHECK-IN to get your free appetizer! USE YELP. Let them know what you think so, they can do better! That's honestly good. So, if you come you're probably better of getting a shake here not the alcoholic drinks. There over priced, don't let you keep the cup, and don't make them correctly!

3V0Yb-U8jM-WpGwap71iuw.text: Dessert bar/restaurant located in front of the Fashion Show Mall on the Las Vegas Strip.  The restaurant has indoor and outdoor seating. The decor is like an old ice cream parlor meets modern luxury.  To start I had one of their famous smoking goblets. I had the watermelon mojito. The goblets are very large at 60 ounces and are shareable. My goblet was yummy and continued smoking for about 30 minutes, when I finally finished it.  The food menu is pretty large and includes brunch, lunch, and dinner. I had the grilled cheese and tomato soup. It was good.  Lastly we could not leave without trying dessert. We got the snickers milkshake which was obnoxiously large and came in a candy coated glass. Again, easily shareable. It was delicious and I slipped into a sugar coma the rest of the afternoon.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dad enjoying his milkshake
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Watermelon mojito smoking goblet
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoking goblet

URt0jduABGEdDBkcUQTogA.text: First time visiting sugar factory and everything was great! The dessert we ordered was delicious!! I was very pleased with how great the service. Our server along with a bunch of other servers were very attentive and so polite. We were checked on by a manager which was great, I loved how the managers were so present within the restaurant. I will definitely be back with my family on our next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JNqmL1D15pEoVQW79-z0OA.text: This place is like no experience comparable! Food was delicious my drink was $40 alone but worth every penny crazy variety of desserts and great customer service can't wait to go back!!!

Rhet9Y-sS2emwtVFV1AjgA.text: The good:  We got seated quickly. The burger slides were delicious! The drinks are fun and were tasty & strong.  That's where it ends....  It took us at least 25 minutes to get ONE drink. The waiter was not personal or friendly or even thought to apologize for the 25 minute drink wait. It took us a total of 1 hour to get in and out for one drink and an appetizer and it was not that crowded!   Verdict: Not worth the wait and cost. I would hate t see it on a crowded day! We only went for the novelty factor but I would save that money for something else honestly! The lackluster service ruined the experience for us.

yFG0-Ui7mcgrajGd5eMuNA.text: Service was slower than slow. We had a party of 8, but with a reservation our food took ridiculously long. The drinks are yummy and novelty fun, instagram worthy if you will. We didn't even get to dessert because of how long our food took. Food was nothing special. Save your time, skip the table and just hit the bar for a fun drink!

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

K-tAi7kaJM3ZBHlH5tCQxg.text: This was quite a trip! I've never seen so many shake options in my life! The place is really vibrant and colorful and it looks like a sugar factory indeed! We had walked from the opposite side of the Strip and ready for a filling snack. We ordered a banana crepe, fries and my daughter had a really fancy shake with whipped cream, hot fudge and marshmallows - can't remember the name. We finished everything and left very satisfied. Wish there was a branch closer to us!

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

djvqOZZjzk3rYSJQAoxPfQ.text: This was our first time visiting this restaurant. Our family came her recently on a weekend trip to Vegas. First, we couldn't find it easily, but finally found the top floor after walking through the mall. We made reservations and I think we planned to dine in the 1st floor, but since we were running late and couldn't find the first floor entrance from the mall, we were just glad to find it when we did on the 2nd floor.   Anyway, after reviewing the menu book (yes, it's a book), our group of 7 (adults/kids) finally decided on drinks and food: Sliders, chicken Alfredo pasta, and two burgers were ordered, as well as a watermelon goblet drink (reminded me of otter pops), a couple beers, a mint chocolate martini, and chocolate milkshake. It wasn't until after we ordered that I checked in on Yelp and realized we got a free avocado toast. I asked the waitress and she obliged, only to return to tell us they were out of it. I thought it was odd, but didn't want to make it a big deal. She said she would talk to the manager to see what she could do. Well, he was very accommodating and generously offered the appetizer sampler in place. We accepted, even though we had already ordered our food. Needless to say, we were impressed and the table ate the entire thing. Everyone enjoyed the meals and we all had a great time. We would definitely go back, except next time we will find the downstairs entrance!

oCeOQ8o4qrgB5qII1Ex_9A.text: Holy cow, what an amazing set of desserts! Had the s'more shake and the cookie sundae and was stuffed, satisfied, and high on sugar rush. The service was great and so glad we finally made it there! Was worth the crazy drive around town trying to get there, lol.

Y64IltrRHcQj2MmHRQeKoQ.text: Let me start by saying that you should only come here if you're prepared for complete decadence and fun. Everything you could ever want in a bright, welcoming, inclusive and extravagant eatery.  Can we talk for a minute about the irresistible cocktails? Candy, booze and magic combine to make a delectable concoction that you will feel transformed after consuming. Made to share though I suggest being selfish.  Our table had the rainbow sliders and except for the pickle, they were perfection. Cooked to the exact right temperature and an absolute joy to eat.  Unless you truly love yourself, don't get dessert. We had the chocolate cake but there isn't a wrong choice. I don't have words to accurately describe how rich and sinful this cake was. Eat. It. All.  Most importantly I want to talk about the staff. Top to bottom they were exactly what you want in any dining experience. We were attended to by Ashley L. and she could not have been better. Attentive, kind and very welcoming, Ashley was nothing short of perfect. I use that word a lot but it's accurate. Were I from this area I would return weekly if not daily and every time request Ashley.  Keep in mind that the entire staff is easy on the eyes. That's inappropriate but I'm only in Vegas once so Imma be honest. They're as delicious as the atmosphere and the food.  I hope to be back as soon as possible. I'll be talking about this experience for a long time to come.

pnMxI4czlylG1S3MDzDLrQ.text: After having a late lunch in the food court, we decided to wander out to Sugar Factory for ice cream . We were seated in the upstairs "chocolate lounge". Area did not appear busy, only 3 other tables were occupied.  Ordered: Caramel Brownie Bread Pudding $12 and Fried Ice Cream & Oreo Cookie $12 (with the plan to split between two people)...were later told that they were out of fried oreos. Ordered the Cookie Jar Sundae for Two $14 (again meant to split between two people)  Received: "An extra shake"...while waiting for our orders to arrive, a different server came to our table and dropped off a milkshake saying that it was extra from another table's order. We graciously thanked her and sampled what we believe was a cookies n cream shake. Caramel Brownie Bread pudding: Traditional bread pudding served cold with bits of fudge brownies..all swimming in a pool of melted vanilla ice cream. 2 spoons arrived with the bread pudding. No napkins were provided.  Service: Waiter checked in with us four times:  1. to drop off waters & menus  2. take initial order  3. informed us that one order could not be completed as they ran out of fried oreos  3.5--After waiting 30 minutes (after bread pudding was dropped off) flagged waiter down to ask about our missing sundae, she pointed at the "extra shake" and said that was what we had ordered. When we asked why it wasn't a sundae, she responded "it's the same thing...just blended", with further questioning she blamed the kitchen and said "they've been messing up orders lately" 4. to drop off the bill   The check: We were charged for the caramel brownie bread pudding $12 & a (not ordered) cookie jar milkshake $11 Based off this check, I believe the server entered in our order incorrectly (despite stressing that the ice cream sundae was going to be for two people)..but wasn't apologetic (instead passing the blame to the other staff).  Cleanliness: Table surface was not cleaned completely. A different waiter came by mid-way through our wait with a rag to wipe extra chocolate off the side of our table. Floor was sticky in some areas. Crumbs/sprinkles on seat.  OVERALL: As a local, I would PASS on this tourist spot. Poor service and dining experience = an "extra" order we were charged for, a missing order, and no napkins/utensils or drink refills

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caramel brownie bread pudding
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. An &#34;extra shake&#34;..cookie jar milkshake?
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The receipt (cookie jar milkshake price differs from the menu )

hpf5b20bL4MIk4E0Oh7KEA.text: Overall - Goblet drinks were overpriced drinks but you pay for the unique & super fun Ambiance setting.  All other food cost were pretty much the same as any other restaurants on the strip. Service was good - our server Jason D. was awesome.  Most  goblet drinks can be non-alcoholic drinks.  my kids enjoyed it. It was super fun. You have to try everything once.  This was our 1st time - no expectations.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Drake - non alcoholic.
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rainbow Sliders

rS1HtwJZ6t6hULodZWn8-A.text: We had a good time, but I can only give 3 stars for a couple reasons.  We live in the area and some family came into town and spotted a groupon for The Sugar Factory and wanted to try it out.  We did not have reservations, so I dropped by and put our name on the wait list for walk-ins.  They estimated about a 45 minute wait time, which we were willing to wait (we understood we did not have reservations and the wait was expected.)  However, about an hour later after waiting it out, I asked the hostesses if they had a new estimate for our wait.  We were informed that the manager had told them they could not seat any more walk-ins for the foreseeable future.  I asked if I could speak to him, as we had put our names in so long before and had been standing there biding my time with the 5 other people in my party who had, by now, joined me at the location.  After a moment, the hostesses found us a table in a dimly lit corner by the door (we were grateful for it too, he did not seem like he was going to seat us anywhere despite any length of time waited).  On our way past we heard him reprimand them for seating walk ins when it had become pretty clear that he made that cutoff/ distinction after our names were already on the list.  It just made the whole experience taste a bit bitter and it felt rather unorganized.  No one never actually brought us silverware (we were given two sets and our waitress did finally bring napkins so, fair trade?)  It seemed appropriately busy for a night on the strip, but she seemed a bit flustered the entire time so maybe it was worse than I realized? The food was pretty good, though a bit over priced for its quality (eh, it is on the strip so the inflated price tag was a bit expected) and I really wish that you could get personal sized cocktails that mimic the goblets because if you want some you have to go full fish bowl or nothin'.  Overall, we did have a good time and the girls up front were lovely and kind. I hope they did not have to take too much guff for having made sure we were seated. I would like to return to another location to give them another try. Probably specifically for desserts this time around.

5zPM1P89PMCAlAPxlv_bUA.text: Got here before they got busy and got the slowest service ever! Had to ask for my drink b/c they forgot, then got my food after people who came and ordered way after me. I only ordered 2 drinks and the sampler platter! Absolutely ridiculous. To top it off, only large groups that ordered lots of drinks got any sort of real service. Even with a Groupon deal I can't recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hubba Bubba martini

O5fhwata8YdLggUuILGHyA.text: I absolutely loved the Sugar Factory location that used to be over at Paris.  I thought the food and drinks were delicious there!  So I was pretty excited when I found out they were opening a new location at Fashion Show Mall.  I've been here a couple of times now since they opened.  Service was "meh" the first time and we were told they were out of dry ice so I couldn't get the goblet that I wanted.  What kind of business that specializes in these drinks runs out of dry ice?!  That was a huge disappointment, but toward the end of our meal, we found out that they had some dry ice in so I placed an order for a non-alcoholic Watermelon Patch goblet.  At the time it was half off with Yelp check-in, which was great since those drinks are pricey, but the deal is no longer offered.  I got to take a cool video of it as the drink was made and it started to smoke, but it could have been smokier in my opinion :p  Taste-wise it was nothing spectacular to be honest, but it was pretty refreshing and handy to take to-go with me since it was such a hot day.  As for the food, I had the Sugar Factory Club, which was totally average.  Even though food and service were not great on that visit, I wanted to come back to try their Caramel Sugar Daddy Cheesecake "insane Shake."   On that visit, service was better, but not their food.  I got their tomato bisque which was not very good.  It came with cheddar brioche toast which I liked but there wasn't enough of.  The shake WAS pretty insane!  I had to take off the rainbow lollipop and Sugar Daddy to drink it and was given bags to put them in and take home.  The cheesecake that came with it was pretty good.  The shake itself was plain but tasted better with the caramel, which I wish there could have been more of.  I'll give three stars because the goblets and drinks are fun and Instagram-worthy :p  But the food is just not good (and the pasta dish I loved is no longer on the menu) and the service hit or miss, so now that I've tried what I wanted to try, I don't think I'll be coming back here.

Qu61mLJv0JYpCYuSwVR6YA.text: The food was good and the creative drinks were better AND there was a promo going on where if you sat on the patio you get half off on food items... We decided to take the patio promo but as soon as we sat down no server came over to introduce themselves.   A bus boy gave us water and after 10 minutes or so the BARTENDER came over to get our orders. He didn't know much about the food because understandably he was the BARTENDER. However, he was kind enough to do his best and help us out. We were not the only ones feeling neglected the table beside us also didn't have a server. The killer part is a waitress came over in the area and served the tables around us all while ignoring our table and the neighboring table. She knew that some tables didn't have service and refuse to help out. The table next to us had to go hunt down someone to get the check. And we sat for a very long time to pay ours until THE WAITRESS WHO IGNORED US FINALLY ACKNOWLEDGED US and took our bill.  Customer service lacks tremendously- I guess that's the price you pay for a promo...

bdtFDOA4eddJpPhuN0DAQA.text: Service was a little slow but the food was great. More on the pricier side but there are some groupons at times. Definitely recommend getting a giant milkshake as mine was delicious. Still can't believe I finished it all myself.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3yIdPCTg6gxf6rbRfWfQcg.text: Kinda horrible. What kind of restaurant can't split checks..? Even two ways? It's 2019 guys, c'mon, we know you can do it, you're too lazy. We were here Saturday 3/2/19 with a large party for my friend that's getting married. I can't remember our servers name but she was either high, drunk, or just simply didn't care. Really terrible experience. There's so many places on the strip to visit, skip this one.

9nL0HHC9lDlZ8oBi3hxJKg.text: The food was very overpriced given the quality and I say that with this being the cheapest place I visited this trip to Vegas (I researched everything else on yelp beforehand).  I ordered the chicken and waffles.  The chicken was slightly below KFC level and the waffle was soggy and not as good as a random free breakfast waffle at a hotel.  My sister ordered a cocktail that has no price on it and the reason it didn't have a price was because it cost 45$!!  It had a strong watermelon flavor, with vodka, Red Bull, and gummy bears.  They put dry ice in it so it looked cool.  My chicken and waffles Cost 28$ and was garbage compared to IHOPs chicken and waffle which is about 10$.  This place is kind of a tourist trap IMO.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles.  Not good.
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pretty cool drink but massively overpriced at 45$.

WRGgdFjh36_4qd3tDR7KMA.text: I ate vegetarian in an American Brassiere and it wasn't a burger. My spinach-artichoke dip with grilled asparagus was close to amazing homemade. The dip was a little salty. I ate as much as possible with nachos and water. They gave me a 25% discount on the bill, which wasn't even expected. Also, I could have probably handled dessert, but there were no pies on the menu.   I had the best hostess and waiter. Nice place and good food with a wonderful ambiance that I recommend others to visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rubber ducky... Mwah
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach artichoke dip
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asparagus

jBDCDZui5in1clivC4nXwg.text: This food is unbelievably disappointing. We ordered two different salads that were uneatable. The sampler had the fried chicken you can find at your kids football games out of a trailer. Nothing was really that good.  The sundae was pretty good but even then the fresh fruit was not very fresh. And the milkshake we got was good but not worth the price. I could go to any shake shop and be just as happy.  Our non alcoholic (we don't drink) peach gobblet thingy was pretty good. Not worth almost $40 though.  They also told me they could sing me happy birthday with a candle that was $10 on some chocolate ice cream. WTH.   There are a MILLION other places to eat while you're in Vegas! Don't get fooled into going here.

p5yELv6Wbxuh3CMsxJhoZQ.text: I had an amazing experience at this place for which I celebrated my 27th birthday on 9/2. The food was really good and fresh! I got fries basket and the sampler. The service was nice even though the place was packed! My server was Heather! Such a kind helpful person! Then my friend came and we changed the table and the server was Rosie! Again very professional and know exactly what to do! I ordered half the King Kong celebration plate which was a lot but tasted soo good!!! They turned off the lights and sang the Happy Birthday song but they also let you pick a song that you like for the background music!! Such an amazing experience!!

CBFGEfVV3ZZ2cQqAE5oUeg.text: What can I say about the good old Sugar Factory.  Fast seating  Quickly we were assisted with water and then given some time for drinks. They have a lot of options of the Goblet which is the 60 oz cup or Martini or regular.  They also have really good food choices.  The waiter came back to check on us to see what we wanted, I got the white rum with gummies and it was so delicious. For the food portion I got the King Salmon with mash potatoes and asparagus and it was amazing! Very fulfilling! Very fast, everyone comes and check on you to make sure your good and I liked that.

4FzS6KuTCXaaKbd8TCOWFQ.text: I've been told to stop by this restaurant and just take in the experience of this place. I was not let down. I highly recommend people to come by and visit. Very fun and vibrate place with some great choices of food, drinks and especially candy.   Service: My service was good but not the greatest. I've received better in other restaurants, but I think my waiter was tired and ready to go. She greeted with a smile, but I think some missed opportunities with for better customer service. Staff dressed very professionally and smiled throughout my service. I think there were chances where I think the waiter could have provided suggestions or possible promotions at the time of service.   Food: High-Five to the chef. All items were delicious and wanted more but my stomach could not handle it because it was so much.  With that being said, they provided you with a great portion of food and the drinks are awesome.  Unfortunately, one of the drinks was not available at the time of service, it was still was good. My sliders and the milkshake were delicious with my dessert. Yes, you could have rolled me out of there after I was finished. It was that good.   Overall: I would really recommend that you visit. Great food, great drinks, and great dessert. I can't wait to go back or visit their other locations.

WDvNSNKsBpw2PVWehMekjA.text: Oh my gosh this place is to die for. Before I dove in you need to know this is expensive. Expect $100 for two people at least.   The drinks are an experience they have CO2 in them so they are so mystical and fun. I would recommend you drink it quickly because the bottom will freeze  if you don't get to it in time. There are delicious candies through the drink adding to the sugar overload.   The appetizers and food are just as good as the dessert factor here. The Mac and cheese bits specifically are amazing. They are gooey and warm and the sauce is a perfect pairing. We had the burger that also had the Mac and cheese and it was so yummy. I would say two adults can share an meal especially if you get dessert. Speaking of the desserts are out of this world cool and delicious. I would go back just for that next time. I love this place so much. Worth every penny.

4WfACkc_9djPVzxE5xwBBg.text: The perfect place to cool down after walking the strip.  The menu has a wide variety of items to choose from, both food and drinks. There is an outside bar as well as an inside bar but we opted for inside. Davion greeted us as soon as we sat down. He was awesome and was super helpful in choosing one of the many drinks they have available. We will definitely be looking for him on our next visit. we chose the "Energy Bear" for a drink - it was the perfect pick me up to get going again. We were also able to try the Mac and cheese lollipops with the yelp check in and it was just what we needed before dinner. Crisp crunchy outside, with a gooey cheesy inside. Glad we were able to try the out.
