Eb7RY4iluqAOwDfKoHjIsg.text: This place was very pricey. The food was average nothing special. My family and I came here for lunch. Ordered rainbow mini burgers for the kids, Shrimp Alfredo, and burgers. Nothing special with the taste. I've had better for less price.   Be prepared to wait for seating and for your food. This is vegas and they are always busy. I like the location right in the center of the strip. Love the candies and dessert though

SOVQP4a77J5myhcI4K4OBA.text: When you enter the doors you step in to a fun and whimsical candy wonderland. Their menu is the size of a textbook! I've come here every single time I've been to Vegas (too many to count) and I've always ordered the goblet drinks. Sweet cocktails served in a goblet full of ice and dry ice for $40 each. Drinks and a show! The drinks are sweet but strong and packed full of candy and booze!   I've ordered their appetizer platter quite a few times and the Mac and cheese balls are to die for!!   The service is always amazing, and if you're lucky, the server will give you a to-go baggie of candy! If you can't finish your drink, they'll also give you a to-go cup.   Keep an eye out on Groupon for $40 worth of food and beverage for $28 deal. This place can get pricy real quick!

BHfkL9XgpF18cjVpfW0IMQ.text: This review is for the food only, I would never ever pay $40 for one drink, that's my 3 cents, I value my coins, I don't care if there is a Groupon for a few bucks off!  Ive heard nice things about this place, so why not give it a try. The outside is nicely decorated, they do have a balcony, of course there is a friendly hostess luring you in. I visited on a Friday afternoon, so we got in instantly, no wait. There is a lot of competition in Vegas for food, Ive never waited at any restaurant so far in Vegas. Our hostess was really nice and on point at all times, she explained everything. They do have a Yelp coupon for a free appetizer, we picked the macaroni balls which were delish and filling!! We had the orange chicken salad and a burger/ fries, all the food was good. I was a bit surprised due to the popularity of this place!  I did take pics of the bartender making drinks, great experience, but I guess Im not the average when it comes to valuing my coins. I did visit the candy shop for a few treats upon leaving.  Try it and let me now what ya think!  Tip: Research the safety of Nitrogen drinks, decide if is this a good choice for U. Great photo Op, and it does look tasty.

yvW3l2R05BFSt4xd1BYdwA.text: This is definitely a "must do" while in Las Vegas!!!  We decided to go here based on reviews and recommendations...and I would agree with the others that this food is amazing. Also I have to say that the customer service was flawless upon us entering all the way through to checking out. We was greeted by a friendly staff member, that quickly seated us at the first available booth.  Than our waitress was on point....giving us assistance since this was our first dinning experience with them. The food is on the high end....but well worth it because the portion size are huge. The spouse and I could have easily shared a entrees. Overall, I would definitely revisit them again.   I would highly recommend this restaurant to friends and family members.

tFxlXjq2LrtsjB_aaTeaVQ.text: Came here on a Friday afternoon before we went out clubbing. Had to Uber here since it's on the outskirts of the strip. We were seated immediately and decided to sit outside since it was such a gorgeous day. The menu is very large and has a great selection and variation of drinks you can order.   We ordered the Goblet raspberry watermelon mojito and the Sugar Factory Club sandwich. My boyfriend and I shared both. The goblet was very huge and I'm glad we shared considering both the size and the price of each one. $40 for a goblet. They sometimes have a "buy one get one free" deal on goblets so keep your eye out!   The drink was super delicious!! And really refreshing as well. The mint and raspberry made the drink taste not overly sweet which I liked. It had watermelon candies on the rim as well. I really liked how the waitress first asked if we were ready for her to pour the drink, this allowed for us to take out our phones and record this moment without missing anything.   The Sugar Factory Club sandwich was okay. In my opinion it was nothing out of this world and tasted like an overpriced average sandwich. The meat tasted like overly processed turkey. I probably wouldn't order the sandwich next time.   When you come to the Sugar Factory, you definitely come for the experience! Paying $40 for a big drink was worth it in my opinion just to get the full experience. Plan to splurge at the Sugar Factory to get a sweet treat!

haCZgR7FgxjQtj0rwrT87Q.text: I finally went back here after a year and a half after my last terrible experience. A manager actually reached out to me to rectify the situation which I thought was very nice and surprising, so I decided to try again. This time we were seated faster and got drinks within 15 minutes( not terrible). Our waitress was very nice and attentive so that was a plus over last time. We ordered 2 drinks and 3 meals. The American Honey drink was delicious, however the raspberry sin was not as expected. We even questioned why it looked nothing like on the menu. (See pics) The turkey club and fries were delicious as well as the Manhattan eggs Benedict. However my Chinese chicken Salad was very lackluster and nothing like the picture. Overall, I still think this place is too expensive for what you get, but I am giving 3 stars ( mostly because I can't do 3.5) based off of the caring manager, good service and mostly good drinks/food.

FtbSrTUJjLQfurCrIkx1Rw.text: Been waiting to eat here since it opened. But I live in LA so I've been waiting for a while. (Lol) My husband and I did enjoy our time at Sugar's.   Our waiters were extremely helpful and had positive vibes. We told them we were celebrating our first year wedding anniversary. And they totally made is feel special.  The experience was dope, I loved the specialty drinks. They do get creative so whatever your into I'm sure they have something for you.   Sooooo, If I'm being honest the food was basic. I wasn't impressed. I ordered the Steak and Eggs and it was eh. My husband ordered the Waffles and Chicken. He also agree, his Chicken wasn't tasty or in his words seasoned to perfection. But honestly once you start drinking the food will be fine! (Lol) So go enjoy the experience and drink up!

FdMAKuwHF4yqpkIiaFd1Aw.text: We were visiting Vegas for my birthday and this place was a must see as I see celebrities posting about this place a lot. Although we didn't order food, we did get two goblets (one alcoholic, one not). Those things are HUGE and stronger than I thought it would be. They were actually pretty tasty and didn't have an over bearing sugary taste.  They also pour the drink right in front of you so you get to experience the smokey, mystical magic right in front of you. Our waitress and staff was very friendly, the place wasn't busy at all on a Tuesday afternoon and will definitely go back if I ever get the chance!

yPxXU74Q24d5Qhv6eQomlw.text: We came on Friday afternoon and absolutely loved our experience. My daughter wanted to try the King Kong sundae in celebration of her 9th birthday. The hostess was super accommodating and set up our table quickly and she appeared just as excited as I was to surprise my daughter.   There were only 6 of us, so we got the King Kong sundae, which has 16 scoops of ice cream, tons of toppings, a donut, candy necklaces, lollipops, and even came with lit sparklers!   The restaurant turns out its lights and sang a personalized happy birthday to my daughter. Our server, Maria, rocked the house. She treated my daughter so extra special! Thanks for everything!!

9bpVVMp7Sei2j2UkfSqoAA.text: The drink itself is very sweet and you can't even taste the alcohol. Me and my friends ordered a watermelon one. The dry ice does freeze the drink fairly quickly though so be ready to use the straw to stab into the bottom to suck out what is left of the booze. The place is very picturesque, so it's good for Instagram and bringing a group for fun. Be ready to spend around forty dollars for a cocktail.

PLyRP6FgEL49rFBLd4ThLw.text: Pretty poor experience. My friends kids were turning 12 and I suggested this place for dinner thought it would be fun.   Service: When we first got there our server had a terrible attitude and was not very helpful. He seemed annoyed we all ordered milk shakes right away. One of the kids spilled water and he was extremely slow to react or care. No empathy was shown so the kid felt terrible for accident. It's not hard to say "it's okay, it happens."  We were verbal about his attitude and lack of attention to him directly then our server changed. Second server was very pleasant and helpful.   Food: The food was rough. Mostly because mine was the worst and I'm writing the review.  I ordered chicken and waffles and the chicken was so over done it was hard as a rock. Not edible at all. The server did not come back until half way through the meal so I just ate the waffles. When she did come back she took the chicken and said she'd have it remade. The server agreed it looked terrible which almost made it worse because she served it.  The chicken took over 20 minutes everyone else was done eating so I told them to never mind I didn't want to sit here and eat when everyone else's was ready to go.   Final thoughts / TLDR: The place seems gimmicky. I would only recommend stopping in for the ambience and maybe a milkshake - skip the food it's Vegas plenty places to get good food and hospitality.

iSDPb5nD3gl8ftrSSiLeew.text: My family and I came to the sugar factory to celebrate my little sisters birthday and my first impression was that the menu looked pretty cool .  The girl at the front wasn't very friendly but that definitely didn't stop us .   My little sister ordered the rainbow sliders and they were so cute . They tasted Fine . I ordered the Steak sandwich with fries that was good . My step dad ordered a burger with a side of chimicurri sauce and it honestly looked like oil with crushed red pepper . It wasn't great. My brother ordered shrimp Alfredo and it was good but honesty tasted like boxed fettuccine Alfredo . The fondue we got for dessert was the best part . It was good and enough for all of us to share .   I was a little disappointed at the service and we also let the waiter know that it was my sister's birthday and I think he forgot . They didn't do anything for her . Overall , my experience was just OK . The food is over priced for what it is , the service wasn't great and the food was just alright . Unfortunately I feel that there are far better places to eat at on the Las Vegas strip .

TsowbISnIvc6beV3o7fTkQ.text: The donut burger was pretty good. The cotton candy martini was really good. Still overpriced of course.  But it was a fun food experience for a restaurant on the strip.

Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cotton candy martini

cGUBdgBm1x0pZfWFgkE9uw.text: I hosted a small get together the other night for the local chapter of a collective I'm part of and we had the best time! I had reached out to the restaurant in advance to make sure everyone could pay with separate checks and make sure they could accommodate us as we needed and they were so helpful. When I got to the restaurant, they took me to a corner booth and helped me set up all of our materials. Our host answered any and all questions and stayed to make sure our small group had all arrived and we were settled (Thanks again, Madison!). Our server, Jason, took amazing care of us as did the rest of the staff who kept our water glasses full and made sure we had everything we could possibly need.   We had the Rainbow Sliders which were so yummy (and super photogenic) and three of the craziest milkshakes I've ever seen in my life (Twinkie Dinkie, Tie Dye, Caramel Sugar Daddy Cheesecake). I literally had a slice of cheesecake sitting on top of my milkshake! My club sandwich was so big it's literally served as three meals ($16 might sound pricey but given it's been three lunches, it's a good deal). When it was time for our bills, they were brought out separately as discussed in advance with absolutely no fuss. That never happens anywhere! One of the managers even gave us a tour of the chocolate lounge upstairs and offered to take photos for us in front of all the cool displays.  I was a HUGE fan of the original Sugar Factory when it first opened inside Paris Hotel and Casino. I rarely go to one place multiple times but Sugar Factory was my favorite place to frequent (and that says a lot). When the menu changed I wasn't happy and I didn't love the incarnation at Town Square. I wasn't sure what to expect of this new location but when I walked in I was thrilled. It has the same look and feel of the original and the menu even has the original items (many of which were removed when the menu was remodeled). If you eat here, make sure to go upstairs to see all of the displays outside the chocolate lounge! It's an Instagram dream come True (especially the miniature carousel). Yes, the restaurant is ornate and over the top but it's Las Vegas, get over it.   Thank you Madison, Jason, Mery and all the wonderful staff at Sugar Factory for making our gathering so amazing! I can't wait to come back!!!

tn2VfoSV0xVEWjc2KR0kJA.text: This was seriously the absolute WORST service I have EVER experience. I was with a group of 5 girls. 3 were seated and given Complimentary drinks for Ladies Night & told the waitress (Terri D.) that they were waiting for 2 more ladies to order. The last two arrived and we had to wait 30 minutes before we were even acknowledged again! We tried to wave her down, she put a finger up signaling she'd be there in a second. We literally went up to another waitress and just asked her to please take out order, she said you guys aren't in my section so I'll just tell her... WELL SHE DIDNT. We waved down what looked to be a manager and told him how we had not be attended in over 45 minutes, she finally came around apologizing that she was busy & had too many tables. It literally felt like she was just plain ignoring us because in the time we spent waiting to get our food and drinks; 3 appetizers & 2 goblets (2 1/2 hours +) we saw the two tables next to us get several rounds of drinks and one of them managed to finish a goblet, have dinner, order dessert, & was even sung happy birthday to. So obviously she was just "TOO BUSY" to stop by our table for some reason. Oh by the way we were half way into our goblets before we had to stop the manager again to ask him to get us the complimentary drinks for the two other ladies who arrived a little late. And the only reason we bothered him again is because we waited over 20 minutes after asking Terri again to bring them...   I don't buy her too busy excuse because I saw plenty of other tables being attended and serviced... it felt personal, we felt ignored and for no reason. We were trying to be polite but we are never doing ladies night here ever again.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FvfGnR9qQvYueRpp7Y1ihw.text: Great service, but food wasn't great, unless you buy a dessert they don't acknowledge your birthday or do anything for it...was slightly disappointed especially since it was the sole purpose of our visit for my daughters 16th birthday...prices are a little extreme...drinks were weak for the amount of money paid...sorry just didn't agree with a lot of the reviews...  Soooo the manager reached out to me and fixed all issues that was wrong the first time...although we can't redo a Birthday the second time around was great...food was better and our waitress helped out with our selections so that our food was better...service was still great and they came out to do her birthday. I was grateful. Thank you!

PWfHQBXEhDbaQs9NQAc2zA.text: Celebrated my co-worker 31st Bday! You guys should order the Rainbow appetizer for it was really, really good! However, my Mediterranean Pasta was kinda bland and they don't have any soy sauce at all according to our waiter. We ordered the goblet drinks (Lollipop passion) which I wasn't a fall at all. I prefer the goblet with fruit passion in it. The dessert ice cream with  Sparkler was really awesome, that made my co-worker so happy and kudos to the waiters and hosts but even though everything went great I still think about my pasta all the time on how I was not satisfied lol! I would come back again for desserts not the pasta anymore lol!

mV1dDpRcPUMfDvXw9WQZcg.text: My first time eating at this restaurant. Location was as expected busy, it was clean, updated and modern. We made a reservation so wait time was not an issue. The noise level of the restaurant was quite distracting and made it difficult to converse with people in our party. The wait staff was amazing, friendly and prompt. My daughter's ordered the specialty drinks  and  we all ordered gourmet burgers.  The drinks were fair and the burgers were sooo good.  The burgers were truly delicious.  This restaurant definitely warrants a return visit.

tuYUNGEsRB54ynyDudWMsw.text: This is my second time visiting the sugar factory, and the last time i went it was near the paris hotel, and this location is at the Fashion Show mall. It's very nice and clean and very romantic like. Only thing i have to say about the sugar factory is they food. I asked for the hamburger with mac and cheese on top with no bun. They brought it but with a little and mac and cheese so i asked the waitress to look at my hamburger and she said "ill bring you some more mac and cheese for your hamburger" she did. My sister order a Classic cheese burger, and she asked for well done and she didn't get that, so she had to send the burger back and got a new one. These are the only reasons that i'm not impressed with this location, but they drinks are very good i might say!!!!They don't skip on the alcohol when it comes to the Goblet drinks with the candy in them.

rAUOtKbXY4uM0c9p7lf9tA.text: If you want to waste a couple hundred dollars and yell over the music to the person next to you while sipping on a novelty milkshake that has a cheeseburger on the straw, this is the place to go. Otherwise, I would recommend literally anywhere else.  My family and I went here for my mom's birthday lunch a couple days ago and it was awful. We were there at noon on a weekday so it wasn't even busy, but we struggled to get our server's attention the whole time, and none of the other waitstaff walking by would stop to clear plates. We finally had to ask someone and he actually ignored us. It was so weird and not Vegas-like service at all. They also didn't do anything for the "birthday" part of the lunch (like saying a simple 'happy birthday') and we didn't bother bringing it up a third time to our waiter. There were five of us and we didn't have alcohol or dessert but it was still over $200 which felt so wasteful. We were all really disappointed by such an icky experience eating out.   More on the food: The blue cheese bacon burger and onion rings  were good.  The fish tacos were really gross.  Chicken fingers, club sando, grilled chicken sando were all fine.

91eHACSEQlXYh8eC4-VbYQ.text: The service in this place is terrible.    We weren't expecting much, but drinks and napkins would've been nice.    Our waiter was incompetent and unable to keep up with simple things.   After the man passing out our food knocked water all over the table, he continued to hand out meals while water was dripping all over the kids.   He didn't really understand that he needed to clean up the mess before handing out the rest of the food.   After the water debacle, we never receivers our drinks back or our napkins even though we REPEATEDLY asked for them....six of us shared the lone Diet Pepsi left on the table.   My friend never received her food.    The manager was completely useless....they didn't understand that we didn't want our meal comped....we wanted our meal.  This is a terrible tourist stop where they don't care about customer service at all.   Avoid.

w5pI-qjHjrHTvmphkJ95RQ.text: Loved this place! Also because I love candy and sugar! There was a huge list of alcoholic drinks to choose from that had actually gummies in it! Plus the dry ice gave it that smoky look, which was so much fun to watch. The downside is the big drinks cost $40 and you don't actually get much to drink it is definitely more for the experience. I was able to finally get a donut burger for lunch too! It was a pretty picture that much was for sure. The burger itself was good, but boy was it messy, the glaze stuck to my fingers the entire time, and the "bun" fell apart almost instantly, at least the flavors were great. The service was pretty fast and friendly and the decor of the restaurant was really fun! They had a slideshow playing on loop with celebrities and different concoctions of drinks. This is a must from now on every time I come to Vegas again.

I will not be returning to this establishment.

ne6C5NvmWNzpi_S8OTY_OQ.text: Place is nice, people are nice but the food sucks balls .. no flavor whatsoever. Ordered the spinach dip and it taste so bad, the chicken fingers my sons ordered were hard to bite and stringy (double yuck) I would go just for the experience of those alcohol drinks. My husband ordered a bubbling drink and it taste like big o fountain soda but that was it. I wouldn't go back for the food that's for sure.  Oh their super fast to bring out the food like VERY fast.  We were shocked maybe that's why the food tasted so bad .. stale French fries found at Sugar factory

MNXxkXfYPvgM2Xp2jVSG3Q.text: This place was pretty dope. As a tourist it's a really warm feeling when your server seems like they enjoy their job. Our server Alex was very enthusiastic and friendly. He was very detailed in explaining things to us and had a good energy about him. I will definitely be back when we come to Vegas. I highly recommend this place.drunks are amazing.

OY44PUegs3LTrkD7sWVumA.text: Usually go here for just "drinks"... but decided to go on my birthday.. we found not one but hair twice this day. One was in one of the lollipops in one of the drinks we ordered. The other was in the little "birthday" rice crispy treat they give you for $10 (not worth it lol) and when it was time to pay, we weren't charged for the rice crispy or the drink with the hair but instead they charged us for something extra that we didn't even order, but we didn't notice until after paying for the whole bill.

f0SH1WyWzbkZpAPDlRwcMA.text: I came here to celebrate my 11 year old son's birthday last night and it was ok. I purchased a Groupon for $55 which had an $80 value. The coupon said it was for 4 or more people. Great!   We get to the location and after being seated it was cool. We were greeted promptly and our servers were super friendly. The place itself was very cute. There were 4 of us and we ordered: 2 milk shakes, 1 Goblet drink and 1 martini with grey goose vodka instead of the standard vodka, an order of French fries and an order of spinach dip. The bill came and it was $117! I wouldn't even mind the price because the goblet drink was cute and really good and I liked the atmosphere BUT, one of the shakes was not good so one of the kids didn't drink it. The martini wasn't sweet and it was a Lemon drop, and the food was soooo bland.   The staff was very sweet though. I think our waiters name was Mellz (sorry if I butchered that) and he made my son's night with his dancing and just being relatable.   If you're hungry, eat first then come here for your drinks and sweets.

YL-siBJdOB7kwbjn6Gl_NQ.text: First I would like to say that the food was good. My husband and I ordered the rainbow sliders, onion rings and fries. The fries were lightly seasoned, however they were string thin, but also tasty. The sliders were flavorful and filling, as were the onion rings. My friend ordered the macaroni and cheese balls, they give you 3 and she only ate 1, they were not good.  Second, the drinks. The drinks were very yummy with just enough sweet and alcohol combined. I ordered the chocolate strawberry cocktail and my friend ordered the root beer float.  Last I would like to give the reason of only 2 stars. The service. The service was terrible. We sat for nearly 30 min before someone came to take our order. To top it off, our waitress was so eager to get another tables order that she said she'd be back to finish our order after she took the other tables order and then never came back. About 20min later she shows up with a milkshake saying we ordered it, um no, you never came back to finish taking our order. Wrong table.  The entire time we were there not once did she come check to make sure everything was ok or to see if we needed drink refills.  I had to flag her down to get our check, by this time the table was cleared by another person. So will I ever go back, probably not to this location.

0AqBArCeYWCtoij4rN2HXw.text: They've moved locations, now in the mall across from the Wynn. The result is that the atmosphere has dropped a few levels. You can feel it in the service and cleanliness. It's like they don't really care what experience you're having. Ask to lower the music volume from 11 to a 9, forget it the server says. I can't even ask. Burgers are still good but all in all this is a pass for future visits to Vegas.

0DNSpRbtRI-TqDDevOw1OQ.text: I loved this place!!  Drinks were so creative and the food was great.   I really enjoyed the fun atmosphere and even though it was winter when I went there, the outside is a must.  People were sitting outside even in the cold.  I can't wait to go back in the spring!!!

gHrxdL_rRcTInddnpEIUZA.text: This place is beautiful inside, however the lighting, the staff, the music all Suck! Our waiter was like a used car salesman trying to get us to buy things we didn't want.  Huge letdown

NeTHcuRozCMkHlfrtPiLXA.text: I was excited to visit this place because I've heard lots of great things . Well after visiting I'll just say don't believe the hype lol The Goblets are simply just for the looks smh for 40$ you get a big cup of ice & juice with maybe a 10 min buzz, unbelievable. I even told a guy that looked like he may of been a manager that the drinks were nothing but juice. The food was "ok" nothing special and the portions weren't all that large compared to the places I've been in Vegas. For $150 I could of went to an awesome steak house. Disappointed and won't be returning.  Update: After further consideration me and my husband decided to give the sugar factory another go. I must say this time around it was truly a wonderful experience. Our waiter "Anne Marie" was more than fantastic and the managers were very kind and apologetic for the inconvenience during our first visit. Our food , drinks and service was beyond exceptional. The music was even great . As a local I would definitely recommend them for fun night out.

_KBrhSNrhYN-8iseFyJZSQ.text: UPDATE:  After the manager reached out to me on yelp to try again we totally took her up on that offer. Jeneivieve was super apologetic and very prompt in making our reservations after I gave her a date that me and my guest would be available. So one week later me and my best friend went back up to Sugar Factory. And by the end of the night I was FLOORED with how amazing our service was!!  From the moment we got seated we were taken care of. This was the experience that I was looking for last time. We got greeted by the manager  (and he apologized which we graciously accepted) , and then from that moment our waitor Jason gets 5 stars! He was awesome, funny, attentive, and a pleasure all night. There was nothing we asked of him that he did not give us with a smile on his face. We started out the evening with two goblets (he recommended the lollipop one) and on top of presentation the drink was delicious. I will definitely come back for that goblet alone. My friend orderd the Drake and boy oh boy was it strong. You can taste the Virginia Black in it, thankfully the cotton candy added a nice sweetness to balance out all of the alcohol.   He gave us some time to enjoy our drinks and just chaqt before he came over and took our order. (which we appreciated). I ordered the country fried chicken with a side of Herb Varicots (fancy a** green beans) and my friend ordered the steak and frites (which he suggested). Both plates came out piping hot. The chicken was cooked perfectly with a crispy texture and a hint of sweetness in the skin. Her steak was cooked thoroughly and by the end of the night BOTH of our plates were empty. Upon the suggestion of the manner we both decided to order deserts. I ordered the red velvet cake. Now to be honest I didn't read it all the way through because I hate raspberry and this cake was loaded with raspberry cream, mousse, layers, syrups.....so that was a miss for me. I got a chance to taste my friends fried ice cream, and to be honest it was just OK. We were so full that the only thing we could really enjoy were the lollipops that were in my drink. (which were amazing).   Let me tell you. This entire night was the exact service we were expecting the first time we came. And although they didn't get it right then, they got it right the second time. They have ultimately changed my heart and I can't wait until my friends can come in town so I can bring them here. Thank you to Jenivieve, Manuel, and Jason for the great night.  Literally the worst experience. From the moment we walked it was just a complete lack of attention, lack of hospitality, lack of well....EVERYTHING.   I made reservations for this place a week and a half prior for 8:30 pm. We were a little early but we definitely wanted to get there early to look around and take some pictures. I heard the upstairs lounge was super cute and we were more than excited to check it out. Once I showed up to the hostess stand there was NO ONE there. After a few minutes of staring idly at the drink bar outside, a manager came out to speak to the bartender (who was watching us stare at him...) and then saw us waiting. He immediately sat us at the empty table outside without asking name questions reservations etc. We thanked him and for 15 minutes we were not acknowledged, offered a glass of water, or even thought about UNTIL we saw another "manager" who came out to speak to the table behind us. I got his attention told him our issue, he apologized and said he will be right back to take our order. Then a woman came out who he introduced as the Event Coordinator took our food and drink order (PRAISE THE LORD CAUSE WHO KNEW WHEN WE'D SEE ANYBODY AGAIN).  By the time we got our food an hour has passed, and we never saw the event coordinator or either manager EVER again.   Let's talk about the food. It was SOOO BASIC. I order the jalapeno burger. Jalapenos, roasted tomatoes, Sugar Factory's special sauce and American cheese. Sounds good huh? NAH. They literally through a luke warm patty on a bun popped some uncooked or seasoned jalapenos on it with a slice of cheese, no sauce, no roasted tomato, and some sloppy lettuce. I was so turned off by the service, the food, and the entire night that I sucked it up and just ate it. I was so ready to go. Literally the entire experience ruined my night. At the end of the night I paid 19.00 for a burger that I could have went to Burger King for (at least it would have been hot). I could understand paying for the experience but there was no experience. They had one poor girl working the patio, there were more than enough empty table inside, the ran out of the ingredients for the one goblet we wanted, one glass of water the ENTIRE time. I didn't even bother going upstairs for pictures or to see the rest of the establishment, it was so horrible. I will never go back. EVER.

AhtCZ0QlBzk3Kr-aS0aKPw.text: This place is definitely a place to go while in Vegas! With the goblets and the mac and cheese balls, you cannot go wrong. Might I suggest getting the White Gummi goblet. Simply delicious! Seriously, this place is awesome!

P3lh7-dipyVYcVf6XHiuhw.text: Cocktails were excellent, and dinner was delicious. But DANNY made our evening exceptional.

PUeuE9LKkM_TRBWKZKp8cg.text: this is a awesome to get old time candy that u cant find in the store and i wish they can put in colorado n the food sound good but i did not get ot eat there

wCOjHHY0scSJRxUrVT7bCQ.text: Very very disappointing...... over priced for what we experienced. food tasted old , gummy candy was hard as hell. Only plus was our waitress. Wanted to have a lovely Father's Day dinner with friends and family. Never again......

nBzImqcZelRuggvmKAEiDQ.text: Horrible customer service, we waited long to order our food, food didn't take long to arrive, but there was no assigned waiter and we weren't ever checked up on, I ended up ordering dessert and it never arrived so we had to get up to ask for our checks and it took long in general.  I had been wanting to try this place out for years and my first time was a horrible experience.

d_UIjIEri9VUUWdPPEaZJw.text: Want an over the top family dining experience in Las Vegas?  Then look no further than Sugar. This place is unlike any other. The menu is thick with interesting choices. Very good selection of appies, salads, burgers, anytime breakfast, pizzas, sandwiches and their over the top selection of fishbowl drinks, specialty drinks and specialty milkshakes.   We had a wonderful server Richard who was attentive and accommodating. We ordered 2 fishbowl drinks. One with alcohol ($38) and one without ($30) for our boys (ages 12 & 14). They are fun with the dry ice inside. Sweet as you'd expect in a place called sugar and for extra sweetness they add candy to the drinks.  We ordered an appetizer platter and the Sloppy Joe burger. Not everyone was hungry so we didn't order multiple meals. Appetizer platter had wings (good), onion rings (very good), chicken fingers (ok, not special) and amazing deep fried mac n cheese balls. Amazing!  And I'm not a huge mac n cheese fan. The sloppy joe burger was very tasty as were the thin fries that came with it.   We left stuffed and with our drinks Vegas style in to-go cups. Would go back next Vegas trip. Used a Groupon which helped lower the total cost.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tACWeLGVmWLYE51nxdVB2g.text: This the best place I have been and is one of my top 5 right now!!!!!! 1st place on my list

tSUPQWhyxfujv0qnGFXjvQ.text: We came on a Saturday night two weeks ago. It was already pretty busy at 6 PM but we were sat immediately. The young girl at the front was friendly and asked if we had a reservation(which we did). She quickly walked us right inside. There are four adults and two children and we were sat in a huge round booth and our server Jade was there as we settled in. He took drink orders and gave us a few minutes to look at the menu well he got us water. I had Salmon, my daughters had soup and cotton candy which was a gift from a woman manager/owner,maybe who made us several trips by checking on us and others around us. my husband had a monster burger which was incredible two and the other two friends with us had a garbage salad which was huge and the fettuccine. Jade sold me on a Virgin goblet for the girls and it was quite a show. The whole restaurant was rockin and from the time we arrived to the time we left it got busier and busier but the managers kept circling around making small talk and cotton candy was everywhere making everyone smile I food came fast but our third round of drinks took a little longer than the first two. My daughter's birthday is in February so I asked the manager about parties and She immediately took us upstairs for a tour. Still thinking about it,but it seems like a great spot. We live local and go down to the mall every so often and next time I won't Sugar Factory is there!

v46P5wdG7cmS_anZxWmtBA.text: We came with a large group of ladies for dinner. Service was awful. Took about a half hour to get a drink.

ppkhggBmk5wlwBKnoAYS4A.text: My First time to sugar factory was a great experience I was served by bartender Jeremias! He Was very friendly, attentive, and made amazing drinks would definitely recommend him and for sure come again!

SynayJZFP1GMkKG6bfJFJA.text: Had to try it when I was in Vegas and the huge drinks didn't disappoint. Love the photos and customer service as well.

8--VnTRy6qSbuoLVhFcMtA.text: Would not accept our Groupon at either location with each one saying the other one SHOULD. Ordered two goblet drinks which were fine. Food was underwhelming. Worst part was sitting wasting time waiting for our check about 20 min after we had obviously been done long before.

PrwMUVBr2wwhtanwSRArqA.text: Ms. Chelsea A. was a sugar indeed! She accomodated our party of 10 and surely made a great impression on us. Her service was outstanding. Unfortunately one of our sugar goblets didn't have the dry ice because they ran out. But good ol' Chealsea made up for it and her service was just so pleasing, I didn't even care if my goblet didn't have the smoke hovering out of it. It still tasted great and so did the food! I got the Rainbow Sliders, juicy, colorful, basically a real life pretty patty (yeah, I just made a spongebob reference lol.) Our group came in to celebrate two of their birthdays so we also got the BIG bowl of ice cream and candy delivered so happily by all the sugar factory servers. That dessert was also pretty bomb. Enough to feed us all!   Don't forget to check-in on Yelp for the 50% off the sugar goblet (theres also non alcoholic ones!) Also, one of my friends used a groupon here as well so you can check that out too.  I'm so glad they opened a new restaurant here, I was pretty sad when the one at the Paris closed down. But forsure this wont be my last visit!

CdXkQmh5BzIVPwi-w3Uffg.text: Would rate the service if we had gotten any... Walked in with 3 of my friends and were seated immediately, but were quickly forgotten. Server never came around, NOT even to give us the complimentary water that is usually served as you wait for your order. Waited around 15 mins before we decided to get up and leave. Table in front of us was already complaining to the manager about her server never coming back after taking the order. The table behind us was getting their order taken even though they walked in more than 5 mins after us.  Never going back.

UErKS46UU79AQwAgr8o4Tg.text: A follow up letter to poor sweet Travis....  Dear Travis, I decided to take our therapists advice  to come back and enjoy a Buy One Get One goblet with two different girls on another trip. I was so excited and nervous to see you again but then I was let down that you stood me up on Monday. I really was hoping we could work this out Travis. But I guess it's not me, it's you. Thankfully, Erick was my white knight and swept me off my feet. He was fun and flirty and knew exactly what to recommend. I left with a big hug, a drink to go and delicious dinner and dessert from the retail store. So I forgive you Travis. Erick has shown me a whole new experience that will leave me feeling taken care of, loved and happily full.  Sincerely,  The girl who is breaking up with you from feeding her way to much food in May. Xoxo

6t1ps5kzVmmrfybEt3bLuQ.text: Would not separate the check took us 30 minutes to pay the check. The guy kept walking away.. So disrespectful. I paid 39$ for one drink

y2glOaJNqC6Rv-yR58SiXg.text: Came here for daughters birthday fun clean restaurant as always love the experience. The waiter Manny he's great with kids and patience he's excellent customer service with full attention to our needs. And food does come fast thank you manny for the experience .

2FPgG0uq8-uCnA0YsKxFbw.text: The staff were all very friendly and attentive. Top notch customer service. The goblet was good but pretty overpriced at $39 and really lacking in the alcohol department for the money.   I had high hopes for this place at first, but then our food came out. I ordered a chicken sandwich and after my first bite knew something was wrong. After the bite I inspected my food and the chicken was very very undercooked. They were super apologetic, brought me new food and didn't charge me for my dinner. They also brought us a free dessert, which was appreciated. Again, the service was great. Later that night I got extremely stomach sick though and I know it was from the bite of raw chicken. Can't go back because of that...

I ordered a shake for my daughter and was told that the Ice cream machine is broken..  (Note: I came in about a hourish before the place opened) If I didn't order my meal I would've left the place bc that's the only reason why I was here.

ceWF3kyNYCGvHmubHkUrTg.text: What an Amazing Experience!! We (party of 6) came here to celebrate the 12th Birthday of my friends daughter, Ashley. She was so amazed by the dry ice effect in her non-alcoholic goblet. Then even MORE AMAZED (as were the adults) by the "show" that was put on by the staff when delivering the Signature 24 scoop King Kong ice cream sundae!!!   All lights go dim and the restaurant goes quite. Suddenly, fun dance/club music starts playing. Our waiter starts walking with a HUGE sundae (with sparklers) in hand and behind him a line of other staff members. Once they arrived to our table they begin to sing Happy Birthday. IT WAS AMAZING!  The smile on Ashley's face was Priceless!   A huge THANK YOU SHOUT OUT to Marc (our server) and Amanda (Manager on duty)!!! Your service was so much appreciated!

hBRvpPTodeiZl_YqBUlY6A.text: Staff was ok and food was decent. It seemed that everyone was no enthusiastic about anything. Anyways my son got the super large yellow duck and it was just amusing. Candy selection was something I could get at grocery store.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My wife enjoying a warm cup of coffee on a cold Vegas morning.

IA4ETRqcfoDfGTYKMdIUpQ.text: I was so excited to come here and check this out. So finally we were able to come and dine here with a friend. First I thought I can use the Groupon but then they say I can't use it bec I have to have 4 people to be able to use it. So I wasn't able to use it and that's a bummer .   Then I checked out the store . Ok so what is the difference between this store compared to the other candy stores ? Actually it's only the name and the plastic goblet that says sugar factory and that's it . All of the candies here u may find it in any candy store . They don't have any signature candy or chocolate like See's candies or ghirardelli So anyways I still got myself some chocolate covered gummy and nuts .        On to our dining experience , the decor of the restaurant is ok nothing really fancy. Since it's a sugar factory I would expect more sugar decor lol . But it's just an ordinary restaurant type of decor . We got the orders right away and my kid ordered the berry bliss and it was really great to experience it . Me and  my friend ordered fettuccine . So the food came , my kid was delighted to see the smokey berry bliss . My guess is that they put dry ice on the bottom , add some berries and then when it's time to serve , the server pour the cocktail (without the alcohol) to the big goblet and then it starts to smoke . Pretty neat. Then the lunch was served , my son ordered the chicken with waffle . It's a big serving but the taste is not that great the chicken is salty. The waffles didn't come with any fruit or whip cream . And IHOP waffles tasted better than this one . Onto our fettuccine oh my gosh it is way salty to my taste oh my goodness what's wrong with me everything I taste always taste salty . But how come the other pasta restaurant doesn't taste salty at all ?         So at least I got a great talk with my long time friend who's based from Vegas . Then I got the bill . The berry bliss in the goblet was $30 so I thought maybe the goblet is free that we can bring it home . But no . The price is  $30 it's only great to experience it . So that's another bummer and so I have to buy it from the store if I want and it cost $20 . Well that's it I cannot say I fully recommend it . If u want to experience it why not go ahead but be aware ur paying way too much . I wouldn't recommend to eat the salty foods that you may order anywhere else but I would recommend the goblet if you want to experience it .

A_aupSf9XvHuuY66XnAbOw.text: Great birthday experience!!!! Love the firework candle for my son's birthday experience! Chaz, our waiter, was super helpful with suggestions on what to order that would make my sons birthday celebration the best experience possible. Music and food was amazing!!!

HWnTjR7331_xzN4VIBUxaA.text: Expected the worst, but had to "experience" the drinks the wifey had checked out online.  Arrived on a Tuesday around 11am. Place reminded me of an old soda fountain bar but with adult beverages disguised as childhood dream thirst quenchers, and a candy emporium as we came in.  Wife chose a Strawberry Mojito to share. Waiter was attentive and gave her the heads up to grab a video of the pour of our watermelon mojito into the icy red glass.  Once the liquid he poured hit the dry ice, the vaporous concoction started to bubble and boil.  Pretty tasty as well with a good mix of rum, fruit, mint and enough little fruit gummys to put a four year old into a sugar coma.  Food arrived and wifeys fish tacos were crispy and delicious.  My steak was petite, but well marbled, very well seasoned, and cooked perfectly with my over easy eggs and crispy home style potatoes.  Toast was meh, but satisfactory to mop up the eggs.  Price was the usual stack of cash for two.  Enjoyed it all and would recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

O_xKY21zwYeuNXznH8xfkA.text: How sad. We LOVED sugar factory when it was at Paris but it's definitely dropped in standards.   For starters, we made a reservation for 1.45 and they obviously knew nothing about it - the hostess struggled to find us a table and led us to one that was still covered in dishes! We sat down as she cleared this away, came back to ask what name it was under and then wiped down the table. Ok...  Nearly 15 minutes later we got asked if we were ready for drinks. Ordered 3 martinis and our food as well - 2 burgers and the fettuccine. The group next to us asked for their check about this time.   20 minutes later...no drinks. The group next door asked for their check again. We saw several goblets and insane milkshakes being served at the bar but nothing came our way.   Finally, almost 45 minutes after we sat down we got our drinks. Our food came shortly after that and the next door peeps finally got their check after asking for the 3rd time and noticing how long we had been waiting.   I give one star for the food being delicious and the other star for our poor server, who advised one of them has just walked out for no reason and "something's going on in the kitchen, I don't even know what." Poor staff, I felt really sorry for them with such disorganisation going on.

-BfdB0BafmTY19sixLSi-Q.text: So we came here for a bachelorette dinner, and i have to say BEST SERVICE EVER!! Food was great drinks were amazing! First night in Vegas and we are all happy! Come here if you want good food, good ambience, and good drinks! Will becoming back soon!!

jNdJPSUkNaGQrjDvb0FdJQ.text: The food was horrible. $17.00 for a hamburger, Burger King is 100% better. The service was also horrible. It took forever to get the food. Don't waste your money!

CO24xEGTe4-QXffc0WQC0A.text: The goblet drinks looked awesome but I decided to pass on this and get one of the insane milkshakes instead. They're pretty insane! I had the Twinkie Dinkie and it comes complete with a Twinkie garnish. The glass comes covered in chocolate and gum balls, and the chocolate is worth scraping off and eating with the shake. As for the food... I don't really have much to say because it was so average. Definitely check out this place for dessert or a drink when you're ready to spend a lot for a great photo or just an over-the-top indulgence, but I suggest passing on  having a regular meal here. As for the prices... well expect to pay a LOT for what you're getting but check the Yelp or other promo deals.

FSkYBYumxc-H8eOcxSpWHw.text: This place is okay.  A real tourist trap we've been to the one in NYC In the Meatpacking District and I wouldn't say the food here is any better or worse.  The thing that pissed me off about our visit on July 23rd was the fact that when my daughter was proofed because she wanted one of those overpriced, giant drinks the server saw her birthday was the day before.  We were there for lunch and one of those dumb drinks for my daughter.  We were not there to celebrate her birthday and we never indicated that to the server.  At the end of the meal the server comes out with an ice cream and a sparkler in it for my daughters birthday.   I sat there and thought what a nice touch.  Well, when we got the bill I saw it wasn't so nice - we were charged $10 for something we never asked for.  Just be aware of this I'm positive the servers are taught to look at birthdays for any recent ones and pull this stunt.  Just be aware of what's going on.

l12607IE78GmY7_ljedfRA.text: So, this restaurant, like most of Vegas, is incredibly loud, crowded, and expensive... that being said, the staff are very kind, even going so far as to offer our service dog water, and giving her regular refills. Perhaps more importantly in a restaurant review, the food is phenomenal. I highly recommend anything with guacamole in it, but really you can't go wrong here!

sATKnKtWTI7i7SGyXp3OzQ.text: It was all my girl talked about so of course we had to go and I was extremely satisfied with the food and dessert. Recommend anyone with a sweet tooth to go here.

fwhNCkTKAZWRxjCQh2QUyg.text: Rainbow sliders are beautiful to look at however; the meat was a little too dry. Excellent milkshakes!

d0yPsXG_-ZprbGnHih0UuQ.text: I looked very much forward to sampling offerings here, but the visit itself yielded mixed results.    The ambiance was colorful, loud, lively, and bright--until lights were seriously dimmed for the night service. French Onion Soup was only okay, with a minimal amount of cheese and broth that tasted like Lipton's boxed onion soup.  To the contrary, the three meatballs covered with Marinara Sauce were very good as a featured appetizer, and Diane's trio of Fred Macaroni & Cheese Pops were nicely filled with gooey Mac 'n Cheese.  The Tomato Soup that accompanied her Grilled Cheese Sandwich was also creamy and delicious, although the sandwich itself stuck to the bread, was too dry, and the two slices were clumsily and unevenly joined.  While the soups and appetizers came out quickly, there was over a 45-minute wait for our entrees.  My party of three sat and sat while we watched other diners be seated after us, receive all of their food, and leave.  Our server said that our entrees would be coming shortly, but never admitted that a snafu had occurred in the kitchen.  This was very evident when I was presented with a bill for double what we had ordered in salads and Grilled Cheese Sandwiches.  This was promptly corrected by our server, who then acknowledged that our entree orders were rung up twice (for unknown reasons).  At least the Chicken Salad with Ginger Dressing was abundant, moist, and very good; the hand-cut French Fries excellent; and my sip of Diane's Chocolate Cookie Jar Insane Milkshake through a thick green straw, with the taste of caramel coming through the chocolate, simply outstanding.

G0p8Z9Znqf3EAMVtKG94HA.text: This was my first time coming here and it will be my last. This place needs a new manager. The majority of the staff is not properly trained as the service was substandard.  When I called to ask exactly where in the Fashion Show Mall this is at, the lady on the phone was very nonchalant. Additionally, the hostess was worse; didn't even properly greet us.   There was only one server for an entire section and many customers were complaining how long everything took.  Do not order the burgers! The menu says "grass-fed burgers" and they cost $19. But I can tell they were frozen patties and they were dry. Go to Wendy's if you want a juicier burger. Everyone at my table agreed about the dry $19 burgers.  The premier milkshakes are what they are known for. So for $19 each, it is worth the price. However overall for you money, the untrained staff, and also how their air conditioning did not work in the middle of the summer, I will not come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $19 Milkshake with pop rocks and cotton candy.

glo-Yd05hqlKwj-vATkiYQ.text: The kids saw this place on a food show so when we saw it cruising the strip earlier in the day, the begged me to take them.  We decided to go for a late night snack.  I did not realize besides all of the desserts, that they had a full menu too.  So we got a a few items to shack and share along with some crazy and delicious shakes!  Lots of crazy desserts available to share and some wild looking fish bowl drinks too!  We will be back for sure!

Rvhvd5dk061PnYN4SieeSw.text: Not too many vegan options at all.   Came in for a friends birthday and had the Very Berry Fishbowl. It was huge and got all four of us tipsy and didn't have to order any more.   Great location and relatively easy Uber pickup.

GXc9mWCKE-95V8KOLTukfQ.text: Came here on a Friday night with my husband. We were greeted at the entrance and seated right away. I had already searched through the menu since this was one of my must try locations for our vacation. The waiter was friendly and attentive. I had the burger with plantains and my husband the fish and chips the food was good but the drinks were the best part. Would definitely come back because of the drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

K9_WkoYnyC72DN8nIbTw3w.text: I never got the chance to visit the original Sugar Factory Brasserie on the Strip back when it was outside Paris LV. So I was pretty excited when I found out that they re-opened at the Fashion Show Mall. Now I finally have a chance once again to try some of their outrageous menu items. I was actually interested in trying one of their Insane Milkshakes on the menu. In particular, their Bacon Cheeseburger Milkshake. After all, it was National Hamburger Month when I was there. And it was definitely a huuuuuuuuuuge milkshake good enough to be my lunch. Bacon Cheeseburger Milkshake -- bit.ly/2vLk12Q Strawberry Ice Cream drizzled with strawberry sauce and topped with whipped cream, a Mini Cheeseburger, Candy Bacon Strip, in a Chocolate Covered Mug with pretzel pieces and M&Ms. Just to be clear, there's no cheeseburger in the milkshake. As you can see from the pic, the candy bacon strip and mini cheeseburger are both served outside the milkshake and were more like decorations. Still though, just by looking at the pic, it's pretty damn insane! The milkshake was good and I enjoyed the sweet and salty combined flavors when eaten with the mini cheeseburger, candied bacon, and pretzel pieces. This is not something I'd order all the time but if you want shock value, this is one thing you can consider getting. I ended up finishing at about 80 percent of the shake, so I was very satisfied! Sugar Factory at the Fashion Show Mall is definitely a spot you want to check out for some shock value dining and drinking. I would love to come back again to try more things from their menu. Almost everything on the menu has some kind of playful Willy Wonka look to them and would be fun to enjoy either by yourself or with a group.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon Cheeseburger Milkshake.  Insane!

W7cg9d3pQsdmJURF8d-xDw.text: Slightly overpriced, just average food and instagram-able drinks. Maybe ok for a birthday but not a place for every day eats.

3sl2_eRtNI8Ky4yKfiC_4w.text: I have been to this place twice now and I do like the fun candy and absurdly crazy desserts. It is definitely a bit on he pricey side but knowing that you'll be fine if you plan to just spurge. I got the grilled fish tacos (cod) instead of fried and a basket of fries. My guest got wings. I need to go back and order a huge $20 shake and share w a friend lol. Our waiter was cool but since no one is allowed to wear a name tag I don't recall his name. Kind of weird but whatever. The music was a bit too loud for an early lunch could have passed on that it's more of a night time music feel and it was too early lol. The drinks are fun but again pricey @$30 ish. But u can keep the fish bowl or yellow duck or whatever if u want some Vegas souvenirs. It's a novice type of place for tourists but I'll go back when I have visitors come in. Love the Chandeliers but the candy store is a little expansive. My guest was going to get a couple gimbals and 2-3 blow pops-it was $7! That's a bit steep. Lol. Just plan to spend a lot and have fun and like the waiter said "it's for the Gram" (instagram photo ops)

5RaF92tQ_ntRLeCP7B_8Cw.text: Second time here and man was it a whole new restaurant! It was like they read through the problems I recently had and worked on them. We ordered the fish tacos for our appetizer and they were amazing! Really loved the sauce. For our entree we got the farmer and the jalapeno burger and both had so much flavor! So so so good! For dessert we had a fried cookies and cream ice cream and fried Oreos. Very different but a great dessert! Our waiter was impecable, very attentive with not only us but everyone he was helping. Came back after everything we ordered was coming in and made sure it was to our liking. Overall I can't say enough good things about this place. Highly recommend it!

fvzPf3_xoFi0ZqgSImllkw.text: Sugar Factory has a great presentation with their food, but unfortunately their food doesn't taste as good as it looks. Including the drinks as well because they have a very impressive selection of very nice looking drinks, but they are filled with sugar. The drinks were way too sweet for me, but the presentation of it all was beautiful.  Service was nice and quick, and they did not forget about our table. Inside made for a nice, fun atmosphere.

dyIFp1qEnbwCIVC_oqLiIA.text: We went there on a Monday night, so it wasn't crowded. Daughter who we took to Vegas for her 21st birthday and loves everything Kardashian. It lives up to expectations. I had the peanut butter chocolate martini. It was great. Place was very clean and decent music in background. I can see how the Millennials like it, but I'm a little older to go back. Waitstaff was friendly and kept an eye out for the brand. Dont ask to change anything.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MBWkYmeN72iCixaPDEPqFg.text: If it wasn't for the GroupOn offer, we would have never visited this place. With a GroupOn, we got $40 worth of food for $25 as long as we go Mon. To Fri. It's around $4-$5 more for any day (includes Fri-Sun) GroupOn. We arrived in town on Thursday so we had dinner there on our first night.   We got seated right away since, I guess, Mon. To Thurs. is not a busy night. As soon as we were seated, I regret our decision. As a family, we like to look at the menu and talk about our choices but I could barely say a word without screaming because the music was so loud!!!!!! I guess they don't want you to talk to anyone you are with and have a nice conversation over food.  The next regret came when we saw the prices on the menu. With the $40 GroupOn we got one order of $20 rainbow sliders, 5 tiny pieces so it comes out to $4 each where you get two bites each out of it. We also got one order of $19 shake which came with a bonus tiny slider.  I was going to check in to Yelp to get 50 percent off one of the smoking goblet but I was told that I cannot combine it with the GroupOn. Lucky break that I realized later on since I would rather spend my money elsewhere.   The worst part was being seated next to the elevator where all night long scantily dressed women were brought up there by the wait staff. That must be their free ticket to get up there. There's not that much space in between the elevator and our table so it's a bit distracting. The elevator is also close to another room where the wait staff keeps going in and out. This must be how it felt like to be seated next to the restroom.   This place is just hyped up by the Kardashian family and other celebrities. We go to Vegas at least once a year and this is definitely one of those one time visit only.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $20 Rainbow Slider or what we call Pretty Patties. Each tiny one is $4 each. The best part is you get to keep the duckie.
Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is what a $19 milkshake looks like. Definitely shared this.

Ijo0duxNSETW-j78IVrG7A.text: This place has very pretty food, and aesthetically pleasing desserts.  We got a cool deal where it was a BOGO apps. We also got two drinks, and it bubbled. The thing about the goblet drink is that is pretty pricey...It is a nice show, but I think most of the goblet you are paying for is the dry ice that makes it bubble and fog.  The food is good, but they also discontinued the pizza but that was still pictured on the menu.

d_54sRgkCsEZasAa_OxCPQ.text: GOBLETS GALORE!  Can't go wrong with a good drink and a great friends! Food was over priced and service was so so....but it's the strip,

photos.caption: Photo of Sugar Factory - Las Vegas, NV, United States

x0sVa84EMmTxF6Jm-Y75Nw.text: The Sugar Factory! What can I say, this place was dope AF! I've seriously never been anywhere like it. They're known for their specialty shakes and oh-so-sugary cocktails. It says on the wall, it's the "most instagrammed restaurant" and I can see why. First of all, their drinks are absolutely wild!!  Secondly, it has been visited by so many celebs...Kim and Kylie, JLo, Drake, you know, just some B-listers, no big deal.  There are a lot of drinks to choose from, but if you go with a goblet, I recommend the spicy pineapple because the drink itself was really tasty, and the gummies inside are ACTUALLY SPICY!! I actually ended up fishing out all the gummies and asked for a to-go box so that I can continue to enjoy them. Just keepin in real.  Besides sugary drinks and insane smoothies and desserts, they actually have food that you can load up on before the sugar haul. Because we had literally just had dinner when we came here, we tried to go "lite" and ordered to salad. How very healthy of me.  But seriously, this place is worth checking out if you're an instagram whore like me. Oh, and if you happen to get like at least 10 friends to go, I would just order the King Kong....the most epic dessert you will ever eat in your life!!

S3eXdIQT6Qc_bqiqsNMElw.text: So, so sad to write this review.  My husband and I were HUGE fans of the Sugar Factory back when they were at the Paris.  This new location is nice and the decor is fun.    We got the Passion Punch goblet which we got every time prior and this time is was unbelievably sweet with ZERO detectable alcohol.  Bummer because we used to get a little buzz on to start our day on the strip.    Fried Mac and Cheese are no longer triangle squares with breadcrumbs.  Now they are battered in what is like funnel cake batter and then fry them and put them on sticks so they are lollipops.  First, you used to get more... second the thick batter on the outside is just GROSS, third is I found something random and dark brown in one that was questionable.  The side sauce seems to be unchanged and still tasty.    The club sandwich was standard and good - hard to mess up though.   Lastly, our waiter was okay but he was also tending the outside bar.  Problem is I watched him pick his nose/ play with his nose ring MULTIPLE times and then continue touching things. GROSS!  The only reason I ate was because I saw him wash his hands before he brought us our food.    We want to love this location but will not be back.  Hopefully we can get a better experience at one of their other locations.

Rff_T9J57-mIznJtzw_--g.text: So this is my first time here, we got seated, waited and waited to be served..about 20 min of waiting to be served my family and I just walked out.  It's not even close to full and service here is horrible.  No server came by to check up on us after we were seated.  As a local I'm never visiting again with this kind of service.

zRDlsWQMqnw67X2xMlp2bQ.text: So we got seated, and waited for like 10-15 minutes for someone to even ask if anyone has helped us, so ashley said she would get the manager without us even asking for them.Ashley came back and said she would just be our server. Then Ronda came and said she would get us some water even though she walked by us 8 times without saying anything! So she brought us our waters while ashley brought our drinks and Ronda said to ashley I got them waters because this is my section... like really Ronda walked by us 8 times without saying anything and ashley came to help the customer which is the most important part, and then when the expeditor came to bring our food, Ronda came up behind him and said take it back this is not my section... this is so unprofessional and immature. So I would give Ronda 0 stars with Ronda with 4 stars because we never got offered a refill. What was the most aggravating was a party of 8 sat down and immediately were helped and got their drinks before us after they sat down 10-15 minutes after us.

zcvG5s5Nk5lNy0wNkOKvow.text: Just had an amazing omelette at the Sugar Factory here in Las Vegas!  This is my first time eating at the restaurant.  We had excellent service! The atmosphere is amazing.  I will be back afain!

wqKswmX7ZJuxh87-u_6ing.text: We went to the Sugar Factory for drinks and did not expect their food to be really good because usually when a place specializes in one thing the other stuff leaves a lot to be desired. Not so with this place. We ordered their infamous goblet drinks, rainbow sliders, onion rings, and artichoke dip. Everything was so good and the waiter was great. Definitely a must try when out on the strip!

OeAAIu0I8xUbVj3GNtIiZA.text: The goblet we chose to share was Passion Punch!!! Delicious, with enough alcohol for a nice buzz! Stay tuned... we're coming back later for the food and to share more pics!!!

IUTHkcViuL-KA9aWakRJJQ.text: Our server Rhea was amazing one of the best servers I have ever had. We had a fairly large group and she was great with all the orders and checking back in on us in a timely manner. The food and atmosphere was amazing.

H7FKfcXOdDKxMqbEVkq7jQ.text: This place was so much fun. They have amazing cocktails that are unique and delicious. The food was fantastic. We're too full for dessert but those look great, too. We'll be back again with the kids - they'll love it.

XzMippNnE2g2etkC9b3kbA.text: This place is awesome! We got the berry goblet and it wasn't too sweet, it was just right with the perfect amount of alcohol. I recommend my friends to visit this place when they come to Vegas because it is truly memorable and a great time with friends and family.

iVvFs3q1YSd-cBat3VMJYA.text: First time here and it was just magical. Travis, our waiter, was beyond welcoming... he was just so nice and sweet and didn't mind explaining the menu. Thumbs up for the place, travis and the chef helping him today.

8wxyjMiXi55oPfB8nChp4g.text: Great food, cool fun cocktails (too sweet for me), and over the top desserts. It's like an adult Farrell's that I grew up with. Don't miss this place or the Chocolate Lounge upstairs!

MtxAxG8ZzzxfJNnfUkfnSg.text: I initially made reservations for the Sugar Factory and it was way too loud. It was almost like we were at a night club and it was only 6PM! Our server recommended for us to go to the chocolate lounge that is a little more private. The moment we walked in the server/bartender (gay guy with blonde hair) was RUDE AF. He told us and the host that all the tables were reserved and we had to sit outside. Funny he said that, when there was only one table with a reserved sign. FYI--We were seated at one of the tables INSIDE THE CHOCOLATE LOUNGE. Once we were seated, it took awhile for our server to come, to get our beverage order, and the food. The food is not good, at least not for dinner. It's pretty much like diner food with contemporary furniture. The only plus with this restaurant is the view.

QD52Sey0DUq0N2e317OoKg.text: Came for a friends birthday dinner and had a blast! Adrian, our server was very attentive and accommodating to our group-very appreciated! :)

Hjju-gdQnnSixQ5kPXUn3w.text: Absolutely love the vibe of this restaurant!  Hip and fun!  The patio is a fantastic dining experience.  I recommend the Sunshine Tea Goblet to start.  The Rainbow Sliders are yummy and a great appetizer.  I lean towards the Chinese Chicken Salad which is the perfect compliment to the sliders.  Can not wait to return!

GjzzQn0q4ThaZVTSV_ZrSA.text: Came here for breakfasts, we had great service but what made our experience even better was John the manager.Came and cleared our table, refill our waters and he didn't just do this to our table, I seen him go around the restaurant helping out. That's a great manager right there! He's a team player! Very pleasant and attentive! Thanks John!

bMNIYzZGmTzfQjEXGc6IYQ.text: Ate here last night with family. Food and service was great! Thanks to the manager and waitress Reilly for taking good care of us!!!

prqhrI_HYiAHA31OGj1ERA.text: Great drinks and deserts, food is ok, could be better, especially the ribeye.  Service could use some help as well.

M801IVvPj8hPyc8WNJ0qoA.text: AMAZING!! The Sugar Factory cares so much about their customers and what they think. Came back again before I left Las Vegas and was so glad. I was dying to try a goblet, so I got the lollipop passion and it was really neat. Our server was really nice as is all of their staff. Really nice place to stop by and eat. It's also really fun and the experience was memorable. Hope to visit again

x7_0JhF5rj9AiPOTa0yV7Q.text: The service was good and the food was delicious.. Went for brunch and had bottomless mimosas. The waiter kept the drinks coming without us even having to ask. Will make sure to go again next time I am in Vegas!

hNMXFUcxWRZ0vnht8aFHcw.text: My popcorn shrimp was deep fried to perfection. Martini was strong and delicious and the snickers milkshake was decadent. Wonderful meal and an excellent server-- Brittany. She was attentive, helpful, and friendly. This is definitely a restaurant everyone should try out, great food, service and overall atmosphere.

OGPnW7MWYw9IQYA2fWdHUA.text: I had an amazing experience. The food, drinks & dessert were delicious!!! Thoroughly enjoyed the upbeat and fun environment!! Loved it!  "Briana" provided excellent customer service.  We shall return.  Thank you!

G98LXVEwZ6HtfL1RwvK5PA.text: Ariel was awesome! The rainbow sliders were so good! Seat quick and the food came quick.

aHCBAJ5_YL7ZpjN_gjZwmw.text: We got to Vegas from Mississippi and this was the first stop. What a great place! Atmosphere, drinks, service, bartenders (Nell is hilarious), awesome. It's a must see!

VmlAyS0_hVszz4XaiWHDwQ.text: Our waiter Manny was great! He suggested great food and the best drinks. The ambiance was great. I didn't think this was would be a family friendly restaurant, but it was. We had Gummi Goblet and the Rainbow Burgers. My sister had the Buffalo Burger, but it was a bit on the spicy side. We wanted to try dessert, but everyone was too full.

PBFVBnnG2Heoaod4XIxvPA.text: I was warned by my family about the slow Service and they were correct. We had to cancel the desert We ordered because it was taking too  long. Their gobblet drinks are over sensationalized. I would not return.

UshMlz9jO-QDltoNNyrkZQ.text: Celebrated my 21st birthday last week and decided  to have dinner at The Sugar Factory. This is my second time there and it was by far a great dinning experience. The first time I visited The Sugar Factory was when it used to be at The Paris Hotel and it wasn't so great. We got sat way in the back where it was pretty dark, customer service wasn't the best and overall the food wasn't it either.   Decided to give it a second shot and I'm glad I did because right from the beginning the hostess greeted us & was super friendly. We talked for a bit while the rest of my party arrived and got seated right away. Our server that night was Jake ( I believe that was his name) and he was amazing! He would check in with us to see if we needed anything and he also let us know when & how long our food would arrive to our table. He was very friendly & attentive.   Overall, the service & food was phenomenal!  Thank you to the staff at The Sugar Factory for making my 21st birthday memorable; definitely will be coming back. Also the goblet drinks are a must because not only are the delicious  but  the presentation of it is so cool!

aT3nq3bLNrpK9bMM4iH0_A.text: Terrible service!! We were celebrating a birthday on an early evening, a slow night we waited over 45 minutes for our cocktails and they weren't the ones we ordered. Our server said she would take care of our drinks and she didn't. We had a coupon and our server never added it to our check... management could have stepped in to make the situation better

DsUU4XzrFx4wXsadx2s_GQ.text: I am a local.  In our paper last week this location was showcased.  I was very excited to go and have their ice cream cone which is surrounded by cotton candy.. It is a Sunday at 11:45 a.m . There ice cream showcase is empty, 100% and the Gelato is 3/4 empty and what WAS in this case looked like it had been eaten and put back, very messy and unappetizing.. I asked if this was the only ice cream they had, and I was told yes..Very disappointed.  I will not make the trek back to the strip for this..

4QfmugeVpOUJ0P0ZzSWkew.text: I just experienced the worst customer service ever today. First of all it was my birthday, I made a reservation for a table of 15!!!! ( expecting my table to be ready and set up ) which it was not , I arrived at my reservation time which was 7pm and no one helped us at first ?? Second they didn't have our table set up ??? our waiter was completely rude he seemed like he really didn't care what we had to say or ask, so as the night went on I thought it was get a little better one of my friends ordered a steak  medium rare ( came out almost well done) , so she asked the waiter about the steak and about getting a new one and this was his response ( I work at a steakhouse for my second job I know what medium rare is ) which in a professional restaurant like that you should always make the customer HAPPY no matter what !!!! never came around !! Asking how was everything , no refills nothing only until everyone saw us getting annoyed!!! When I called and made a reservation I said " everyone will be splitting checks " and when it was time for the bill they didn't even bring the bill out !?!? Until like 25 mins plus !!! And they bill wasn't split up !!!! MY MOM SPLIT UP THE BILL HERSELF using her phone calculator !! Between 15 people !!! And not once did anyone come up to us and say if we needed help or anything or how we could figure it out !!! Nothing JUST RUDE RUDE RUDE DUMB PEOPLE AND IM FROM VEGAS AND OUT OF ALL PLACES THE STRIP HAD THE WORSE SERVICE !! Get outta here bad location

5yTO9bBSqdSiI9qcmz8HDQ.text: I was so excited to try this place! The atmosphere is great, however the service was horrible Upon arriving, we waited for about 5 minutes to be seated, there was not a line! This was because the staff was to busy visiting with each other before they noticed we were standing there waiting to be seated. Ordered lunch and drinks... my boyfriend had to ask 3 different waiters for his diet coke before it finally arrived at the table before I was almost done eating my very wilted salad. I would only recommend coming to purchase the candy, for the food and service was horrible!! Also when I ordered one of their signature drinks, it came and wasn't what I was expecting, more disappointment! Thanks for letting me down sugar factory! Your place was on my list of things to do in Vegas, and it was a complete letdown!! :(
